They are on their third collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, with the aim of boosting business activities and revenue. The group members, such as Mariam Konaté, sell cereals, clothes, fruit and vegetables, condiments and tubers such as yams. She aims to use her loan to purchase thirty 50kg bags of yams; her goods are sourced from the Loulouni market and from the neighbouring villages. The yams are sold for cash at the Loulouni market to a male and female customer base. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA - a proportion of this will be saved for social ends and the rest re-invested in the business.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchasing yams

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo NUEVO AMANECER esta conformado por 2 socias que se garantizan entre ellas, son personas responsables y dinamicas, está integrada por: 

La Sra. Maria esta casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, la primera se dedica a la venta D. productos en su tienda D. barrio, ella tiene el esposo que es mecánico y además tiene un transporte que lo trabaja por las noches, con el dinero del  credito comprara mercaderia para surtir su tienda.

La Sra. Justina esta casada y tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, venD. comida en el mercado D. Irpavi, y el esposo tiene una pequeña imprenta en su domicilio, con el dinero dle credito comprara insumos e ingredientes para la elaboracion D. sus comidas. 

Ellas viven por la zona D. Chasquipampa, es un grupo muy bueno en el anterior crédito se encontraba la sra. delfina quien falleció por lo que el grupo quedó D. dos personas, tienen un historial muy bueno y muchos años como clientes D. Empender, es un grupo antiguo ya trabajo varias secuencias con la institucion, ambas tienen sus hogares establecidos y son parejas relativamente jóvenes. Estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) Group is maD. up of 2 women who depend upon one another; they are responsible and dynamic people. Mrs. Maria is married and has 2 young children. She works in sales at her neighborhood shop. Her husband is a mechanic and also works in transportation at night. With the loan money, she will buy merchandise to stock her store. Mrs. Justina is married and has 2 children who are in school. She sells food at the Irpavi Market. Her husband has a small print-shop in their home. With the loan money, she will buy supplies and ingredients for the food she prepares.

They live in the district of Chasquipampa. Their group is very good. During the previous loan cycle, Mrs. Delfina passed away, and now the group has two remaining members. They have had an excellent history as clients of Emprender for many years. It is an old group that has already had several loans with the institution. They both have stable homes and are relatively young couples. They are thankful for Emprender and Kiva for trusting them with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Digna Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Digna Rosa P. M., es casada de 32 años y con sus dos hijos, estudiantes de la escuela primaria y preescolar, habitan en Esquípalas, ella labora como domestica en una casa privada, son una familia muy humilde, que con su trabajo han logrado levantar la casita en donde actualmente habitan.

Dentro de sus limitaciones económicas, solicitan un préstamo para la continuación de este proyecto de vida que les ayudara a habitar en un lugar digno y seguro para sus hijos,  es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la  compra  de materiales de construcción y avanzar en gran medida con las remodelaciones de su hogar, sobre todo en la construccion de un muro lateral, que divida su terreno de los del vecino para evitar problemas de pocesion de propiedad a futuro, asi mismo una mayor seguridad debido a la delincuencia que se da en estos dias, ellos agradecerán el apoyo que se les brinde debido a las limitadas oportunidades de financiamiento, que han tenido de parte de los bancos y otras financieras, por ser una familia muy humilde.
texts.en:
Sra. Digna Rosa P. M. is 32 years old, married, and has two children. One is an elementary school student, while the other attends preschool. She lives in Esquípalas and works as a housekeeper for a private residence. Even though her family lives modestly, Digna was able to build the small house where her family currently lives.

Due to financial constraints, she is requesting a loan so that she can continue one of her projects that will help her live in a decent place and provide a safe environment for her children. Digna plans to purchase building materials so that she continue the renovations to her house, specifically the construction of a side wall between herself and her neighbor to avoid future problems regarding property boundaries. The wall will also provide greater security from the crime that has occurred in recent days.

Since they are of modest means, Digna and her family are grateful for the support that has been provided due to the limited funding opportunities available from banks and other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a side wall

loans.name: Germán

texts.es:
Germán tiene   31 años de edad,  está casado con Vilma, tienen tres hijos de los cuales uno está en la escuela,la familia viven en casa propia.
Desde  muy  joven  se dedicó a trabajar arduamente  para  poder  llevar  un mejor  nivel  de  vida, se inició como  vendedor ambulante en una empresa con un tío de quien aprendió la profesión. En ese  periodo conoció a su compañera actual, fueron  progresando  de a poco  hasta que llegaron a   a  reunir capital suficiente para formar  su  propia  microempresa.
Hoy  día  trabaja en grande y  le da trabajo a sus dos hermanos, es  muy  luchador y  sueña  con  que sus  hijos  sean  personas de  bien  y lleguen a  ser alguien en la vida.
Solicita el préstamo para aumentar la variedad de productos de su pequeña empresa, como sería la compra de edredones, sabanas,golosinas, llaveros, cigarrillos, al por mayor para su venta al detalle, de modo a incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Germán is 31 years old, married to his wife Vilma, and has three children of whom one is in school. The family lives in their own home.

From a young age, Germán has worked hard so that he could have a better standard of living. He began working for his uncle’s business as a traveling merchant so that he could learn the profession. During this time, Germán met his wife and together they made gradual progress until they were able acquire sufficient capital to start their own micro-enterprise.

Today his business is larger and he provides employment to his two brothers. Germán is a hard worker who hopes that his children will develop into good people and make something out of their lives. He is requesting a loan to increase the variety of products offered by his small business. Germán plans to purchase bedspreads, bed sheets, candy, key chains, and cigarettes in bulk so that he can sell these items retail and increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bedspreads, bed sheets, candy, key chains, and cigarettes

loans.name: United Business People Group

texts.en:
Marila T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Business People.  She is 33 years old, single, and has two children who are 8 and 11 years old.  Marila was only able to attend school through the 7th grade, and could not continue due to lack of financial support.

For over 9 years, Marila has been selling wood that can be used for cooking and baking; she buys at wholesale and sells at retail. Her business is located in west point in the Waterside market down town Monrovia, Liberia. She started her business with the help of her husband. She faces a lot of problems to get wood during the dry season in Liberia. Customers are attracted to her business because she sells good wood products. Her dream is for her business to develop and to improve the livelihood for her children. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of the 30,000 group loan amount to purchase more wood products to increase her sales.

The photo that accompanies this profile, Marila is the one holding the sign. And John F. is inset at lower right.

loans.use: To purchase more wood products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Celeste Group

texts.es:
El grupo Celeste está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, unidas y con ingenio las cuales se dedican a la costura. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Luz Marina M. R.  quien en 1995 instalo un pequeño taller de costura donde realiza vestidos, cotonas, pantalones y bordados entre otros.
Ella se ha ganado el respeto, admiración y confianza de sus compañeras de grupo especialmente de la señora María del Carmen S.  R. quien señalo estar muy agradecida con M. por haberle enseñado este oficio, impulsarla y ayudarle.
La otra socia es la joven Gilma Antonia Velázquez  de 23 años quien también se dedica a la realización de vestidos.
texts.en:
The Celeste Group consists of three hardworking, united, and ingenious women who engage in sewing. The group coordinator is Sra. Luz Marina M., who opened in 1995 a small sewing workshop where she makes dresses, cotton shirts, trousers, and embroideries among other items. She has earned the respect, admiration, and trust of her fellow group members.

One of them is Sra. María del Carmen S. R., who learned the business from Sra. Luz Marina. María is grateful to Luz Marina for teaching, encouraging, and helping her. The other member of the group is Gilma Antonia Velázquez, a young woman who is 23 years of age and also makes dresses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Benkelema est constitué de six femmes toutes mariées,  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans,  4 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames  à Loulouni une sous préfecture de la région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’accroitre leur chiffre d’affaire et leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femme mène  diverses  activités telles la vente de céréales de tissus, de charbon de bois et la vente d’atieké (aliment à base de manioc)  avec Awa Traoré, qui est très sollicitée et appréciée.
Awa Traoré comptent acheter avec son  prêt 30  chargements de charrettes en manioc qui sera transformé en atiéké. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Loulouni et dans les villages  voisins. 
L’atieké est vendu en détail   et en gros au marché de Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Awa envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour  survenir au payement de la scolarité des enfants  ainsi que les frais de nourriture de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Benkelema is composed of six women, all of whom are married with four children, are an average age of 40, and generally live in polygamous families in Loulouni, a sub-prefecture of the Sikasso region - the third largest administrative region in Mali. They are on their seventh collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organisation, with the aim of boosting their business revenues and increasing their customer base. The group members, such as the highly sought-after Awa Traoré, sell cereals and fabric, firewood and atieké (a manioc-based food). Awa Traoré aims to use her loan to buy 30 cartloads of manioc, which will be processed to atieké; she sources her goods from the Loulouni market and from the neighbouring villages. The atieké is sold retail and wholesale for cash at the Loulouni market, to a male and female customer base. Awa envisages generating an average monthly profit of 18, 000 FCFA - a portion of this will be saved to pay for her children's education and the family's food, and the rest will be re-invested in business activities.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manioc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics products.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Nagujja Harriet runs a nine-year-old retail business in Kayunga. With it, this diligently hard working, widowed, 50-year-old mother of three kids has managed to elevate her family’s welfare. Ever since she began, she has been making profits of 220,000 shillings a month.

Harriet’s dream is to expand her business to a wholesale franchise, specifically a supermarket. The first step to her achieving this, she says, is to obtain this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more retail stock like sugar, flakes, salt, boxes of milk and cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing beverages [for resale]

loans.name: Las Favoritas Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Cascada, se reúne la Asociación Comunal LAS FAVORITAS, con 8 integrantes 
Una de las integrantes es Modesta T., de 26 años  tiene el negocio de venta de comida, específicamente fideo revuelto en maní, cuenta que el préstamo le ayuda de gran manera ya que antes compraba sus insumos por menor cantidad y ahora puede comprar al por mayor y así minimizar sus costos, tiene su puesto de venta frente al Hospital Corea, le ayudan en el negocio sus dos hermanos. 
Las demás integrantes de éste grupo necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Las Favoritas” (The Favorites) meets at one of the Community Centers of Pro Mujer Cascada. The group has eight members. One of them is Modesta T., who is 26 years old and sells food. Her specialty is noodles cooked with peanuts. The loan will be of great help to her because she can now buy supplies in bulk and minimize her costs. She operates a vending post in front of the Hospital Corea and her two brothers help her with the business.

The other members of this group need loans to acquire merchandise, supplies, and materials according to their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies in bulk for preparing food

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Juana del Carmen O. G., tiene la edad de 37 años es casada, madre de 3 hijos, menores de edad y totalmente dependientes económicamente de la cabeza familiar, la familia habita en el barrio Pablo Calero, y  son agricultores desde hace 21 años.

Dentro de los principales planes para los cultivos, está el restablecimiento de nuevas aéreas de plantillos de piña, en los últimos meses las plagas han afectado la producción, y es por esta razón que ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, vegetativos, y sobretodo fertilizantes que provean a las tierras mejores condiciones para la producción de una mejor cosecha, este apoyo que se le brinde a la señora O. le favorecerá a largo plazo en su economía doméstica para la inversión de nuevos proyectos de vida o para con su negocio, que directamente mejoren la calidad de vida de la familia. Este no es el primer préstamo de la señora Juana, ella tras los otros créditos, que ha tenido buenos resultados y mejorado sus finanzas, ella se siente capaz de inyectarle un mayor capital de trabajo, debido a que la demanda ha crecido en los últimos meses y ella espera suplir esta demanda, que le traerá un aumento en las ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana del Carmen O. G. is 37 years old, married, and has three young children who are financially dependent on her role as a head of household. Her family lives in the neighborhood of Pablo Calero and has been farming for 21 years.

Among the main plans for Juana’s farm is to reestablish a new crop of pineapples because pests have impacted her production in recent months. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can purchase farming supplies, seedlings, and especially fertilizers so that her land will be in better condition to produce a good harvest. This support will help Juana in the long term because she can devote her household finances to other projects that will help improve the quality of life for her family.

This is not the first time Juana has received a loan. Her previous loans have brought about good results and improvement to her finances. She is able to inject more capital back into her business because demand has picked up in recent months. Juana hopes to be able to meet this demand and experience an increase in her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies, seedlings, and fertilizers

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is a widow with five children and her children go to school. She owns a four roomed house where she stays with eight people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Robinah takes care of additional family members.  The family gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication. Robinah owns a stall where she sells sweet and Irish potatoes and works in Nakawa Market and receives at least 25 customers a day and her customers are mainly from other markets.  Besides this food business, she also does some tailoring work when need arises. Robinah has been in this business for 20 years and her business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  Robinah has been with MCDT for five years, servicing her 13th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sweet and Irish potatoes. She is aspiringof seeing  her business grow bigger and  own a delivery van Robinah decided to work with MCDT because she wanted laons but her no colateral  security

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Fusana

texts.en:
Fusana I. has gained education up to senior high level. She is married with three children. Fusana sells provisions at Abura. Her husband works with a sachet water company where he is a distributor.  

Fusana uses her revenue she generates from her sales to help her husband take care of the home. Fusana will use the loan to purchase more provisions to resell. With the new profits from her extended business, Fusana plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase more provisions to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO D. EMPRENDIMIENTO LAS TRABAJADORAS ESTA CONFORMADO POR 8 SOCIAS 6 MUJERES Y 2 VARONES, SE CONOCEN Y SE GARANTIZAN ENTRE ELLOS, LA MESA DIRECTIVA ESTA FORMADO POR:

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SRA. SHIRLEY ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, VIVE EN UNA CASA EN ANTICRETICO TIENE UNA TIENDA D. BARRIO CERCA AL CEMENTERIO D. SACABA ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA ES MUY BUENA LIDER EN EL GRUPO, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE PUBLICO ES CHOFER ASALARIADO, LOS DOS TRABAJAN DURO PARA SACAR A SU FAMILIA ADELANTE, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA D. BARRIO Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO. 

LA SECRETARIA ES LA SRA. SOLEDAD VIVE CON SU TIA A UNA CUADRA DEL CEMENTERIO, ES VENDEDORA AMBULANTE D. JUGUETES CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD MANTIENE SU HOGAR YA QUE ES SUS UNICA FUENTE D. TRABAJO CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA JUGUETES AL POR MAYOR D. LOS MAS VENDIDOS Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO.

ESTE GRUPO D. 8 PERSONAS CADA UNA D. ELLAS TIENEN UNA ACTIVIDAD INDEPENDIENTE, TIENEN VARIOS AÑOS VIVIENDO EN SACABA , SE CONOCEN BASTANTE BIEN ENTRE ELLAS  EXISTE LA PARTICIPACIÓN D. 2 VARONES D. IGUAL MANERA SON MUY CONOCIDOS CON SU RESPECTIVA ACTIVIDAD, TODOS LOS SOCIOS ESTAN AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The Hard-Working Entrepreneurs village bank is maD. up of 8 members, 6 women and 2 men, they know each other well and guarantee eah other's loans. The board of directors is maD. up of: Shirley, the president, is married with two small children. She lives in Anticretico where she runs a small neighborhood store close to the Sacaba cemetery. She is very responsible and hard-working and a great group leader. Her husband works in public transportation as a salaried driver. The two work hard to help their family progress; with the money from the loan, they will buy merchandise to stock their store and increase their working capital. The group secretary is Soledad who lives with her aunt one block from the cemetery. She sells toys around the town in order to support her family; hers is the only source of income. She will use the loan to buy the most popular toys wholesale to increase her working capital. Each of these 8 people has their own business and have lived in Sacaba for years. They know each other very well and the 2 men in the group are also very well-known and well thought of in their businesses. All the members are grateful to Emnprender and Kiva for the support they are receiving through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: María Dominga

texts.es:
La señora María Dominga C. L., es madre soltera de 46 años,  sus dos hijos son mayores de edad y viven de forma independiente, pero le apoyan económicamente y en los trabajos de la finca, debido a que ella es cultivadora de piña desde hace 16 años.

Dentro de sus planes de vida está el establecimiento de un puesto de venta de frutas y realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda, pero la afectación de plagas y enfermedades de las tierras, han robado este sueño debido a que la producción se ha disminuido,  provocando pérdidas económicas, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de  materiales agrícolas, tales como fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos, con el propósito de realizar un mantenimiento a las tierras y tras esto una mejor cosecha, que garantice la recuperación de la inversión y   la ambición a futuro de llevar a cabo sus planes de remodelación y establecimiento de una nueva fuente de trabajo, esto favorecerá a toda la familia, pero sobretodo a la señora Dominga debido a que ella es una mujer sola que no tiene el apoyo de una pareja, pero su trabajo le ocupa su mente y la llena de propositos a futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. María Dominga C. L. is a 46 year old single mother. She has two adult children who live independently, but they help her financially by assisting her with the work around the farm. María has been growing pineapples for 16 years.

Among the plans María has for her life are to open a fruit stand and make a few improvements to her home. However, pests and diseases have impacted her farmland. Her plans have been put on hold because production has decreased, causing her to suffer financial losses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers and seedlings so that she can maintain her land and achieve a better harvest. María hopes the loan will guarantee the recovery of her investment, provide for her future plans of remodeling her house, and establish a new source of work. This should encourage the entire family, especially María because she is a single woman who does not have the support of a partner. Therefore, her work occupies her mind and provides her future with purpose.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & other farming supplies

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es:
María Inés tiene 58 años, casada y madre de nueve hijos de los cuales ocho son casados, vive con uno de sus hijos casados, el soltero y cuatro nietos porque su madre trabaja en la ciudad de Cuenca y su esposo que se dedica al cultivo de la tierra aportando todos con los gastos del hogar, viven en la casa de la hacienda que cuidan porque aún no cuentan con su casa propia.



 Es socia del banco comunal  Vegaspamba hace seis ciclos y se encuentra muy contenta con los créditos ya que le benefician para mejorar la economía de su hogar. Este banco está ubicado en la parroquia Jadan, los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican principalmente  a la agricultura y  ganadería, cultivos de  maíz, fréjol, trigo y arveja; dentro de las artesanías  se destacan el tejido de  chompas de lana de oveja, así como también a  la elaboración de  sogas y soguillas de cabuya,  el tejido de macanas(pañoletas),  ponchos, frazadas confeccionados con hilo de lana utilizando los  telares, actividad que sobresale en el sector San Juan    Pamba. Una buena parte de los varones trabajan en  la construcción en Cuenca.

Nuestra socia cuida una hacienda hace seis años, aprovecha para criar cuyes, pollos, cerdos tanto para el consumo de su hogar como para la venta a sus vecinos de la comunidad, con el credito que recibirá comprará cuyes para iniciar un nuevo negocioy también alimento y vitaminas  para sus pollos y cerdos.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María Inés is 58 years old, married, and the mother of nine children of whom eight are married. She lives with one of her married children and takes care of four of her grandchildren because their mother works in the city of Cuenca and her husband is busy farming their land in order to provide for all of the household expenses. They live in a house located on an estate because they do not have a house of their own.

María Inés has been a member of the Vegaspamba Communal Bank for six loan cycles and is very happy with the loans because they have helped improve her financial situation. The Communal Bank is located in the parish of Jadan, where the residents engage primarily in livestock breeding and agriculture, specifically growing corn, beans, wheat, and peas. They also engage in handicrafts making wool sweaters, sisal rope and cords, woven scarves, ponchos, and wool blankets. Most of these items are sold in the San Juan Pamba sector. Many of the men work in Cuenca in the construction business.

María Inés has lived on an estate for six years. She raises guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs for both home consumption and to sell to her neighbors in the community. The loan she will receive will be used to buy guinea pigs for her new business. She will also buy feed and vitamins for her chickens and pigs.

Her greatest wish is to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs & feed and vitamins for her chickens and pigs

loans.name: Mario José

texts.es:
El señor Mario José C. V., es casado y con un hijo, él señor C. tiene la edad de 28 años, y radica en el barrio de la borgoña, su esposa es secretaria, y le aporta a los gastos del hogar, ellos son agricultores desde hace 12 años.

Dentro de las necesidades que los agobian como pareja, está la remodelación de su vivienda, que amenaza con la seguridad de la familia y la salud de los mismos, ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra  de fertilizantes y fungicidas que le brinden un mantenimiento óptimo a las tierras y garanticen una buena cosecha, a fin de alcanzar un aumento en las utilidades y con esto la posibilidad de realizar las remodelaciones a su hogar  en bien de su pequeño hijo. Este es su tercer préstamo gracias a los fondos Kiva, ha sido gracias a estos préstamo que ha invertido en su cosecha, pero la buena administración del dinero le ha brindado la posibilidad de realizar pequeñas mejoras a su vivienda, a futuro espera tener los recursos necesarios para terminar con las remodelaciones a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Mario José C. V. is 28 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in the neighborhood of Borgoña. His wife works as a secretary and helps with the household expenses. They both have been farming for 12 years.

One of the pressing needs for this couple is the renovation of their home because its current condition threatens the safety of their family and their own health. Mario is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and fungicides so that he can maintain his land to ensure optimal conditions for a good harvest. This will allow him to increase his earnings so that he can proceed with the repairs to his home for the sake of his young child. Thanks to the funds from Kiva, Mario will be receiving his third loan. He is appreciative of this investment in his crops and good money management will help make small improvements to his house possible. In the future, he hopes to have all the necessary resources to finish the renovations to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & fungicides

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor  Roberto Antonio R. U., vive con su esposa en el Barrio Medardo Andino,  ellos tienen 4 hijos que están casados, la familia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años y fue gracias a su esfuerzo propio que comenzaron sus días en este rubro.

Uno de los problemas que más los aflige,  es el robo de la producción que afecta sus ganancias, dentro de los planes que tiene para la producción está la introducción de nuevos cultivos, que se consuman en masa, antes de llevar acabo esto, solicitan préstamo para la compra de materiales agricolas, tales como fertilizantes, insumos vegetativos y semillas, con esto esperan que la producción se les multiplique, y de la misma manera las utilidades para la reinversión ya sea en su negocio o en proyectos personales y familiares que favorezcan al mejoramiento económico-social de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Roberto Antonio R. U. lives with his wife in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. They have four children who are married. The family has been in farming for the past 12 years; they started out in this line of work thanks to their own efforts. One of the problems that most distresses them is the loss of some of their production to theft; this affects their earnings. Among their plans for the future is introducing new crops that are mass consumed. Prior to doing this, however, they need funds to buy farm supplies like: fertilizers, seed and other supplies that they hope will increase their crop yields and their profits to be reinvested either into the business or to cover personal and family expenses that will improve the entire family’s socio-economic standing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou B. est une dame de 48 ans qui habite a Nimzath Guediawaye et qui est membre de l’U-IMCEC  a  la caisse de Baye Laye depuis 2002. Elle a déjà rembourse 6 prêts  antérieurs. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 4 et 30 ans. Madame B. a commence à pratiquer l’activité  de couture depuis 1978. En cette période elle  faisait  des prestations de service et travaillait chez elle. Elle a choisi personnellement cette activité par amour. Ses plus grandes recettes sont enregistrées  pendant les périodes  de fêté (tabaski, Korite, Fin d’année). Elle sollicite un crédit d 200 000 frs dans le but de réfectionner  son atelier et dresser une clôture  pour la devanture  de l’atelier de couture.  C’est le crédit qui lui permet d’acquérir  des machines pour améliorer  la rentabilité de  son activité, et aussi d’améliorer  la visibilité de son salon de  couture pour être  mieux connue.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou B. is a 48-year old woman who lives in Nimzath Guediawaye, and she has been a member of the U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) savings bank in Baye Laye since 2002. She has already repaid six previous loans. She is married and mother to seven children, whose ages vary from four to 30 years old. Mrs. B. began a sewing activity in 1978. She has provided a service and worked at home since then. She chose this activity personally because she liked it. Her largest revenues are recorded during holiday periods (Tabaski or the sheep festival; Korite, which celebrates the end of Ramadan; and the end of the year). She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs with the aim of rebuilding her workshop and putting up a closure for the facade of the sewing workshop. The loan will allow her to acquire machines to improve the profitability of her activity and also to improve the visibility of her salon so that she can become better known .

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rebuilding of workshop

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 41 años, es una mujer emprendedora, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que le dejaron sus padres. Durante los días de la semana trabaja de enfermera, en un policlínico que se encuentra a una hora de su casa y los fines de semana, realiza trabajos pesados, como cargar y transportar los materiales de construcción hacia el lugar donde esta la obra. Disfruta mucho este último trabajo, debido a que ayudaba a sus padres desde su infancia. Hoy, termina muy cansada pero satisfecha a la vez, es por ello que sus albañiles le tienen respeto a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo  es vivir de las rentas de sus habitaciones, por ello espera en adelante continuar trabajando e invertir, para cuando sus hijos estudien, puedan contar con lo necesario. Este es su quinceavo  crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos como hasta ahora, ya que no le gusta tener deudas. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar piedra chancada y demás materiales de construcción,  para el vaciado de la viga de su casa.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 41 years and is a very enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in the house that her parents left them. On weekdays she works as a nurse at a polyclinic that is located an hour from her home, and on weekends she does manual labor such as loading and transporting construction materials to the site where she is building a house. She really enjoys the latter work, since she helped her parents with that sort of work from the time she was a child. Right now she is finishing up the work, and feeling both very tired and satisfied, and that is why the masons have respect for her work. Her greatest desire is to live off the income from the rooms she rents out. She hopes to continue working and investing in the future so that when her children are in school they can have everything they need. This is Yolanda’s fifteenth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments—as she already has been, since she doesn’t like to have liabilities. She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase crushed stone and other materials for installing girders so that she can finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials to finish building her home.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguari se reunieron unas mujeres con el objetivo de  aumentar su capital de trabajo y otras para emprender alguna actividad productiva.

El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Aty, cuyos objetivos es trabajar en grupo, mejorar la actividad que las mismas actualmente realizan, actualmente se encuentran en el quinto ciclo integrada por 22  mujeres, quienes trabajan a diario para brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. 
Cada integrante realiza una actividad para generar su ingreso individual, una de ellas es la señora Balvina quien es peluquera y tiene instalada su peluquería en su domicilio.
Ella dedica un tiempo parcial a su casa y el resto de su tiempo a la atención de su negocio. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la peluquería, en la compra de elementos de trabajo como sillones para peluqueria, secadoras y otros.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguari some women got together with the aim of increasing their working capital and carrying out other productive activities. The group is called by the name Kuña Aty, and among their goals is to work as a group to improve the economic activities that each of the members currently performs. The group is now in its fifth loan cycle. The group is made up of 22 women who work every day to provide more for their respective families. Each member carries out an activity that allows her to generate her own income. One of the members is Balbina, who is a hairdresser and has installed a hair salon in her home. Balbina spends some of the time taking care of her home, and spends the rest of her time tending to her business. She is asking for a loan so that she can invest in her business by purchasing items such as armchairs, hair dryers, and other items for her hair salon

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing meat products, dairy products, canned foods, items for a clothing store, items for a bookstore, and wholesale goods.

loans.name: Luis Diego

texts.es:
Luis Diego C. F., tiene la edad de 35 años, está casado, y tiene 4 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 12,10,10 y 4 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado (terneros), la idea es comprar terneros para engordarlos. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Luis Diego trabaja desde hace varios años con el ganado y está muy motiva porque con esto va a poder aumentar el número de animales que posee, al mismo tiempo que mejorará su calidad. El cuenta con un área de potrero donde se desarrollan los animales. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Luis Diego C. F. is 35 years old, married, and has four children who are his top priority. Their ages are 12, 10, 10, and 4. His loan will be used to buy cattle (calves) for fattening. Luis Diego wants to maintain them properly so that he can get the best price when it comes time to sell them. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services that have been provided.

Don Luis Diego has been raising cattle for several years and is highly motivated because this loan will help him increase the numbers in his herd and also improve the quality of the animals. He owns land where they will be able to develop. Luis Diego hopes in the future to provide his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He also wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Chorro Para Arriba Group

texts.es:
El grupo Chorro para Arriba está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ello es la señora Alejandra Cristiana García quien desde hace cuatro años se  dedica a la realización de bolis y gelatinas. Este producto lo realiza y distribuye a distintos puntos de Masaya  junto con sus tres hijos. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de componentes que ocupan día a día para la producción estos son gelatina, acido, saborizante y azúcar.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Miriam del Socorro R. de 52 años quien vende café, pan y golosinas en la zona Franca, Juana Z. quien es tortillera desde hace 17 años y Sonia G. Bario vende comida, refrescos, gaseosas y helados.
texts.en:
The group “Chorro para Arriba” (Stream Upward) consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Sra. Alejandra Cristiana García who has been making popsicles and gelatins for four years. She and her three children distribute her products to different areas in Masaya. Alejandra will use her loan to buy all the necessary components she uses every day to make her products such as gelatin, acid, flavoring, and sugar.

Her fellow group members are Miriam del Socorro R. (age 52) who sells coffee, bread, and candy in the free trade zone; Juana Z. who has been making tortillas for 17 years; and Sonia G. Bario who sells food, refreshments, sodas, and ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making popsicles & gelatins

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi M. sells slippers at Abura. Esi has received senior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a welder. She helps her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for her family. Her loan will be used to buy more slippers for sale. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: buy more slippers for sale

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es casada, tiene 33 años, se dedica al comercio (Despensa)y a la cría de cerdos, su marido trabaja como vendedor ambulante; tienen 3 hijos menores quienes dependen económicamente de ellos, pues están en edad escolar.
Ella es muy emprendedora e independiente, habilitó su negocio propio hace 10 años para aumentar su ingreso y brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia, aunque cuenta con el apoyo de su marido, ella trata de resolver los inconvenientes que surgen en el ámbito de su trabajo.
Actualmente exixte una buena demanda de carne porcina por lo que quiere invertir en la compra de cerdo y alimento para los mismo para trabajar también con este rubro que tiene buena perspectiva.
Ademas necesita construir una buena porqueriza de manera a que no interfiera en las otras actividades que ella tiene y el de manera el trabajo solo se trate de dar comida a los animales, ella tiene mucho deseos de prograsar por ello quiere invertir en esta actividad.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old, married, manages a food pantry, and raises pigs. Her husband works as a traveling merchant. They have three young children who attend school and are financially dependent on them.

María is an enterprising and independent woman who started her own business ten years ago so that she could increase her income and provide her family with a better standard of living. She has the support of her husband and always tries to resolve any complications that arise in her field of work.

There is currently a good demand for pork, so María wants to buy pigs and feed for her animals. Working in this field gives her a good perspective. She also needs to build a solid pig sty so that the animals do not interfere with her other activities. This will enable her to work by herself when it comes time to feed the pigs. María wants to invest in this activity because she has a great desire to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs & animal feed

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever  tiene   25 años de edad,  es soltero, vive con su padre quien está a su cuidado.
Desde  muy  joven  se dedicó a trabajar  como empleado en una empresa que se dedica a la reparación de celulares que pertenecía a un familiar y  quién aprendió la profesión.
Hace cinco años habilitó su propia empresa en el centro de la ciudad,   que se dedica a la venta, reparación, recarga de saldos para celulares.
Hoy en dia cuenta con clientela formada y trabaja con él una hermana a quién le paga sus estudios universitarios por los servicios prestados.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas y celulares ya sean nuevos o en desuso para su posterior reparación y re-venta. Y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ever is 25 years old, single, and lives with his father who is in his care. As a young man, he decided to work for a relative’s business that is dedicated to repairing mobile phones so that he could learn the profession. Five years ago, he started his own business in the central part of the city where he sells, repairs, and provides minutes for mobile phones. Today he has an established clientele and works with a sister who he pays so that she can attend university.

Ever is requesting a loan to buy tools, as well as new and used phones for repair and re-sale. He hopes this will increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools & mobile phones for re-sale

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza R. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia, es viuda y tiene a su responsabilidad a su hijo.
Le está haciendo falta más variedad de producto y desea poner juguetes y artículos para bebe, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así poder comprar la mercancía para que su negocio tenga más inventario.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que también recibe un ingreso de la renta de un local que le dejo su esposo.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza R. has more than two years experience selling used clothing. This business is the source of income for her family. Esperanza is a widow and takes responsibility for her son.

She is lacking a great variety of merchandise and also wants to add toys and baby products, but she does not have the necessary funds to make this investment. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy these products for her business and increase her inventory.

Esperanza plans to repay the loan using the earnings from her business. She also receives rental income from a piece of property that her husband left behind.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Production and sale of cassava flour

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
After working for years as a nanny, Guadalupe finally felt ready to go into business for herself when she discovered a program that helps to train and certify would-be daycare owners. In this comprehensive program, Guadalupe learned how to set up her business and manage its costs, and took classes about child development to prepare herself for the wide variety of children that she would care for. Upon graduation, Guadalupe transformed her home into 'My Little World Childcare'. 

Guadalupe’s daycare center is a ‘home away from home’ for the children, and she has tight bonds with the children she cares for. “I love celebrating their birthdays,” she says. “It’s beautiful to watch them grow up. I get to see them get their first tooth and learn how to walk.” Each day she tracks their eating habits, how they slept, and any unusual behavior, and makes reports to their parents. 

Guadalupe received a microloan from Opportunity Fund in 2007 to renovate her backyard and turn it into a better, safer play space for the children. She now has swing sets, a playhouse, and other toys, and the children spend time outside whenever possible. “If I had not received a loan from Opportunity Fund I still would have tried to make the safety improvements to my center, but they might not have been enough. I am afraid it could have been dangerous.” 

With a second loan through Opportunity Fund, this one for $8,000, Guadalupe will be able to purchase a computer to track her business expenses and a van to take the children on field trips to the nearby park and museums. She will also install a fence to separate her front yard from the street.

loans.use: Computer to track business expenses; van to take children on field trips; safety improvements to her childcare facility

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba E. is a happily married woman. Aba prepares 'banku' (a staple maize dish) for sale at Abura. She has been educated up to the junior high level. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Aba uses the earnings she generates from her sales to support her husband in the payment of her children’s tuition and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare 'banku' and also to sell some grains. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase more maize to prepare 'banku' and also sell some grains

loans.name: Rita María

texts.es:
La señora Rita María M. A., es una joven de  23 años, es casada y su esposo labora como Albañil, apoyándole con los gastos del hogar, aun ellos no tienen hijos, pero esperan mejorar sus condiciones económicas para comenzar ha procrearlos.

Los ingresos de la familia son muy limitados, ellos esperan que se les apoye en la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar unas remodelaciones al hogar, sobre todo con la reconstruccion de su baño personal debido a  que esta en mal etado y perjudica la salud e higiene de la familia, el apoyo que se le brinde a la familia ayudara a ambicionar con la idea de agrandar la familia a corto plazo, pues es una de las mayores ilusiones del matrimonio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rita María M. A. is a married young woman who is 23 years of age. Her husband works as a mason and helps with the household finances. They do not have children, but they want to improve their financial condition before starting a family.

Rita’s family income is very limited, so she hopes to receive assistance with purchasing construction materials to complete a few home remodeling projects. One such project is rebuilding her personal bathroom because it is in bad condition, which makes it harmful and unhealthy for her family. The support that will be provided to Rita and her husband will help them with their plans of expanding their family in the short term, which is one of the greatest thrills of marriage.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rebuild the main bathroom

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 66 años, casada y madre D. 4 hijos que son ya independientes, por lo que vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 20 años se dedica la venta D. tamales en un espacio del patio D. su casa,  mediante este negocio se hizo muy conocida en su barrio, ya que todos los fines D. semana abre su negocio y todos acuden a ella a consumir su platillos. Asimismo, tiene la oportunidad D. ofrecer productos D. belleza a algunos D. sus clientes exclusivos, ya que estos le garantizan cumplir con el pago D. los productos que compran. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es  la interrelación con la gente, eso hace que su negocio sea rentable, por lo que lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad. En adelante, continuará vendiendo sus cosméticos D. belleza y preparando tamales, y con el tiempo puedo comprar su vitrina para que pueda exhibir sus productos D. belleza y evitar que sus nietos puedan cogerlo y deteriorar su mercadería. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente cada una D. sus cuotas, puesto que desea contar nuevamente con nuevos aportes. Asimismo espera integrarse a su grupo y velar por el bienestar D. sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos D. belleza y tener variedad D. cosméticos, para que aumente sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gloria is 66 years old, married, and the mother of four children who are already independent. She and her husband live in their own home.

For more than 20 years, Gloria has been selling tamales from a space in her yard. Through this business she has become well-known in her neighborhood. Every weekend she opens her business and everyone comes by to savor her dishes. At the same time, Gloria takes the time to offer beauty products to some of her exclusive customers since they are guaranteed to make payments for the products they order. What she enjoys most about her job is the interaction with people, which helps to make her business profitable. She has been in this venture for two years and plans to continue selling beauty products and preparing tamales. In the future, she plans to buy a display case so that she can exhibit her beauty products and prevent her grandchildren from touching and damaging the merchandise.

This is her first loan with MFP. Gloria promises to be punctual with each of her payments because she wants to rely on subsequent loans in the future. She also hopes to blend in with her group and look out for the welfare of her fellow Communal Bank members. With the loan she requested, Gloria will buy more beauty products so that she will have a greater variety, thereby increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of fritters and cassava flour

loans.name: Caaguazú Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité se formó en el Barrio Bernardino C. D. la Ciudad D. Caaguazú, las integrantes poseen el espiritu emprendedor que se necesita, son solidarias unas con otras y muy responsables, son 18 señoras que integran el comité, cada una posee un trabajo independiente, luchan día a día para mantener a la familia con el deseo D. superación constante en cada una. 
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Buenaventura Ocampos quien posee una carniceria y su actividad es dedicarse a las labores D. la casa y atender su carniceria, ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con su trabajo ya que le deja buena ganacia.
Quiere comprar una conservadora especial para la carniceria, para la compra del mismo solicita el crédito ya que D. esa manera contará con mayor cantidad D.  producto.
texts.en:
This committee was established in the Bernardino C. neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú. The members possess the necessary entrepreneurial spirit. They work closely with one another and are very responsible. The committee consists of 18 members. Each one works independently and strives each day to support their families in hopes of making constant improvement. One of the members is Sra. Buenaventura Ocampos, who owns a butcher shop. Her activity is dedicated to performing her housework and attending to her business. She is very satisfied with her work and is able to generate a good income. She wants to buy a special refrigerator for her butcher shop, so she is requesting a loan so that she can acquire the highest quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Yanileth

texts.es:
Yanileth G. V., tiene la edad de 28 años, está casada, y tiene dos hijos uno de 8 y otro de 12 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para reparación de la moto que tiene. Necesita comprar los repuestos para la reparación de la misma. Este es su medio de transporte para llegar a tiempo a su trabajo, ser más eficiente y cumplir con un horario establecido, además de esto depende que pueda aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como trabajadora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Yanileth G. V. is 28 years old, married, and has two children (ages 8 and 12). She is requesting this loan in order to repair her motorcycle. Yanileth needs to buy spare parts in order to make these repairs. This is the means of transportation that allows her to get to work on time, be efficient, and complete her established schedule. She is dependent on her vehicle so that she can earn more income for her household finances.

This is the first time Yanileth has requested a loan from FUDECOSUR and she is very grateful for the services that have been provided. She hopes in the future to provide her family with a better quality of life and better financial stability, as well as continue growing as a person and as a worker.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Marame

texts.fr: Madame Marame N. est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis avril 2009. Elle a déjà bénéficié  d’un crédit  antérieur. Elle habite à  Mbott2  dans le quartier de Saliou N. à Guediawaye. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 5 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de légumes  et de poissons fumes au marche Serigne Mansour Sy  de Golf a Guediawaye. Elle a 10 ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de son activité. Elle a choisi l’activité dans le but de ne pas rester inactive et surtout par amour. C’est une activité qui engendre des entrées d’argent journalières  car ca concerne des denrées  alimentaires qui se consomment quotidiennement. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu  pour un voyage a Diaobe dans le but d’acheter des produits qui pourront renforcer et diversifier son activité. L’augmentation de ses revenus contribue positivement à la satisfaction de ses besoins personnels ainsi qu’a  ceux de ses enfants. La rentabilité de son activité a travers son premier prêt lui a permis d’aider un de ses enfants en lui achetant une machine a coudre cornière d’une valeur de  500 000 frs car c’est un tailleur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marame N. is a member of the local Baye Laye branch of U-IMCEC since April 2009. She has already been granted one previous loan. She lives in the Mbott 2 neighbourhood, part of the Saliou N. borough in Guediwaye. She is married and the mother of five children, and sells vegetables and smoked fish at the Serigne Mansour Sy Gulf market in Guediwaye. She has ten years’ experience performing this activity, chosen to avoid inactivity and mostly to support her loved ones. This activity generates daily revenues as it deals with food products for daily consumption. She is requesting a loan for 150,000 francs which she will use to travel to Diaobe, where she will buy products to strengthen and diversify her activity. The increase of income has a positive effect on satisfying her personal needs and those of her children. After her first loan improved her business’ profitability, she was able to help one of her children (a tailor) by buying a embroidery sewing machine worth 500,000 francs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of condiments on the market place

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua T. smokes fish to sell at Abura. Smoking is another process of preserving fish. Fish when smoked takes a longer time to go bad. To keep prolonging its safety one just needs to keep reheating it under low smoky heat. 

Ekua has received senior high education.  She is married and lives with her three wonderful children. Her husband is a sawmill operator. She helps her husband in taking care of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her trade to reinvest back into her business. 

Ekua did not have enough fish to show because it was a Tuesday. The fishermen do not go fishing on Tuesdays and so she has to wait till the next day to be able to get fish to smoke for sale.

loans.use: buy more fish to smoke to sell

loans.name: Freddy Bayardo

texts.es:
El señor Freddy Bayardo A. R., tiene la edad de 38 años, es casado y su esposa trabaja como oficinista, no tienen hijos, y habitan en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, son vendedores de frutas, desde hace 5 años siendo esta su principal fuente de ingresos. 

En los últimos meses ha observado una alza en los precios de las frutas, esto ha obstaculizado la compra de más mercaderia, razón por la cual ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de frutas, que les aumente la oferta debido a que la demanda se mantiene en los meses de verano y desean aprovechar el clima, que motiva a la compra de frutas en la clientela, el apoyo que se le brinde, les ayudara a ambicionar  en proyectos que favorezcan a la estabilidad económico-social de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Freddy Bayardo A. R. is 38 years old and married. His wife works as an office worker. They haven't got any children and live in the Juan Ramón Padilla Housing community. For the past five years, he has been selling fruit as his main source of income. In the past few months, he has noticed a rise in the price of fruit, which has made it difficult for him to purchase more merchandise. This is the reason why he is applying for a loan, so that he can buy a larger inventory of fruit, which would then increase his sales due to the high demand that occurs during the summer months. With the warmer climate, his clients tend to purchase more fruit and he wants to be able and ready to take full advantage of this tendency. The help that he is asking for would help him in reaching this objective and thus adding to the socio-economic stability of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a larger inventory of fruit.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Tienda la Flor de Oro es un lugar de gran preferencia entre los vecinos del barrio Carrizal en el sur de Barranquilla, pues su propietaria Ernestina C. R. de 52 años, es una mujer valiente que ofrece una atención esmerada a cada persona que se acerca a este negocio, que le ha dado todo y al que se ha entregado también, desde el mismo momento en que quedó viuda con sus tres hijos y responsable de todos los ingresos y decisiones del hogar; a través de su esfuerzo, dedicación ha logrado que sus hijos estudien y ya hay uno que es profesional y con ello tiene su familia, un nuevo ingreso para solventar los gastos del hogar. El negocio de Ernestina es resolver las necesidades de las familias vecinas, relacionadas con el acceso a productos de la canasta familiar, por eso necesita un crédito por valor de $ 2.300.000, para invertirlo en la  compra de aceite en pimpina, arroz, granos, bebidas y carnes especialmente. Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los créditos recibidos de esta organización, ha logrado incrementar sus ventas y apoyar el crecimiento educativo de sus hijos. Su sueño es lograr que los dos hijos, aún bachilleres, sean profesionales ya que esta posibilidad le augura un futuro mejor. 
Ernestina se esmera por aumentar la excelencia en el servicio a su clientela para lograr la sostenibilidad en el mercado y aumentar cada día sus ingresos. El desafío más grande fue quedar sola con sus tres hijos después del fallecimiento de su esposo  y ampliar la capacidad de recibir créditos para ofrecer una mejor oferta de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The store "La Flor de Oro" enjoys a strong patronage from the neighbors of the Carrizal neighborhood in the southern part of Barranquilla. The owner, Ernestina C. R., 52, is a stout-hearted woman who provides careful attention to every person who enters this business, which has given her everything and to which she has dedicated herself. Ever since she was left a widow with 3 children, she has been responsible for all of the income and decisions of the home. Through her efforts she has managed to put her children through school. Already one of them is a professional, and he has a family and a new income to cover the household expenses. Ernestina's business meets the needs of neighboring families, who use it to access grocery products that are typically bought by local households. She needs a loan in the amount of $2.3 million Colombian pesos to invest in the purchase of cooking oil, rice, grains, drinks, and meats, in particular. This is her 3rd loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; with the loans she has taken from this organization she has managed to increase her sales and support the education of her children. Her dream is to see her two unmarried children become professionals and have the possibility of a better future. Ernestina takes great care to improve the services to her customers so that her business will be sustainable in the market and her income will increase over time. Her greatest challenge was being left alone with 3 children after the death of her husband. She wants to expand her ability to receive credit so that she can provide a better offering of products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, grains, drinks and meat

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela 20 de Julio de la cálida Barranquilla, vive Lorena Jiménez M. una joven de 21 años muy emprendedora, que a su edad ya es propietaria del negocio La Gran Estación, nombre que le puso Lorena, porque todo el que pasa detiene su marcha para refrescarse, pues el clima reinante lo hace obligatorio. 
Las actividades de esta joven mujer no tienen límites, ella también vende mercancías femeninas especialmente accesorios en plata, y como cada día en sus negocios ve rotar su mercancía rápidamente, necesita estar provisionándolo de bebidas y todo lo que solicitan sus clientes; con este propósito está aplicando a un crédito por valor de $ 1.300.000 para comprar por volumen cajas de refrescos, bebidas y adornos femeninos en plata como pulsos, anillos, cadenas y tobilleras. Lorena inició su aventura emprendedora sin cumplir su mayoría de edad con pequeñas actividades de venta, luego se dedicó a comercializar productos por catálogos, cuando trabajando como empleada fue retirada  y utilizó toda su liquidación para lograr iniciar este su gran negocio, al que fue añadiendo, con el apoyo en su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, otras actividades como la venta de bebidas refrescantes en la obligatoria parada de peatones y vecinos que por allí circulan, así mismo sus ingresos han aumentado dándole la oportunidad de iniciar una carrera técnica.
Lorena es muy feliz con su pequeño hijo de dos años, sus estudios y su trabajo como negociante; tiene muchos sueños asociados a su crecimiento personal y empresarial, trabaja en la actualidad para terminar su carrera, buscar mejores opciones de vida y fortalecer la sostenibilidad de su unidad de negocios que ahora la emplea y porque suspira por tener una casa propia donde compartir con su pequeño su vida futura.
texts.en:
Lorena Jiménez M. lives in the 20 de Julio neighborhood in warm Barranquilla. She is a 21 year old young woman who is very enterprising. At her age she is already the proprietor of a business, La Gran Estación. Lorena gave it that name because everyone who passes by stops to refresh themselves. The prevailing climate makes it obligatory. This young woman’s activities have no limits. She also sells merchandise for women, especially silver accessories. Everyday in her businesses she sees her merchandise rotate rapidly. She needs to be stocked up on drinks and everything her customers request. With that objective, she is applying for a loan for 1,300,000 COP to buy in volume. She will buy boxes of soft drinks, drinks, and silver jewelry like bracelets, rings, chains, and ankle bracelets for women. Lorena started her enterprising adventure before she was of age with small sales activities. Then she sold products by catalog. When she was working as an employee she was laid off. She used all of her assets to start this great business. She was adding, with the help of her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, other activities like selling cool drinks. She sells where the pedestrians and neighbors who circulate around here must stop. Her income has increased, which gives her the opportunity to start a technical career. Lorena is very happy with her small two year old son, her studies, and her work as a businesswoman. She has many dreams associated with her personal growth and her business. She is currently working to finish her career. She is looking for better life options and to strengthen the sustainability of her current business. She yearns to have her own house in which to share the future with her little one.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy in volume boxes of soft drinks, drinks, and silver jewelry like bracelets, rings, chains, and ankle bracelets for women

loans.name: Yadira Antonia

texts.es:
Yadira  F. es una barranquillera que sabe mucho de negocios, que expresa su experiencia de hace 20 años y  las diferentes actividades que realiza y que hasta ahora se han sostenido dan cuenta de ello. En su casa todos trabajan: su esposo es taxista y tienen 2 hijos de 20 y 23 años de edad, que también trabajan; ellos son precisamente la razón por la cual empezó su negocio, para agregar un ingreso más al hogar e invertirlo en sus estudios, porque su esposo tenía una gran responsabilidad en los gastos del hogar y ella consideró un deber el apoyarlo en este propósito.
Inició vendiendo pasteles a sus vecinos y fue expandiéndose y añadiéndole otro producto como el queso, que vende en porciones de libra o de kilo a solicitud del cliente. Observadora de su clientela, Yadira ha logrado comprender otras necesidades y por eso incursionó también en la venta de mercancía variada, como electrodomésticos, ropa y calzado, tres negocios en los que interactúa y cada vez muestran su potencial de crecimiento; con esta percepción se acercó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para solicitar su primer crédito, quiere comprar queso en mayor cantidad pues conoce que deja buena rentabilidad y también invertir en pequeños electrodomésticos, cosmético y ropa femenina para responder a pedidos de clientes, que necesitan hacer sus regalos, con motivo de la celebración del día de las madres en el mes de Mayo, asì  jóvenes adultos, hombres y mujeres envuelven los obsequios de su madre, suegra, cuñada, y hasta la vecina o amiga, en fin toda la que sea madre biológica o haya cumplido con el roll de madre.
Yadira a sus 50 años es una mujer trabajadora que sueña principalmente con el crecimiento de su negocio, pues se ve en el futuro con una mejor infraestructura de negocio y ayudando con tenacidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Yadira Montalvo is a woman from Barranquilla who knows a lot about business. She has 20 years of experience, and the different activities she has done to support herself are proof of that. In her house everyone works. Her husband is a taxi driver. They have two children, 20 and 23 years old. They also work. They are the exact reason that she started her business. She started in order to add another income to the household and to invest in their education. Her husband had a great responsibility with the household expenses, and she considered it her duty to help him with this objective. She started selling cakes to her neighbors. She was expanding and adding other products like cheese, which she sells by the pound or kilo at the customer’s request. She observes her customers, and Yadira has come to understand other needs. She also started selling various merchandise like domestic appliances, clothes, and footwear. She interacts in the three businesses, and each time they show their potential for growth. With this perception, she came to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request her first loan. She wants to buy cheese in greater quantities as she knows that it is very profitable. She also wants to buy small domestic appliances, cosmetics, and clothes for women to respond to her customers’ orders. They need to give gifts for the celebration of Mother’s Day in May. Young adults, men, and women wrap the gifts for their mothers, mothers-in-law, sisters-in-law, and even their neighbors or friends. They buy gifts for their biological mothers or anyone who has filled the roll of mother. Yadira, age 50, is a hard-working woman who primarily dreams of the growth of her business. In the future she sees her business with a better infrastructure, and she sees herself tenaciously helping her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese in larger quantities, domestic appliances, cosmetics, and clothes for women

loans.name: Amigas Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio Bernardino Caballero D. la Ciudad D. Caaguazú, son 18  señoras, que se acercarón a la Fundación Paraguaya ya que se enterarón que otorgaba pequeños préstamos para mujeres, las mismas son muy trabajadoras, solidarias y responsables.
El crédito sera D. gran ayuD., ya que ellas desean un progreso personal y familiar y al participar del comité les resulta muy satisfactorio a todas no solo por el crédito si no el compartir con señoras con un mismo interés el D. seguir adelante luchando día a día.
La Señora Ciriaca T. D. M. posee un negocio D. distribución al menudéo D. tienD. en general.
El monto obtenido será destinado a la adquisición D. mercaderías al por mayor como son los alimentos enlatados, utiles escolares, embutidos en Gral., verduras, frutas, productos cárnicos y lácteos, así como articulos D. limpieza y mercería; para su distribución al menudeo.
La tienD. que posee es bastante concurriD. por la variedad D. productos que posee y la Sra. desea ampliar su stock D. mercaderías para D. esa forma incrementar sus ingresos para así ir creciendo en el M. en el que se desarrolla
texts.en:
This communal bank formed in the Bernardino Caballero neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú. There are 18 women who approached the Fundación Paraguaya because they learned that they gave small loans to women. These women are very hard-working, supportive, and responsible. The loan will be a big help because they wish for personal progress and progress for their families. Participating in the communal bank is very satisfactory for all of them. This is not just because of the loan, but it is also because of sharing with women with the same interest in getting ahead as they struggle day to day. Ciriaca T. D. M. has a business of retail sales in a general store. The loan will be used to purchase wholesale merchandise like canned goods, school supplies, general cold meats, vegetables, fruits, meat and dairy products, cleaning and notions products to sell at retail. The store that she has is pretty busy because of the variety of products that she has. She wants to increase her stock of merchandise in order to increase her income. That way she will grow in the market in which she works.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Get general mercandise like canned goods, cold cuts, notions, and cosmetics

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 61 años, es separada D. su esposo, vive con uno D. sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 7 años D. dedica a vender comida en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó dentro D. su casa, desD. entonces todas las mañanas ofrece desayunos y los fines D. semana ofrece comida típica, siendo uno D. sus hijos quien la apoya en la atención al publico.  Es así que esta actividad empieza desD. muy temprano en la madrugada para preparar su comida, luego continua su trabajo limpiando y aseando sus implementos y utensilios. Este negocio lo disfruta bastante porque le gusta cocinar y tiene muchos años D. experiencia, es por esta razón que continuará con este trabajo con el objetivo D. tener un negocio mejor desarrollado. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. una licuadora y extractora, mesas y sillas para facilitar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Isidora is 61 years old, separated from her husband, and lives with one of her children in their home. For more than 7 seven years she has maD. a living selling food from a small space she fixed up in her home. She sells breakfast every morning and on the weekends she sells typical food. One on her sons help her attend her customers. Her day starts very early in the morning because she has to prepare the food. Then, she continues her work by cleaning and tidying up her utensils. She really enjoys this business because she likes cooking and has many years of experience. This is why she will continue with the same work hoping to develop her business more. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to act responsibly with her payments. Also, she feels that this loan will be very useful for developing her business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of a blender, a juicer, tables, and chairs to make her work easier.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a blender, a juicer, tables, and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. lives with her four children and is married to a farmer. She has no educational background. Esi is a fishmonger at Abura. The smoked fish is locally called by the Fante people “eban”. It is normally small in size. 

Esi uses her income in helping her husband pay their rent and also take good care of her children. Esi will add the loan to her initial capital to purchase other varieties of fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Esi plans to smoke fish in larger quantity to supply the market women in Abura instead of selling it herself.

loans.use: add the loan to her initial capital to purchase other varieties of fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Preparation and sale of food

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Av. San Lorenzo se reúne en la ciudad de Calceta en la provincia de Manabí, la señora Francisca es una  ciudadana de esta bella ciudad, ella tiene descendencia de chino puesto que su abuelo era de ese país en una época que la una parte de la colonia china se radicó en esta provincia se enamoró de su abuela y se quedo a vivir en nuestro país.

La señora Francisca es madre de tres hijos, en viudo hace 11 años, esta atravesando por momentos de dolor hace 4 meses perdió a uno de sus hijos y eso la ha tenido bastante triste, pero así, aun así a seguido trabajando no puede dejar de hacerlo es la manera de sacar  adelante a la familia, a sus 53 años se dedica al comercio y lo hace a través de las ventas de sabanas, toldos, y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, lo hace de una manera informal, desde hace 13 años se dedica a este negocio en su ciudad de origen, semanalmente viaja a una ciudad de la misma provincia para hacer las compras de los pedidos que tiene que entregar, cada crédito que recibe de la Fundación lo invierte en el negocio, en el lugar que compra no le dejan a crédito pero para poder conservar a sus clientela tiene que darles facilidad de pago y cobra por semana, nuestra socia esta con ganas de seguir trabajando uno se sus sueños es mantener a su familia unida.
texts.en:
