The Avenue San Lorenzo Communal Bank meets in the city of Calceta in the province or Manabí. Ms. Francisca is a citizen of this beautiful city. The is of Chinese heritage, her grandfather having come from that country during a time when part of the Chinese community settled in this province. He fell in love with Francisca's grandmother and stayed to live in our country. Francisca is a mother of three children. She has been a widow for 11 years. She is going through some painful times since four months ago she lost one of her children which has been very sad, but still she has continued working. She cannot stop working since it is the means she has to help her family get ahead. At 53 years of age she works in commerce, selling sheets, awnings, and clothing for women, men, and children. She works in an informal way. For 13 years she has worked in this business in her native city, traveling weekly to a city in the same province where she make purchases for the orders she has to deliver. Each loan she receives from the Foundation she invests in the business. Where she buys her merchandise they do not provide her with credit, but to maintain her clientele she must give them flexible means of paying, charging weekly. Our member has a desire to continue working since one of her dreams is to maintain her united family.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets, awnings, and clothing for women, men, and children

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Av. San Lorenzo se reúne en la ciudad de Calceta en la provincia de Manabí en este sitio sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio de diferente formas.
La señora María Teresa es una de las socias de este banco, es madre, ama de casa y también es maestra en un colegio, tiene 35 años es madre de un niño de 12 años el esposo se dedica a la ganadería, nuestra socia nos comentó que desde que era una adolecente le ha gusto el mundo de las ventas, por eso a parte de ser una excelente profesora de mecanografía, archivo y tecnología es una muy buena comerciante, en los actúales momentos ella imparte sus conocimientos a jóvenes de un colegio y también vende productos de belleza y ropa por catalogo, en la mañana esta en las clases y en las tardes esta estudiando su séptimo semestre de administración de empresa, y los fines de semana se dedica a vender sus productos, ella sabe como coordinar el tiempo para hacer las cosas sin descuidar su hogar.

María Teresa se casó hace 15 años y solo ha querido tener un hijo cuenta que es un poco difícil poder tener mas hijos por el ritmo de vida que lleva se le complicaría su trabajo, en la época de invierno es cuando las ventas bajan, porque gran parte sus clientes son compañeros del trabajo y en tiempo de vacaciones es poco lo que vende, por eso hace créditos mas pequeños, con este nuevo crédito invertirá en los productos y ropa que le han pedido sus clientes ya para abril las ventas crecerán y así los posteriores meses obtendrá m as ganancias,
 nuestra socia esta muy satisfecha con la Fundación ya son varios los ciclos que lleva como socia y eso le ha permitido desarrollarse bien en lo que le gusta las ventas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Av. San Lorenzo meets in the city of Calceta in the province of Manabí. There the residents work in agriculture, cattle, and different forms of commerce. María Teresa is one of the members of this bank. She is a mother, housewife and also a high school teacher. She is 35 years old and the mother of a 12 year old boy. Her husband works with cattle. Our member told us that since she was a teenager she has really liked sales. That is why, in addition to being an excellent typing, filing and technology teacher, she is a very good saleswoman. Presently, she imparts her knowledge to the young people of a high school and she also sells beauty products and clothes via catalog. Mornings she is in class, afternoons she is in her seventh semester of business administration, and weekends she sells her products. She knows how to coordinate her time to accomplish these things without neglecting her home. María Teresa was married 15 years ago and she has only wanted one child. She remarks that it is a little difficult to have more children due to the rythym of the life she leads. Her work would be become complicated. During the winter is when sales go down, because a large portion of her customers are coworkers and during vacation she sells little. Because of this, she does smaller loans. With this new loan, she will invest in the products and clothing that her customers have ordered from her, since in April the sales will increase. In this way, she will have more profit in the months to come. Our member is very satisfied with the Foundation and she has been a member for several cycles. This has allowed her to develop in what she likes to do: sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothes to for resale.

loans.name: Celia Pastora

texts.es:
Doña Celia es una mujer trabajadora, madre de cuatro hijos, tiene la edad de 36 años, y con ahorros provenientes de su esposo, producto de su trabajo como taxista logro poner una pulpería en donde vende una variedad como: granos básicos, golosinas, cereales, lácteos, gaseosa, pollo y mas producto de necesidad del cliente. Anteriormente vendía ambulante golosinas para poder ayudar a pagar los gastos básicos, ya que todo ha incrementado. 
Entre sus planes esta poder dar los estudios a sus hijos es por eso que con los financiamientos invierte en su pulpería para poder obtener ganancias y con esto ahorrar para pagar y comprar lo necesario de útiles para los estudios. Con este financiamiento comprara: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, jabón, aceite, golosinas, gaseosas, carnes y pollo con el propósito de dar un buen servicio de venta de productos consumibles diarios del cliente.
texts.en:
Celia is a hardworking woman. She is a mother of four children and she is 36 years old. With savings from her husband, product of his work as a taxi driver, she was able to open a convenience store. She sells a variety of things such as: basic grains, snacks, cereal, dairy products, sodas, chicken and more products needed by customers. Previously she sold snacks as a street vendor in order to help with household expenses, since everything has gone up. Among her plans is being able to give her children an education. That is why she invests her financing in her store in order to obtain profit and thus save and pay for and purchase the school suplies they need. With this financing she will purchase: beans, rice, sugar, soap, oil snacks, sodas, beef and chicken. She will do this in order to offer good service of daily food sales for the customer.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase: beans, rice, sugar, oil, soap, snacks, beef and chicken in order to maintain a variety of products to sell more.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet tiene  25  años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Trabaja de manera independiente en la venta de ropa desde hace dos años, es por ello que viaja cada cierto tiempo a la ciudad de Lima, para comprar su mercadería que luego son llevadas a otras ciudades de clima cálido a vender su mercadería. Desde entonces sus ganancias se perciben cada semana, pese que a veces los constantes  viajes tienen sus riesgos por las excesivas lluvias que se presentan, aún así esta actividad le da mucha satisfacción, por que le permite crecer económicamente. Anhela  crecer su capital y tener mayores ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que es muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de polos y shorts al por mayor.
texts.en:
Janet is 25 years old. She is a single mother and she lives with her two children in a rented house. She has been self employed selling clothing for two years. This is why she travels periodically to the city of Lima to purchase merchandise that is then taken to other warm-climate cities to sell. Since then, she has made a profit every week, despite the fact that the constant travelling is risky due to the excessive rain that exists. Even so, this activity gives her a lot of satisfaction, because it allows her to grow economically. She wishes to grow her capital and have higher profits. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very responsible with her payments, and she considers that this sum will be very useful in her business' progress. She will invest the loan she is asking for in polo shirts and shorts, bought wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase polo shirts and shorts wholesale.

loans.name: Yenny Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Jenny es una socia del Banco Comunal Av. San Lorenzo que se reúnen en la ciudad Calceta mas conocida como las ciudad que no tiene copia, es  rodeada por un maravilloso paisaje montañoso y un rio con mayor atractivo turístico en la zona, sus habitantes en gran mayoría se dedican a la cría de ganado y a la agricultura.

La señora Jenny es una socia muy comprometida con su trabajo, ella aparte de ser una buena ama de casa y excelente madre es una de las modista mas solicitada del lugar, ella nos contó que desde muy joven empezó en el arte de la costura empezó hace 30 años confeccionando ropa para damas como, vestidos, blusas, y ropa para niños como camisas pantalones y uniformes escolares, nuestra socia es nacida en Junín un pequeño pueblo cercano a la ciudad donde en los actuales momentos reside Calceta, a sus 47 años sigue en la misma labor de coser no se le ha dificultado en lo absoluto, pese a que en ocasiones quiere dejarlo porque es demasiada responsabilidad tiene que ser puntual para entregar la costura, y hay días en los que duerme dos horas, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana y se va de largo cociendo por mas de 12 horas y descansa poco y seguir para entregar al día siguiente la costura.

La señora Jenny es sola en su trabajo no cuenta con operarias, ella prefiere hacer todo el trabajo, en su casa tiene maquinas profesionales,  se ella la que se encarga de cortar y coser las prendas, con este nuevo préstamo  nuestra socia podrá surtir en telas, botones, encajes y todo lo necesario para realizar sus costuras.
texts.en:
Señora Jenny is a member of the communal bank "Av. San Lorenzo" that meets in the city of Calceta, which is know as the city like no other. It's surrounded by marvelous mountainous countyside and a river that attracts the most tourists to the area. The great majority of the inhabitants make a living raising cattle and farming. Señora Jenny is a member who is very busy with her work. Apart from being a good housewife and excellent mother, she is one of the most sought after seamstresses in the area. She told us that she began the art of sewing when she was very young. Thirty years ago she began making women's clothing like: dresses, blouses,and clothes for children like: shirts, pants, and school uniforms. Our member was born in Junín, a small town near the city of Calceta, where she currently lives. At age 47 she continues with the same work of sewing which has not been hard for her in any way except for when she wants to stop because it's so much responsibility to have to turn in the sewing punctually. There are days she sleeps only two hours and gets up at 4 in the morning and sews for 12 hours and rests a bit and continues on so she can turn the piece in the next day. Señora Jenny works alone. She doesn't have helpers to rely on. She prefers to do all the work and has professional machines in her home. She does all of the cutting and sewing of pieces of clothing. With this new loan, our member will be able to stock fabrics, buttons, lace, and everything she needs to do the sewing.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, lace

loans.name: Ramata Coumba

texts.fr: Madame Ramata Coumba B. est une commerçante  de tissus qui a 2 ans d’expérience. Elle habite dans le quartier de Keur Serigne Assane à Guediawaye. Elle est age de 32 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis janvier 2010 et a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur. C’est dans  le  soucis  de ne  pas  rester  inactive que  Madame  B.  a choisi par amour cette activité. Sa spécialité  c’est  la vente à crédit. Elle se réjouit  beaucoup des périodes  de fête  comme la Tabaski, la Korite ou le Magal. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des tissus et des draps destines a la vente. Son objectif est de renforcer  et de diversifier son stock de marchandises. Madame Ramata souhaite progresser et devenir une grande commerçante. Son mari a immigre et c’est avec  ses revenus qu’elle  parvient  a régler  les besoins primaires.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramata Couba B. is a fabric trader who has two years of experience. She lives in the Keur Serigne Assane district of Guediawaye. She is 32 years old. She has been a member of the Baye Laye savings bank since January 2010 and has already had one loan. Mrs. B. chose this business because she liked it and because she did not want to remain inactive. Her specialiaty is to sell on credit. She takes delight in the holiday periods, such as Tabaski (the sheep festival), Korité (the end of Ramadam) or Magal (another Muslim festival celebrated in Sénégal). She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs with the aim of buying fabric and sheets to sell. Her objective is to strengthen and diversify her stock of goods. Mrs. Ranata wants to make progress and become an important businesswoman. Her husband is an immigrant and it is her revenues that allow her to cover the basic needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Yamuna

texts.en:
Yamuna is a 42-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has three sons and two daughters who are still in school. Her husband is a contractor. They are very close and work well together.  

Yamuna has managed a business of sewing and selling clothes for four years now.  She co-operates well with others and is very enthusiastic.

She has requested a 40,000LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Thomas Bahati

texts.en:
Thomas Bahati is a 36 year old man who deals in the biofuel business. He also operates a second business of selling groceries and this he has done for seven years.  Thomas is a father of four. He operates his businesses from Kibokoni Malindi, where his customers are residents in and around the area. He earns a profit of KES 4,800 per month. 

This will be Thomas' second loan, after he learned about Kadet through a marketing activity. With this loan, he will source for charcoal and firewood with KES 10,000 and grocery stock with KES 10,000. He hopes this loan will boost his business so that he can expand his grocery shop, build rental houses and educate his children comfortably.

loans.use: Source for charcoal and stock shop

loans.name: Sujeewa

texts.en:
Sujeewa is a 39-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura Matara. She has five children: three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a mason.

Sujeewa manages a cinnamon cultivation business. She has requested a 30,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business.

She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To support her cinnamon cultivation

loans.name: Sunila

texts.en:
Sunila is a 37-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children. She has three sons and one daughter. They are still in school, and her husband is a tool maker. They have been doing this business for five years. They make table knives, knives, axes and other various tools and goods. There are two laborers working in the shop as well.

Sunila has requested a 60,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help she and her husband's business. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: For the manufacturing business

loans.name: Kabibi Kaingu

texts.en:
Kabibi Kaingu is a 30-year-old lady who lives with her husband and four children in Kibaoni Malindi, where she operates a retail shop selling items such as sugar, tea leaves, cooking fats, and detergents. This business has been in operation for the last two years and her target clients are the residents of the Kibaoni area. She normally earns a profit of Kshs 3,500 per month and also practices farming on the side.

This will be Kabibi's second loan with Kadet after having been introduced to it by an existing member. Half of the loan will enable her to restock her retail shop with items upon which she is running low, and the other half will be used to buy a cow and some goats. With the proceeds from this loan she plans to expand her business to wholesale status, increase her livestock, and pay school fees for her children. Kabibi hopes to ultimately own a big business that is stable.

loans.use: To restock the retail shop and buy a cow and more goats

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Estela J.,  se dedica a la venta de Ropa interior y joyas de plata por la zona, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, y con mucho entusiasmo formó un comité de mujeres emprendedoras en su barrio denominado Constitución de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, el grupo esta conformado por 17 integrantes, son señoras muy trabajadoras, independientes, solidarias y con un solo interés  el de salir para delante. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir (camperas, botas, busos, pantalones) de manera a diversificar sus productos y además por llega la temporada otoño-invierno.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Estela J. makes a living selling underwear and silver jewlery in the area. She is the single mother of two children. She enthusiastically formed a committee of woman entrepreneurs in her neighborhood called Constitution of the city of Caaguazú. The group is made up of 17members who are hardworking señoras, independent, and in solidarity. They have one goal -- to get ahead. She is applying for this loan to buy articles of clothing (jackets, boots, sweatshirts, and pants) so she can diversify her products and for the fall-winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing like jackets, pants, knits, t-shirts

loans.name: Rohini

texts.en:
Rohini is a 38-year-old married woman living in the town of Kekanadura in the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She has two daughters. Her husband is a driver and her children are still in school. Rohini has managed a sewing business for eight months. She buys cloth and sews kids' dresses, bedsheets and ladies' items.

She has requested a 35,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Gladys Changawa

texts.en:
Gladys, 27 and separated from her husband, is the custodian of their two children, John and Jennifer, who are ten and nine respectively. In the business of selling food to local residents in Kibokoni Malindi for the past two years, Gladys was introduced to Kadet by an existing client, and this will be her second loan. She earns a monthly profit of Kshs 6,500 and will use this loan to increase her grocery stock, improve her business stand, open another business hawking clothes, and pay transport and miscellaneous expenses.

Gladys plans to reinvest the extra income by employing more staff in her business. A hardworking woman, she hopes to acquire a plot of land and eventually build rental houses.

loans.use: Add food stock, improve business stand and start a new clothing sales business

loans.name: Anjelika

texts.en:
Anjelika, married with two daughters, lives in Melitopol where she owns a vending kiosk selling men’s and women’s underwear in the central marketplace. Anjelika, who launched her small enterprise 12 years ago, now has 25,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory and earns a monthly net profit of 6,500 Grivnyas.

Now seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to diversify the merchandise offered for sale in her vending kiosk, she is planning to continue developing her trade and re-investing in its further expansion. Anjelika is hoping to use a portion of the generated profit to improve her housing situation.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Piedra Quemada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Piedra Quemada lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y decidas una de ellas es la señora Dayra del Socorro R. C. quien tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual piensa surtir con mayor cantidad de productos y variedad de productos.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Margina del Carmen Mendosa quien vende ropa e Iracema José R. quien tiene una modesta pulpería y vende pollo.
texts.en:
The group "Piedra Quemada" is made up of 3 hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Señora Dayra del Socorro R. C., who has a small grocery store that she plans to restock with a greater variety and quantity of products. Her fellow group members are Margina del Carmen Mendosa, who sells clothing, and Iracema José R., who has a small grocery store and sells chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staple grains, meat and other products

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa de edad de 43 años, vive junto con su familia, dos hijos estudiantes, y su esposo que labora para la Policía Nacional. Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos han logrado hacer su casa de concreto aunque falta por hacer varias mejoras como: hacer las divisiones, pintar el cual irán haciendo lo necesario. Desde hace varios años se afilio con la empresa Avon en donde vende los variados productos con catálogos, al gusto del cliente, pero también compra cremas, pinturas, perfume, ropa para poder vender al contado y lograr captar clientes nuevos.

Su propósito con este financiamiento es comprar zinc, madera, clavo para poder cambiar el techo ya que es viejo y se le pasa el agua. Lo que implica más gastos en salud para su familia y lo incomodo que le resulta mover sus electrodoméstico para que no se le dañen.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Luisa is 43 years old and lives with her family - two children who are students and her husband who works for the National Police. Thanks to the efforts of them both, they have managed to build a concrete house although it is still missing several improvements such as putting up the walls and painting it, which they plan to do. For several years she has been affiliated with the Avon business through which, using catalogs,she sells a variety of products selected by her clients. She also buys creams, makeup, perfume, and clothing to sell for cash and be able to get new clients. Her goal with this loan is to buy zinc, wood, and nails to be able to change the roof which is old and leaks, leading to more health related expenses for her family and the inconvenience that results from moving the electric appliances so they don't get damaged.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc, wood, nails to change the roof of her house which is old and leaks.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is married with two grown sons. She owns a vending stall in the central marketplace of her home town of Khoost, where she sells  batteries, flashlights, brushes and other small household items. All her merchandise is inexpensive and sells well among market shoppers. Lubov has been in this business for 16 years. Currently, her monthly profit exceeds 2,000 Grivnyas.  

Lubov is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase her merchandise assortment. She has a well-established small business and is hoping to keep it steadily growing. Lubov has proved to be an entrepreneur of integrity and responsibility. She has promptly repaid all her previous loans.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es:
La señora María Graciela G. es separada, tiene 48 años y tiene 5 hijos, 2 varones y 3 nenas.
María Graciela desde hace 13 años se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de uso domestico en forma ambulante esto recorriendo los negocios de varios lugares proveyéndoles de mercaderías, esta es la forma que pensó en su momento de trabajar y así ganar un poco de dinero para mantener a sus 5 hijos. María junto con sus tres hijas salen a vender ropa en forma ambulante.
Ahora la señora María con sus ahorro y con su esfuerzo ya habilitó también un pequeño almacén que lo atienden sus hijos cuando ella sale a vender sus prendas.
En la actualidad María pudo edificar su propio salón de ventas donde atiende cómodamente a sus clientes. En adelante quiere seguir aumentando el nivel de mercaderías para así satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela para este fin solicita el crédito
texts.en:
Señora María Graciela G. is separated. She is 48 years old and has five children, two sons and three daughters.

For 13 years, María Graciela worked as a walking vendor, selling household products. She went around to businesses in various locations, providing them with merchandise. This was how she was thinking at that time, that she would work and thus earn a little money to maintain her five children. Maria and her three daughters sold clothing as walking vendors.

Now María, with her savings and her effort, has also set up a small grocery store, which her daughters tend while she goes out to sell her goods.

At this time María has also been able to build her own sales room, where she can attend to her customers in comfort. In the future, she wants to continue increasing the level of merchandise to thus satisfy the needs of her customers. This is why she is applying for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy herbs, beans, sugar, rice, soft drinks, beer, oil, milk, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca F. A. está agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo elaborar la barda y poner el piso. 
Es nuevamente solicitando un préstamo ya que le está haciendo falta varios acabados del interior de la casa y también desea impermeabilizar el techa.
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que le realizara la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo que tiene limpiando casa particular.
texts.en:
Francisca F. A. is grateful for your help with her previous loan, which made it possible for her to build a wall and install the floor in her home. She is now asking for a new loan, since she still has to finish the interior work in her home and also wants to make the roof waterproof. Francisca does not have the money that she needs to purchase the material and to pay the person who will make the improvements. She plans to pay off the loan with the income that she receives from her job cleaning a private home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the interior work and waterproofing the roof

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian O. is married with three school-going children. She is married to Dominic Obare and the family lives in Mombasa’s Shanzu area where Lilian runs a kiosk sells home products like sugar, cooking oil,and  flour. She has operated the business for seven years and it has been a success.

Lilian got to join KADET through a member of the group she is currently in and is now borrowing her first loan. With the money, Lilian plans to purchase cooking oil, rice and sugar. She serves the residents of Shanzu, Keroport area and she says that the market is good. She hopes to go wholesale and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Purisima Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Purísima lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora Maritza Elena S. Salina quien es dueña de una pequeña pulpería. Este negocio lo administra con ayuda de su papá y su hija de nueve años, a quién según comento S. le ha enseñado por medio de la pulpería matemáticas y le ha ayuda agilizar la mente.
Además cabe recalcar que ella es una mujer con visión y deseo de auto superarse es por ello que retomara sus estudios universitarios  de contabilidad y se está actualizando en las nuevas tecnologías con el estudio de cursos de computación.
Juana A. A. es una mujer fuerte y con voluntad de ayudar es por ello que es voluntaria de los bomberos en Nindiri. Ella se dedica al comercio de productos Avon y Zermat pero su verdadera vocación es la costura la cual desea perfeccionar y poner su propio taller. Mientras Leonardo Acebedo de 21 años desde hace nueve años trabaja de taxista e invertirá el crédito en mejoras al vehículo.
texts.en:
The "La Purísima" group is made up of three hard working and enterprising people. Maritza Elena, who owns a small general store, is the group's coordinator. She runs this business with the help of her father and her nine year old daughter. Maritza tells us that the general store has helped her teach her daughter math and speed up her mind. It's also fitting to say that she is a woman with vision and a desire to pull herself ahead. This is why she has returned to university to complete her accounting studies. She is also studying computing, in order to understand the latest technology. Juana is a strong woman with a desire to help others and she volunteers with the fire department in Nindiri. She sells Avon and Zermat products but her main vocation is tailoring. She would like to start her own tailor shop. Leonardo is 21 years old and has been working as a taxi driver for the past nine years. He will use the money from this loan to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory and supplies

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with a three-year-old son. He lives and works in Kahovka. Alexander sells men’s footwear in a local marketplace. He started this business six years ago. Currently, his turnover capital amounts to 25,000 Grivnyas. His net profit amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas. 

Alexander is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to increase his footwear merchandise and re-stock his inventory. Since he does not charge high prices, he has many loyal clients who trust him and keep coming to his kiosk. The loan will give Alexander’s business a good economic boost and will help meet the demand this spring and summer season.

loans.use: to increase footwear merchandise

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en:
Sriyani is a 45-year-old married woman living  in Telijjawila, in the Matara area. She has one son and one daughter. They are 24 and 23 years old.  

Sriyani has managed a business of selling and making shoes.Ten years ago she started this business.  She co-operates well with others and has a lovely personality. She is very enthusiastic.

She has requested a 30,000 LKR loan   from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial   support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy new shoes for resale

loans.name: Faith Dama

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Dama is single and has a boutique shop at Malindi town, where she sells clothes, shoes and jewelery. Her business, which is four years old, targets the town's residents. She normally gets a monthly profit of 8,000 Kenyan shillings.

Dama learned about Kiva's partner KADET from friends and came to inquire at the office, where she then registered as a client. This is her first loan and she will use Kshs 10,000 to stock ladies shoes and Kshs 10,000 on underclothes. With the extra profits, she will expand her business to a wholesale level.

An ambitious lady, she has hopes to pursue further studies and obtain a Masters in Business Administration degree.

loans.use: Adding ladies shoes and underclothes

loans.name: Sara Elizabeth

texts.es: Sara es de 26 años de edad, junto con su esposo han establecido una venda de ropa, ropa típica en general, solicita su tercer crédito en ASDIR para incrementar y surtir mejor su mercadería, los dos anteriores prestamos los pagaron sin problemas de atraso, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona trabajadora y colaborador en su comunidad, el crédito le servirán para incrementar su venta.
texts.en:
Sara is 26 years old. She and her husband have established a clothing sales business where they sell general clothing items. She is requesting this third loan through ASDIR in order to increase her inventory and be able to offer a greater variety. They repaid their previous loans without falling behind. Her references indicate that she is a hard working woman who cooperates with the community. They will use this loan to increase their inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna is divorced. She has two sons, Yevgenyi and Roman. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she sells dishware and souvenirs in one of the sections of a local store called “Krestyanskyi Dvor” (“Country Yard”). Inna can boast a nice selection of retail items offered for sale at her outlet. She has been in this trade for four years. Presently, she has 50,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her income amounts to 15,000 Grivnyas. 

Inna is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital. Inna is very serious about her business. She approaches all aspects of it with a great sense of responsibility. 

She believes timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Inna’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 38-year-old married mother of two children. She lives in Kongowea in Mombasa and operates a business making juice from fruits. She has been producing and selling juice in Kongowea for one year. 

Florence is borrowing her first loan from KADET, a Kiva partner, and plans to utilize the money in the purchase of fruits for making the juice. Florence operates in a rented store and hopes to open up a permanent premises in the future.

She hopes to venture into selling the actual fruits too, and stop depending on the juice only.

loans.use: Purchasing fruits for making juices

loans.name: Wasanthi

texts.en:
Wasanthi is a hard-working, 32-year-old married woman living with her husband, son, and daughter in Telijjawila, Matara. Her husband has a carpentry and machinery business, in which Wasanthi provides assistance. In addition to helping her husband, Wasanthi has managed a business of selling clothes.

She has asked for a loan of  40,000 LKR from BRAC to help improve her husband's businesses.  Ultimately, with the increased income, she hopes to provide a nutritious diet for her family.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: for the improvement of the carpentry and machinery business

loans.name: Kitsao

texts.en:
Kitsao C. is 32 years old. He is married to Margaret C. and they are blessed with two children. He is a businessman operating a retail shop in the Coast Bamba market in Kilifi district.

Kitsao joined KADET, a Kiva partner, four months ago and now he is ready for his first loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings. His monthly profit is Kshs 4,200 but he also relies on his spouse’s income to supplement other needs. He has been in the business for the last three years. He plans to buy flour, sugar and tea leaves and renovate the business with the funds from this loan. 

Kitsao has never taken loan from any other microfinance institution and was introduced to KADET by a World Vision staff member. He hopes that the loan will boost his business and one day he will become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar and tea leaves and to renovate the business premises

loans.name: Lucy Nzai Kirao

texts.en:
34-year-old Lucy is a mother of seven children and married to a hotelier. She is in the retail and green grocery business, selling fruits, vegetables and soft drinks, sugar, etc. to local residents at Sabaki area in Malindi. The ten-year-old business now earns her a monthly profit of Kshs 5,400. 

Lucy was introduced to Kadet by an existing member and this is her second loan. This loan will enable her to renovate her shop with Kshs 2,000 while the rest will buy retail stock like flour and sugar, etc. The extra income from this loan will enable her to expand business and pay school fees for her children. A hard-working woman, she plans on saving for her children’s education and owning rental houses.

loans.use: Rennovate shop and expand inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital for supplies

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline A. is 43, married to George Owino, and is blessed with one child who is 28. Caroline is a businesslady who owns a salon in the Mombasa Shanzu area. She normally gets a monthly profit of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KSH). Her other income comes from rearing poultry at her home in Shanzu. Her major customers are residents and since the business is located next to a teachers college the students are her major customers while in session.

Caroline joined KADET through a friend and now is ready for her first loan. She has never borrowed from another MFI before to finance her business. She plans to refurbish her salon by buying a dryer worth 8,000 KSH and 7,000 KSH worth of shampoo. She also wants to buy 10,000 KSH worth of chickens.

Caroline describes herself as tough and ambitious and dreams of becoming a regular farmer and running a chain of salons.

loans.use: Beauty salon supplies and equipment, plus chickens to raise

loans.name: Elizabeth Mbodza

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37 year old widow with five children. She lives in Malindi town where she has owned a retail shop which for three years now. The business earns her a profit of 5,800 Kenyan Shillings (KSH) a month.

Elizabeth was introduced to Kadet by an existing member and she is currently accessing her third loan. She will utilize these funds by stocking the retail shop with 24,000 KSH and sourcing for firewood and charcoal with 8,000 KSH.The proceeds from this loan will enable her build more rentals on her plot and pay school fees. She hopes to expand her investments in rentals and establish a wholesale shop.

loans.use: Stock the retail shop and source for firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Tinga Balozi

texts.en:
Tinga is 40 years old and a father of three children. He supplies fish to tourist hotels in Malindi town.  The business is very lucrative during the high season and this business earns him a profit of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KSH) a month. Its three years old now. 

This is Tinga’s second loan with Kadet and he plans to open a fish shop with the extra income from this loan as well as invest in a deep freezer. These funds will help him boost his fish stock (8000 KSH), buy two bicycles for transport (11,000 KSH), and put 1,000 KSH toward miscellaneous items.

Tinga hopes to educate his children well, build a decent house for the family and establish his business.

loans.use: Stock more fish and buy two more bicycles

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 42 años, vive con su madre y su hija en su casa que es propia. Hace mas de 8 años trabaja ofreciendo el servicio de cosmetología a domicilio, ya que sus clientes necesitan de un tratamiento capilar, corte, peinado y teñido de cabello. Su trabajo es de todos los días y siempre esta muy al pendiente de sus clientes, por lo que también ofrece productos de belleza para complementar su servicio. Esta actividad le permite tener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos familiares, es por ello que se proyecta a tener su salón de belleza con todos sus equipos. Este es su 24 crédito con MFP, disfruta ser parte de su grupo comunal, además es muy responsable con sus pagos  y considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de secadora de cabello y productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Judith is 42 years old. She lives with her mother and daughter in her own home. She has been providing in-home cosmetology services for more than eight years; doing hair treatments, haircuts, hair colorings, etc. She works every day, always being attentive to her customers, to whom she also offers beauty products to complement her services. This business allows her to have the income necessary to cover her family expenses. This is why she wants to start her own, well equipped, beauty salon. This will be her 24th loan thorough MFP. She likes being part of this communal group. She has demonstrated great responsibility with her repayments and she feels that this loan will be very useful in helping her to grow her business. She will use the money from this loan to invest in beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a beauty salon

loans.name: Mirian Aydee

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer se reúne con 31 socias en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes ocupaciones, como comerciantes, y empelados de fabricas. 

La señora Miriam es una de las socias desde hace 37 ciclos y nos permitió conocer más  de ella, Está casada tiene dos bebes y esta a la espera del tercero, en el grupo le va muy, en los meses que tiene de gestación la suegra ha sido quien le ha ayudado a vender.

La señora Miriam se dedica a vender productos Avon y ropa para damas caballeros y niños, siempre ha invertido todo lo que presta en la Fundación pero en época de invierno invierte poco no son iguales las ventas se gana poco, y  por medio de la revista de Avon ofrece los productos para que los clientes hagan sus pedidos, la ropa en cambio el esposo es el que viaja a la ciudad de Guayaquil para comprar a los mayoristas, desde hace 3 años viene nuestra socia trabajando en sus ventas y lo hace de una manera informal visitando puerta a puerta las casas de sus clientes , se dedica a vender los fines de semana, con este nuevo crédito invertirá todo para estos meses que son buenas las ventas tiene pedidos como pantalones y perfumes por entregar.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" meets with its 31 members in Bajo de Montecristi in Manabí province. This is a small place surrounded by a lot of vegetation. Its residents perform different occupations: such as merchants, and factory employees. Miriam has been a member for 37 loan cycles, so we know a lot about her. She is married with 2 children, and is currently expecting her third. She does very well in the group, and in the months that she has been pregnant her mother-in-law has been helping her to sell. Miriam sells Avon products and clothing for men, women and children. She has always invested everything she has borrowed from the Foundation, but in the winter season she invests little because during these months she earns very little. Using the Avon catalog she offers products to her customers through advance orders. To obtain her clothing, her husband travels to the city of Guayaquil to buy from the wholesalers. She has been working in sales for 3 years, and she does it in an informal manner, visiting her customers door-to-door. She sells during the weekends. She will invest all of the proceeds of this new loan so that she will have products for the months when sales are high, and so that she can fill orders that she has for products such as pants and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men and children, and Avon brand perfumes

loans.name: San Buenaventura Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguari, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de  aumentar su capital de trabajo y otras para emprender algún negocio para generar sus propios ingresos.
El comité lleva por nombre San Buenaventura, cuyos objetivos es trabajar en un ambiente armónico e ir mejorando la calidad de sus trabajos.
Todas las integrantes son mujeres muy trabajadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
La señora Digna es una de las integrantes quien abrió su negocio después de integrar el comité de mujeres, ella actualmente se dedica a la actividad de venta de accesorios para celulares y ademas la recarga de saldo de celulares.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de accesorios para celulares y también para adquirir algunos aparatos celulares.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguari, some women get together because they want to increase their working capital. Others want to establish a business to generate their own income. The communal bank is named San Buenaventura. Its objectives are to work in a harmonious atmosphere and to keep improving the quality of their work. All of the members are hard-working women. They have invested their loans in their respective activities. Digna is one of the members who opened her business after becoming part of the communal bank. She currently sells accessories for cell phones. She also sells minutes for cell phones. She is requesting the loan to buy cell phone accessories and also to get some cellular devices.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phones and accessories for cell phones

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
Ana Lucia A.  se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo formando parte del banco comunal Tocte,  se siente muy orgullosa porque son un   grupo de mujeres que luchan cada día para ser mejores y superarse junto a su familia, vive en la parroquia Jadan que tiene una extensión de 51,2 km², ocupa el 14,7 % del territorio cantonal ubicado a  27 Km. de  la ciudad de Cuenca, conectada por la autopista Cuenca Azogues o bien sea por la Panamericana Norte vías asfaltadas en el  sitio “Guangarcucho”, luego por carretera lastrada 12 Km. hasta el centro parroquial.

Nuestra socia a  sus  25 años  se encuentra casada y madre de cuatro niños de  9, 8, 6, 2 años, los tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad  y el más pequeño pasa en casa  con ella, su esposo trabaja como oficial de estuquero (elaboración  cielo raso) y gracias al esfuerzo de la pareja están  construyendo su casa mientras tanto viven  en casa de sus suegros en un departamento  independiente.

Ana Lucía cría animales como cuyes, pollos, chanchos  que luego los vende en sus necesidades  y también los utiliza para el consumo de su familia, con su nuevo crédito comprará más  cuyes y pollos así como el  alimento para  su crianza. Su  meta es llegar a terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Ana Lucía A., 25, is in her 4th loan cycle as a member of the Tocte communal bank. She is proud because they are a group of women who fight every day to be better and to succeed together with their families. She lives in the Jadan parish has an area of 51.2 square kilometers and represents 14.7% of the canton’s area; it’s located 27 kilometers from the city of Cuenca along the Azogues-Cuenca highway, or Pan-Americana North, which is a paved road, to “Guangarcucho” then along the service road for 12 kilometers to the parish center. She is married and has four children who are 9, 8, 6, and 2 years of age; the oldest three go to the neighborhood school and the youngest stays home with her. Her husband works applying stucco to ceilings. Thanks to their efforts as a couple they are building their home while living in an independent apartment in her in-laws’ house. Ana Lucía raises small farm animals like, guinea pigs, chickens and pigs which she later sells when necessary; they are also for family consumption. She will use the new loan to buy more guinea pigs and chickens as well as feed for them. Her goal is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens as well as feed.

loans.name: Milene

texts.es: Milene tiene 23 años, casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de sus familiares. Hace más de 8 años se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos con su esposo, por lo que han arrendado un terreno cerca de su casa. Hoy es su fuente principal de ingresos, que le ayuda a sostener a su familia, por tal motivo se dedica a este trabajo todos los días. Además ha tenido la necesidad de contratar mano de obra, que le ayuda en la preparación de sus ladrillos; mientras que Milene se dedica a la venta y en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Durante estos años ha visto que la fabricación y venta de ladrillos le ha sido muy rentable, ahora tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, por lo que tendrá que arrendar otro terreno. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete nuevamente ser responsable con sus pagos, considera además este aporte le será  muy útil para desarrollar su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de insumos que le servirá para aumentar la producción de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Milene is 23 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son at home with her family. Over eight years ago, Milene began to make bricks with her husband, and leased land near their home to use for their business. These days the business is their main source of income, and so they focus on this work every day. They also had to hire more labor in order to help prepare bricks. Milene is focused on sales and searching for new customers. Recently Milene has noticed that the manufacture and sale of bricks has been very profitable, and now she has plans to expand the business. Therefore she will have to lease another site. This is her thirteenth loan with MFP, and she promises to be responsible with her payments. She considers this microloan contribution useful for her business, and with the requested loan, Milene will invest in inventory to increase her brick production.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her brick production

loans.name: Angeles

texts.es: La Sra. Angeles, esta casada,  anteriormente fue cliente Kiva, respondió con mucha puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos, y las cuotas estuvieron de acuerdo a sus ingresos, ella trabaja juntamente con el esposo en un taller de cerrajeria por la zona de Santa fé, tiene dos hijos pequeños en edad escolar, lo que le pèrmite a ella trabajar en otra actividad que es de empleada del hogar por la zona de Seguencoma, el taller se encuentra en su domicilio, por lo que su esposo controla las actividades de sus hijos, son una pareja joven, ahora el préstamo lo invertiran en compra de herramientas  y continuaran con el arreglo de  su vivienda, ellos solicitaron repetir monto y plazo, y con las mismas condiciones, ya que tienen un presupuesto para cubrir sin contratiempos esas cuotas. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Angeles is married and was a previous Kiva client. She handled her loan payments responsibly and completed them on time. Angeles works with her husband at a locksmith shop in the Santa Fé district. They have two young children who are in school and keep her busy when they are at their home in the area of Seguencoma.

Their workshop is set up in their house, which allows her to supervise her children’s activities. Angeles and her husband are a young couple. They now request a loan to invest in the purchase of tools and to continue the remodeling of their home. Their loan will be the same amount and repayment period as before, as well as contain the same conditions. They have already set aside room in their budget to cover the payments. Angeles is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for her locksmith shop

loans.name: Victor Francisco

texts.es: Víctor es de 37 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos dos varones y dos mujer cuenta con un taller donde fabrica ropa típica, la actividad lo viene desarrollando hace aproximadamente 12 años, solicita su cuarto crédito que le servirá para comprar una máquina para confeccionar ropa, los anteriores préstamo lo pagaron sin problema.
texts.en:
Víctor is 37 years old, and has 4 children - 2 boys and 2 girls. Victor has a workshop where he makes clothes, which he's been doing for the past 12 years. Victor is asking for his 4th loan, which he'll use to purchase machinery to make clothing. He has paid off his previous loans without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio esta casado, La actividad del cliente es el servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi y minibus, actividad que desarrolla todos los dias, esta actividad se constituye en la principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia, que esta compuesta por sus cuatro hijos y su esposa quien tambien ayuda con los gastos del hogar con la venta de comida en un mercado populoso de nuestra ciudad.
El destino del credito sera principalmente para el reacondicionamiento de su vehiculo, reparacion de caja, con la compra de prensa y disco de embriague y otras reparaciones menores, para asi de esta manera tener su auto en optimas condiciones para desarrollar su trabajo. Es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Julio is married and provides passenger transport services by radio taxi and minibus. He works every day to develop his business, which is the main source of income for him and his family. His wife also helps with the household expenses by selling food at one of the crowded markets in the city. They have four children.

This loan will be used for vehicle repairs, specifically for replacement of the gearbox. He will also buy a clutch pedal and disc, as well as pay for other minor repairs. These fixes will allow him to keep his vehicle in optimal condition so that he can continue working. Julio is a responsible and hardworking person. He is extremely grateful to both Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Julia Dina

texts.es: Julia es de 30 años de edad, soltera, se dedica a prestar sus servicios como enfermera en un hospital de la localidad, en sus ratos libre se dedica a vender  ropa por catálogos, en la cual tiene aproximadamente 10 años de realizarlo, solicita su quinto crédito  para incrementar su capital de trabajo, los anteriores créditos los pago bien.
texts.en:
Julia is 30 years old, and works as a nurse at a local hospital. During her free time, Julia sells clothing from a catalogue which she's been doing for the past 10 years. This is her 5th loan, which she will use to increase her inventory. She has paid off her previous loans without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La Sra. Justina  M. Vda. D. C., tiene 46 años D. edad, la misma ha enviudado hace 19 años, D. su matrimonio tuvo 4 hijos , 3 varones y una mujer quien está trabajando en el exterior específicamente en España, los tres hijos trabajan con la madre en el taller D. costura, uno D. ellos es estudiante D. la Facultad por eso sólo  trabaja sólo por la tarD. en la costura. 
Cuenta que ella y sus hijos son oriundos del interior del país D. una ciudad llamada Isla Pucú, en donD. ella vivía con su esposo y se dedicaban a la Chacra (cultivos D. verduras, mandiocas) y a la cría D. animales vacunos, porcinos y aves. 
Luego que su esposo falleció vino a la capital con sus hijos a buscar trabajo, en ese entonces empezó con la costura en un taller que es D. su hermano y sus hijos eran ayudantes también.
 Trabajó con su hermano por un período D. 14 años, luego decidió comprarse para su máquina y habilitar su propio taller en su domicilio ayudado por sus hijos, había empezado con 4 máquinas y 3 personales que le ayudaban, terminaban 400 prendas semanales (aproximadamente 1600 prendas por mes).
Actualmente y gracias a su constancia y responsabilidad cuenta con 10 máquinas propias (todas industriales), a parte D. ellos trabajan 9 personas más, y están realizando la entrega D. 1000 prendas por semanas o sea 4000 prendas al mes.
Se siente muy contenta con todo lo que ha logrado, y desea comprar otra máquina D. coser por los que solita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Justina M. Vda. D. C., 46, was widowed 19 years ago. She has 4 children, 3 boys and a girl, who is working abroad in Spain. Her three sons work with her in her sewing workshop; one of them is a university student so he only works sewing in the afternoon. She relates that she and her children are originally from a city in the interior of the country called Isla Pucú where she used to live with her husband; they were vegetable farmers and raised pigs and barnyard fowl. When her husband died she moved with her children to the capital to look for work. Back then she started out sewing in a workshop that belonged to her brother; her children worked too as helpers. She worked with her brother for 14 years and then bought her own sewing machine and set up her own workshop in her home aided by her children. She started out with four machines and three employees that helped her; they would complete 400 items per week (approximately 1600 per month). Currently, thanks to her perseverance and dedication, she owns 10 industrial sewing machines. Besides themselves, she has 9 other workers and they are producing 1000 items a week, or about 4000 per month. She feels very happy with everything she has accomplished and hopes to buy another sewing machine; thus the present loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Juan Eusebio

texts.es: Juan es de 54 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos tres varones y dos mujeres, en su casa de habitación tiene establecido un taller de carpintería, su actividad lo viene practicando hace aproximadamente 15 años con la ayuda de su esposa han salido adelante, solicita su cuarto crédito, para comprar herramienta y maquinaria en su carpintería, los créditos anteriores los pago bien.
texts.en:
Juan is 54 years old, and he is married. He has five children, three boys and two girls. He has a carpentry shop set up in his home. He has been in this activity for approximately 15 years. With help from his wife, he has gotten ahead. He is asking for his fourth loan to buy tools and machinery for his carpentry shop. He paid his previous loans well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Flor De Avispa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Avispa lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Luz Marina Hernández quien recuerda como si fuera ayer como con 300 córdobas inicio su negocio de ropa usada el cual ha ido desarrollando con el tiempo y espera en un futuro no muy lejano tener su propio tramo en el mercado.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Verónica Mercado vende pollo y Ana F. comercializa bolsos y ropa. Ellas invertirán el crédito en la compra de productos para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Flor de Avispa group is comprised of three hard-working women. One of them is Luz Marina Hernández. She remembers it like it was yesterday when she started her business of used clothing with 300 córdobas. She has been developing it with time, and she hopes in the near future to have her own stall in the market. One of her colleagues in the bank is Verónica Mercado. She sells chicken. Her other colleague is Ana F.. She sells purses and clothes. They will use the loan to buy products for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of clothes

loans.name: Zoila María

texts.es:
La señora Zoila María  T.  también es socia activa del banco Comunal Tocte, vive en la comunidad del mismo  nombre  en  la parroquia Jadan, la  iglesia parroquial es el principal atractivo turístico de la localidad  por las reliquias que se guardan en ella, también el  Santuario de Uzhoc, ubicado en el cerro de su mismo nombre es otro lugar digno de visitar.

 Nuestra socia se encuentra tres  años formando parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres  sintiéndose muy contenta por la gran amistad que ha cosechado  en todo este tiempo,  ella  tiene 50 años de edad  comparte su casa propia con el esposo que trabaja en construcción y sus cinco hijos que oscilan entre los 23 y 9 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente para mantener su casa,  su cuarto hijo le ayuda en los quehaceres domésticos  y el  último hijo estudia en una escuela de la localidad.

Zoila María ocupa su tiempo en el cuidado de sus  animales, cultivo de las tierras  y los quehaceres propios del hogar, tanto sus animales como los productos que cultiva los vende en su comunidad,  con el dinero del   crédito solicitado  comprará  pollos y alimento para empezar con un criadero, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos se superen y lleguen lejos en la vida.
texts.en:
Zoila María T. is also an active member of the Tocte Communal Bank. She lives in the community of the same name in the Jadan parrish. The parish church is the main tourist attraction in the area because of its relics. Also, the Uzhoc Sanctuary, which is located on the hill with the same name, is another place worth visiting. She has been part of the lovely group of women for three years. She is very happy for the great friendship that has blossomed during this time. She is 50 years old, and she shares her own house with her husband and her five children. Her husband works in construction. Her children vary in ages from 9 to 23 years old. Her first three children work and economically help her support the household. Her fourth child helps her with the domestic chores. Her last child goes to school in the area. Zoila María spends her time taking care of her animals, cultivating the land, and doing her own household chores. She sells her animals and the products she grows in the community. She will use the requested loan to buy chickens and feed to start a chicken farm. Her greatest dream is that her children will succeed and get far in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens and feed to raise them

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El sr. Nelson F. M. tiene 36 años y esta casado con la sra. Rossana Cabrera de 33 años, tienen 3 hijos , un varon de 15 años y dos niñas de 6 y 2 años respectivamente.
El sr. Nelson se dedica a la fabricacion de joyas de plata desde hace 16 años. El negocio funciona en su domicilio y las joyas que fabrica son anillos , aros, pulseras, cadenas y dijes. Sus principales cliente son las joyerias y los revendedores.
El mismo desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de plata en forma mayorista , de esa manera obtendría mayor descuento por la misma y el costo de las joyas seria menor por lo que tendría mayor ganancia por la venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson F. M. is 36 years old and is married to Mrs. Rosanna Cabrera, 33. The couple has 3 children: a 15-year-old son and two daughters who are 6 and 2 years old. Nelson has been making silver jewelery for the past 16 years. He runs the business from home, and makes rings, earrings, bracelets, chains and charms. His main clients are jewelery stores and resellers. He wants to use this loan to buy silver in bulk. Since it is less expensive in bulk, this will reduce the cost of producing his jewelery, and he will earn more in profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy silver to make rings, earrings, bracelets and charms

loans.name: Roland

texts.es: Roland es soltero, vive con su hija de 8 años en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su madre, hermana y sobrina. Hace más de 11 años instaló una tienda en un pequeño espacio dentro de su casa, en donde ofrece productos necesarios para el consumo humano. Desde entonces su actividad empieza desde muy temprano, atendiendo a sus clientes y cada 2 semanas se va a comprar su mercadería de acuerdo la cantidad de productos que necesita. Por otro lado, Roland ejerce la profesión de docente, por lo que su madre y su hermana, lo ayudan con la atención de su tienda, mientras que el trabaja en el colegio. Tiene en mente continuar trabajando de esta manera y abastecer de más productos su tienda. Este es su crédito número 22 con MFP, por lo que tiene muchos años de experiencia siendo parte de su grupo comunal, además es muy responsable con sus pagos, y sabe que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos básicos.
texts.en:
Roland is single, and he lives with his eight year old daughter in his own house. They live with his mother, sister, and niece. Over 11 years ago he set up a store in a small space in his house. He sells basic needs products for human consumption. He starts work very early waiting on his customers. Every two weeks he goes to the market to buy the quantity of products that he needs. Roland is also a teacher. His mother and sister help him take care of the store while he works at the school. He plans to continue working this way and to stock his store with more products. This is his 22nd loan with MFP. He has many years of experience being part of his communal bank. Also, he is very responsible with his payments. He knows that this loan will be very useful to the progress of his business. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy basic products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products to supply his store

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Chavalas lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, luchadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es una señora de 33 años la cual se dedica al comercio de ropa usada e invertirá en la compra de pacas para tener más variedad de mercadería.
Sus compañeras de grupo son M.V una señora de 29 años quien comercializa naranja agrias y otras frutas y M. P la cual se dedica al destace de cerdo.
texts.en:
The Chavalas Group is composed of 3 hard-working, combative, and enterprising people. The coordinator is a 33 year old woman who sells used clothes, investing in packs of clothes in order to offer more variety of merchandise. Her companions in the group are M. V., a 29 year old woman who sells bitter oranges and other fruits, and M. P. who butchers pork.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PACKS OF CLOTHING TO SELL

loans.name: Emprendiendo Group

texts.es:
El  Banco Emprendiendo, esta compuesta por personas que se dedican a la comercialización D. productos D. belleza, artículos D. bisutería y otros, las mismas que pertenecen a la misma zona, ubicada en la América Oeste casi Melchor Pérez. Como es necesario dentro D. una organización existe la conformación D. la Mesa Directiva a la cabeza se encuentra: 

La Sra. Lucy esta casada y tiene un hijito pequeño, su actividad principal es la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo  D. manera ambulante, a las ves que cuenta con conocimientos básicos D. contabilidad que es su otra actividad realiza trabajos D. balances , etc. es una persona responsable dinamica, con el dinero dle credito comprara mercaderia que se encuentra en promosion para despues poder venderlos al precio original.

Como tesorera esta la Sta. Cecilia , la cual cuenta con el respaldo y aprobación del grupo para desempeñar este cargo. Su actividad es la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo, ella cuenta con clientes que le realizan pedidos, con el dinero del credito comprara productos que se encuentran en promosion.

En general las integrantes del grupo sienten las ganas D. superación a través D. la generación D. ingresos D. manera informal ya que es en apoyo a sus familias y ellas mismas, por lo que se encuentran agradecidas con el préstamo otorgado a través D. Emprender y la agilidad con la que fueron atendidas.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Village Bank is maD. up of a people who sell beauty products, jewelry and other items. They all live in the same area in West America near Melchor Perez. The board of directors of the group is maD. up of: Lucy is married with one small son; she primarily sells beauty products from a catalogue around town. She also knows the basics of accounting where she also works part-time. She is a very responsible, dynamic person who will use the loan to buy merchandise that is currently on sale which she can then sell and make a better profit. Cecilia is the group treasurer who is backed and approved by the group to carry out this task. She sells cosmetics from a catalogue and has frequent customers who order from her. She will use the loan to buy products that are currently on sale. In general, the members of the group really want to progress by earning more income in order to support their families and themselves. They are very grateful for the loans through Emprender and the way that they were treated throughout the process.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La Sra. Jacinta M. 36 años de edad, esta casada desde hace 17 años tiene 3 hijos una de 15 años, 12 años y otro de 8 años, todos viven con la misma.
Desde hace 5 años atrás empezó con el negocio de venta de regalos para mercería, lo cual gracias a su empeño y dedicación fue creciendo día a día, desde hace 1 año incorporo al negocio la venta de sabanas, frazadas y edredones. 
Con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir  sabanas, edredones y ropa de interior para las damas.
 Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya Y Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jacinta is 36 years old, married for 17 years, and has 3 children, ages 15, 12, and 8. All three children live with her. Five years ago she began a business selling gift notions, which, thanks to her efforts and dedication, has been growing day by day. Then a year ago, she expanded her merchandise to include sheets, blankets, and comforters. With the loan Jacinta solicits she wishes to acquire more sheets and comforters, and women's underwear. Jacinta expresses her thanks to the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the help they offer.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE TO SELL (SHEETS, COMFORTERS, WOMEN'S UNDERWEAR, ETC.)

loans.name: Faraway Group

texts.es:
El grupo Faraway está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras el coordinador del grupo es José Mayorlean T. L. quien en el 2008 instalo una tienda  donde comercializa desde ropa, zapatos y perfumes. En el negocio trabajan su esposa quien lo a tiende y administra y sus dos hijos de 17 y 14 años.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Adelayda T. quien vende cosméticos desde hace seis años y Ángela María G. tiene una pulpería la cual inicio hace cuarenta años. Ellos invertirán el crédito en la compra de productos para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Faraway group is made up of several enterprising people. The coordinator of the group is Jose Mayorlean T. Lopez, who opened a store back in 2008 selling clothing, shoes and perfume. His wife also works in the store, as well as takes care of their two children ages 17 and 14. Their two other colleagues in the group include Adelayda T., who has been selling cosmetics for the last 6 years, and Angela Maria G., who runs a small general store. They will use the money from the loan to invest in merchandise and products for their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The members of this group will use the loan to purchase merchandise and products such as clothing, cosmetics and grocery items for their respective businesses.

loans.name: Omar Roman

texts.es:
Don Omar es padre de familia de cinco hijos, de edad de 43 años, vive en un barrio de la capital que se llama Healeah, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace varios años logro poner para ganarse el pan de cada día, lo hizo con dinero de su liquidación de su trabajo. Ahora el administra su negocio y con ayuda de su esposa ha logrado equilibrarse en las compras, y el despacho ya que desde horas temprana se levanta para vender. Su casa es de concreto, falta el repello, hacer divisiones, aun es de tierra lo cual desea embaldosar para una mejor higiene. Asi como poner el local de la venta bien cerrado para una mejor visión  del cliente como seguridad.
Con este préstamo comprara zinc nuevo y perlin ya que el techo esta en mal estado y se le pasa el agua en el invierno por tal razón desea cambiar  para dar un techo seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Omar is the 43 year old father of 5 children. They live in an area of the capital called Healeah. Don Omar runs a general store which he opened several years ago to help cover daily expenses. He opened his store with money he got from his previous job. Today he runs his business with the help of his wife and things are going well. They get up early each day to start their work. Their home is made of cement and needs several important repairs. With sales going well at his store, he is a good client for the bank. With the loan, Don Omar will purchase the materials he needs to fix his roof which has been leaking badly.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will use the loan to purchase materials to fix the roof on his house.

loans.name: Rosa Adelia

texts.es:
Roda Adelia F. es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, creativa y con visión. Ella inicio hace año y medio por medio de la ayuda de su hermana con la venta de aceite de cocina lo cual distribuye de manera ambulante en carretera norte.  
Ella con el crédito comprar mayor cantidad de aceite lo cual le permitirá aumentar el volumen de ventas.
texts.en:
Roda Adelia F. is a hard working woman, enterprising, creative, and with vision. About a year and a half ago with the help of her sister she started selling cooking oil which she distributes as a walking vendor along the north highway. With this loan she will buy a larger quantity of oil which will permit her to increase the volume of sales.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Silmira

texts.es: La Sra. A. T. Silmira, vive en San Antonio, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Su esposo es obrero de campo y trabaja en la empresa Robson. La Sra. A. trabaja como obrera de campo para la parcela del Sr. Luis Choque en el Distrito de Santiago. Cuenta con casa propia que es de material adobe revestido. Solicita el financiamiento para la construcción de su vivienda a fin cumplir su sueño de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. La Sra. A. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Senora A. T. Silmira lives in San Antonio, a district of Santiago, with her husband and two children. Her husband is an agricultural worker for the company Robson. Senora A. also does agricultural work for Mr. Luis Choque in the district of Santiago. They have their own adobe home. They are requesting a loan to make important repairs to their home so they can realize their dream of improving the quality of life for their children. They appreciate the support we are able to give through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to their adobe home, and realize their dream of providing their children with a better quality of life.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 12 años se dedica a vender artesanías, mercadería que obtiene de los mismos artesanos de su localidad. Es así que lleva a venderlos a la ciudad de Lima, que en compañía de su mamá, quien la ayuda a vender. Adicionalmente a este negocio, también vende productos alimenticios oriundos su zona, como: la trucha, papa y maíz. Por  lo que cada 15 días trae algo nuevo que vender, de acuerdo a la  temporada. Este negocio le ha resultado ser muy rentable, ya que siempre compra al por mayor, además que tiene clientes fijos. Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo y aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, considera además este aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de artesanías y también de productos alimenticios, de esta manera incrementara su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 32 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. More than 12 years ago, Yesenia began selling handicrafts from the local artisans in her area. She brings the handicrafts to Lima, with the help of her mother, where they sell them. In addition to this business, she also sells food products typical of the area, such as trout, potato and corn. Every 15 days she brings in new things to sell, according the season. This business has been very successful, as she always buys wholesale, and she has a fixed customer base. She would like to grow her business and increase her income. This is the fourth loan with MFP, and she has always been responsible with her payments. She considers this kind of support very important to the growth of her business. With the new loan, she will purchase more handicrafts as well as food products, to continue to increase her sales and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more handicrafts and food products to sell so that she can continue to grow her business.

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
L. Sra. Violeta  tiene 37 años es casada  tiene un hijo pequeño D. 4 años su esposo trabaja en una imprenta   durante algún tiempo elL. lo ayudo laborando en el mismo lugar con sus ahorros ambos lograron comprar una combi para hacerL. trabajar como transporte publico. En L. actualidad  Violeta administra L. combi y en algunas oportunidades también trabaja  como cobradora D. manera que sus  ganancias  son mayores,  por ahora esta invirtiendo en L. reparación del carro,  el dinero del préstamo  otorgado por “ADAPROSPO” lo utilizara para pasar L. revisión técnica   requisito indispensable para que su unidad continúe trabajando. Violeta también estudio cosmetología  y es a lo que se dedicara en el futuro  tiene pensado poner un salón D. belleza  en su casa,  es para eso que ahorra  por que quiere tener un  salón D. belleza  moderno con todas las comodidades para ofrecer a su futura clienteL.,  elL. es parte del grupo “MADRES EMPRENDEDORAS” conformado por 12 socias vecinas del mismo lugar, tiene el cargo D. tesorera el cual cumple con mucha responsabilidad.
