* violeta es L. que aparece en L. foto con polo turqueza
texts.en:
Sra. Violeta is 37 years old, married, and has a four year old son. She works at a print shop and her husband works at the same place on a part-time basis. Using their savings, they were able to purchase a van to use as a public transportation vehicle. Violeta currently manages the van’s usage and also is in charge of collecting payments, which are being invested in repairs at the moment.

The loan provided by EDAPROSPO will be used to pay for a full technical inspection of the vehicle so that she can continue to put it to work. Violeta also studies cosmetology and plans to open a beauty salon in her house in the future. She continues to save so that she will be able to have a modern beauty salon that has all the conveniences to offer to her future clients.

Violeta is part of the group “Madres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Mothers), which consists of twelve members who live in the same area. In her position as the Communal Bank treasurer, she carries a great amount of responsibility.

*Violeta is the woman in the photograph wearing a turquoise shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a vehicle inspection

loans.name: María Zoila

texts.es:
María  Zoila tiene 54 años vive en su casa propia con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura,  sus  dos hijos solteros de los siete que engendró,  y un nieto hijo de su hija de mayor que  es madre soltera, sus dos hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente para cubrir los gastos de  su hogar.

María Zoila T. es socia del  Banco Comunal   Tocte, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en  la parroquia Jadan,  durante las festividades patronales la santa misa y la procesión con la imagen del Señor Jesús es el acto central, también se mantiene la costumbre de las vísperas realizar  baile de disfrazados, banda de músicos, castillo, vaca loca, la quema de fuegos pirotécnicos, el juego de la escaramuza (simulan peleas entre jinetes), son atractivos para el turista nacional y extranjero.

Este es  su cuarto ciclo integrando el banco comunal  beneficiándose  de los créditos que ofrece la fundación Espoir,  con ellos ha logrado mantener  e incrementar su criadero de pollos, cuyes y cerdos. Con el  nuevo crédito comprará cuyes y materiales como mallas y madera para elabroar  unas jaulas para separar los cuyes por género  y tamaño. Tiene como meta incrementar su criadero de cuyes.
texts.en:
María Zoila is 54 years old. She and her husband live in their own house, her husband works in agriculture. They live with two of their seven children, and with a grand son, the son of their daughter who is a single mother. Their two children work and they help with the expenses of the household. María Zoila T. is a member of the borrowing group, Tocte. She lives in a community of the same name in the parish of Jadan. The parish holds patron festivities, a mass, and a procession with the image of Jesus as the central event. They also maintain the custom of vespers, costumed dancers, a band, a castle, vaca loca, fireworks, the Skirmish game (simulated fights between riders). It is a popular event and tourists come from within the country and from abroad. This is María fourth cycle as a member of the borrowing group, taking advantage of the loans the Fundación Espoir offers. With them she has been able to maintain and increase her business of raising chickens, guinea pigs and pigs. With the new loan she will buy guinea pigs and materials like netting and wood to build a few cages to separate the guinea pigs by gander and size. Her goal is to increase breeding guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, netting and wood

loans.name: El Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Yessi trabaja junto con su esposo en la cerrajería que ambos tienen “CERRAJERIA ELMER” así se llama su negocio que esta ubicado en un mercado D. la zona donD. viven, su esposo empezó haciendo llaves  no tenia un lugar especifico y durante mucho tiempo trabajo como ambulante,  poco a poco y con el esfuerzo D. ambos han logrado comprar un puesto en el mercado D. la zona D. esa manera se han formalizado ahora han ampliado su negocio no solo hacen llaves sino todo tipo D. soldadura además D. vender repuestos para cocinas etc. Con sus ganancias han podido mejorar su casa y están ahorrando por que quieren comprar otro puesto para dedicarse al negocio D. comidas  algo que siempre ha querido hacer.
Por otro lado la Sra. Yessi usara el dinero D. su préstamo para comprar llaves y venderlas, ella pertenece al grupo “EL BELLO AMANECER” formado por 10 socias todas viven en Ventanilla Callao, ella  esta feliz por que en EDAPROSPO ha encontrado el apoyo necesario para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Yessi and her husband work together at a locksmith shop called “Cerrajeria Elmer” which they own. The business is located at a market in the area where they live. Her husband began making keys but did not have a specific place to perform his work, so for a long time he worked as a traveling service provider. Gradually over time, they were able to acquire a local market post in order formalize their business. In addition to making keys, they have expanded their business to incluD. all types of welding services and the sale of kitchen parts. With their earnings, they have been able to make home improvements and save toward the purchase of another market post where Yessi plans to open a food business. This is something she has always wanted to do.

Yessi will use the money from her loan to buy keys to sell. She is part of the group “El Bello Amanecer” (The Beautiful Dawn), which consists of ten members who live in Ventanilla Callao. Yessi is happy to have the support of EDAPROSPO that is needed to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase keys for her locksmith business

loans.name: Magdonio

texts.es:
El señor Magdonio Martínez tiene 57 años y esta casado con la Señora Ninfalina Velazquez que tiene 50 años, los mismos tienen dos hijos.
Uno varón de 33 años que se dedica como el padre a la reparación de artículos electrónicos, y una hija de 25 que recientemente culmino  la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad Nacional de Asunción.
El mismo se recibió de electricista y de técnico en Electrónica en el año 1972. y desde esa fecha se dedica a la reparación de aparatos electrónicos como : Equipos de Sonido , Televisores , Computadoras , celulares y otros  mas.
El mismo desea invertir el préstamo. En la compra de repuestos para artículos electrónicos y en la actualización de programas para flasheo de celulares.
texts.en:
Señor Magdonio Martínez is 57 and is married to la Señora Ninfalina Velazquez who is 50. They have two children, one son who is 33, he works in the same profession as his father, repairing electronics; their daughter is 25, she recently began her studies of Business Administration at National University of Asunción. Magdonio received a degree as an electrician and as electronics technician in 1972. Since then he has worked in the repair of electric apartus like: stereos, televisions, computers, cell phones and others. He wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of spare parts for the electronics and in updating programs for cellphones.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the electronics and in updating programs for cellphones.

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: La señora Aura se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, de edad de 50 años, con cuatro hijos, solo dos están a su cargo y estudian un par de gemelas ya que las otras están casadas. Su esposo trabaja como ejecutivo de venta, el cual dio dinero para comenzar la venta de ropa. Para ayudar con los gastos ya que todo a incrementado a demás por que le gusta ser una mujer emprendedora y que sus hijas tengan la iniciativa en un futuro de tener su propio negocio. Pues poco a poco ha logrado vender zapatos, carteras varios productos. Con este préstamo comprara ropa, zapatos y cosmético para aumentar el inventario y lograr mejores ventas. Sus planes es lograr poner una farmacia en donde también lograra vender sus productos actuales, esto beneficiaria al desarrollo y crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Aura sells clothing and cosmetics. She is 50 years old and has four children. Only two of which are in her care, they are twins and are in school, the others are married. Her husband works as a sales executive, which provided the money to begin the clothing sales. She started the business to help with the rising expenses and also because she would like to be an entrepreneurial woman. Aura wants her daughters to have the initiative in the future to have their own business. Little by little she has increased her business to sell shoes and various products. With this loan she will buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics to increase her inventory and to support better sales. Her plan is to create a pharmacy in which she can also sell her products, this will benefit the development and growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy: clothes, shoes and cosmetics to increase her inventory and to increase sales

loans.name: Elvis Mario

texts.es:
Elvis forma parte del banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”, tiene 27 años y es soltero. Elvis trabaja en la municipalidad distrital de Anta  es asistente técnico de liquidaciones de obras. Ya es un año que trabaja en la municipalidad y le va muy bien. Su actividad económica complementaria es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes.

Elvis es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su mamá con los ingresos económicos de la familia, el requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes. 

El banco comunal tiene 4 ciclos de funcionamiento, el socio manifiesta, que se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal.
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Elvis is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”. He is 27 and single. Elvis works in the municipal district of Anta, and he is the technical assistant for finalizing projects. He has been with the town for a year and it's going very well. His complementary work is raising small animals like guinea pigs. Elvis is a young and enterprising worker who is always looking for ways to get ahead, and with his daily effort he helps his mother with the family income. He needs a loan to buy more guinea pigs. The communal bank has been functioning for 4 loan cycles. This member shows that he is very happy and satisfied with its credit services, savings and training for the time that he has been with the communal bank. This member is grateful for the opportunity offered him in this manner, and he promises to fulfill the schedule of payments. The community of Inquilpata is an hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elvis needs the loan to buy more guinea pigs

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el caserío Pomape, una zona rural dedicada básicamente a labores agrícolas que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Monsefú, conocido a nivel nacional por sus festividades turístico – religiosas, situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar en actividades relacionadas a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ella cuenta con cuatro vacas productoras de leche de las cuales actualmente tres se encuentran en producción, la leche que extrae la comercializa entre sus vecinos y también la vende a un acopiador de la zona que revende el producto a una empresa procesadora de lácteos.

Paralelamente trabaja junto a su esposo en labores agrícolas, ellos siembran forraje para los animales y eventualmente otro tipo de cultivos como tubérculos y cereales; en esta oportunidad ellos tienen instalado camote y maíz chala (variedad de maíz utilizada  como forraje para animales), con los cuales piensan brindar una alimentación adecuada a sus animales y obtener recursos adicionales que les permitan salir adelante.

María Esther desea complementar la alimentación de sus animales con alimento balanceado de modo que puedan producir mas cantidad de leche, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una madre que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si en su trabajo para sacar a su familia adelante, en la zona donde vive ella es bastante estimada y respetada, sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer de confianza que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita. En la imagen nos muestra su cultivo de camote y en el fondo podemos apreciar a sus vacas pastando.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is a 28-year-old mother who lives with her husband and a son in the hamlet, Pomape, a rural area dedicated mainly to agriculture, located in the district of Monsefú, known nationally for its tourist-religious festivities, located twenty minutes from the town of Ciclayo.

For the past ten years she has been working in activities related to raising cattle, she has four milking cows, three are producing at the moment. The milk is being sold among her neighbors and she also sells to a wholesale buyer in the area who resells the product to a dairy processing plant.

At the same time she works with her husband at farm work. They plant forage for the animals and eventually other kinds of crops such as tubers and cereals. In this opportunity they grow sweet potato and "chala" corn (a variety of corn used as forage for animals) with which they plan to feed their animals appropriately and obtain additional resources to get ahead.

María Esther wishes to complement the diet of their animals with balanced food in order to produce more milk. Therefore she needs to request, for the first time, a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a mother who gives her best at her work to make her family get ahead. In the area where she lives she is very appreciated and respected. Her neighbors and friends consider her a woman to be trusted, who is always willing to help where needed. In the photo she is showing us her crop of sweet potatoes and in the background her cows are on grass.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balanced food to improve milk production

loans.name: Basilides

texts.es:
El señor Basilides R. tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Felipa Orrego, y viven en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio Arroyo Pora distrito de Cambyreta.

El señor Basilides y su esposa son propietarios de un Copetín que poseen en el centro de la ciudad de Encarnacion, especificamente en la zona de la Terminal.
 Ellos realizan comidas y viandas, venden también pollo al espiedo y tienen muchos clientes ya que son conocidos en la zona, y mas aun porque se encuentran en un lugar estratégico por estar a metros de la terminal de ómnibus.
 Se dedican a esta actividad desde hace mas de 5 años, han ido creciendo poco a poco, y mediante este trabajo ellos han mantenido su hogar, su familia, educar a sus hijos y solventar los gastos de la vida diaria. 

Ellos han solicitado este crédito para concretar la compra de un vehículo, que les resulta sumamente necesario debido a que traen los insumos de la ciudad de Posadas (Argentina).
texts.en:
Mr. Basilides R. is 44 years old, married to Mrs. Felipa Orrego. They live in their own house located in the Barrio Arroyo Pora, district of Cambyreta.

Mr. Basilides and his wife own a snack food stand in the center of Encarnación, in the area of the Terminal.

They prepare meals and food as well as grilled chicken, and have many customers as they are popular in the area and even more as they are located in the strategic place, meters from the bus terminal.

They have been doing this for more than 5 years, they have grown little by little, and due to their work they have maintained their home, their family, they have taught their children and taken care of daily expenses.

They have requested this loan to set the purchase of a vehicle which is extremely neccesary as they bring raw material from the town of Posadas (Argtentina).

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ¨Purchase a vehicle

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Silvia, tiene 32 años, es conviviente, es natural de la Convención del distrito de Quellouno y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la ganadería. Primero alimenta a los animales y después los vende en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. Ella también se dedica a la producción de queso. Su actividades económicas complementA. es la venta de maíz y papa, ella es mayorista y solo vende en su domicilio. 

Silvia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para un vaca de buena raza.
 
Silvia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Silvia belongs to the community bank "VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA" of the Asociación Arariwa.

Silvia is 32 years old and lives with her partner. She is from Convención of the district of Quellouna and has two children. She lives in the community of Inquilpata of the district of Anta of the department of Cusco. Her main economic activity is stockbreeding. First she feeds the animals and then she sells them at the Campo Ferial of the Comunidad Campesina of Inquilpata-Anta on Fridays. She also produces cheese. To complement her income she also sells corn and potato, wholesale, and she only sells from home.

Silvia is a hard-working and entrepreneurial lady who searches for opportunities to get ahead at any moment, and with her daily effort she supports her family. She requests the loan to buy a cow of good breed.

Silvia is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and therefore she is committed to repay according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Silvia needs the loan to buy a cow of good breed.

loans.name: Sonata En Invierno Group

texts.es:
La alcancía Sonata en Invierno está integrada por 9 socias, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades.
La señora María  A. D. 61 años D. edad, emprendedora y entusiasta es casada  y tiene una hija.
Ella  comenzó a vender en su domicilio con una poca cantidad D. abarrotes  y gaseosas, con el transcurrir del tiempo a medida que su ingreso fue mejorando comenzaba  a surtir su pequeña tienda.
Su primer préstamo lo invirtió en la compra D.  mercadería compro  más cantidad D. abarrotes,  gaseosas, cervezas.
Su actual préstamo lo invertirá igualmente en su tienda  en la compra D.  más cantidad D. abarrotes, verduras,  golosinas y cajas D. gaseosas 
El objetivo D. María, es en la implementación D. su negocio, tanto en la ampliación como en el surtido D. sus  productos que pueda ofrecer al público en general
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Sonata en Invierno” (Sonata in Winter) consists of nine members who are dedicated to various business activities.

Sra. María A. is 61 years old, married, and has a daughter. She is an enthusiastic and enterprising woman who began selling small quantities of groceries and sodas from her home. Over time, her revenues improved and she was able restock her small store. Her first loan was used to purchase larger quantities of groceries, sodas, and beer.

María’s current loan will be used in the same manner to purchase large quantities of groceries, vegetables, candy, and cases of soda. Her goal is to solidify her business by enlarging it and expanding the range of products that she offers to the general public.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
Marina es Enfermera  de profesión, ejerció su carrera hasta tener su segundo hijo,  dejo el trabajo para dedicarse a su familia, en sus momentos libres  estudio corte y confección  sin pensar que algún día eso  le serviría de mucho,  ella tiene un hermano que se dedica a la confección de canguros  es así que empieza a trabajar como costurera para ganarse un dinero extra , durante algún tiempo laboro y  es su hermano  quien la incentiva para que ponga su propio taller, ahora ella confecciona y vende  canguros por su propia cuenta reparte al por mayor a los mercados ,tiendas y negocios del rubro.Con sus ganancias ha logrado ayudar en  los estudios de sus hijos y también terminar la construcción de su casa ,su negocio marcha bien a pesar que hay épocas bajas y altas pero ella logra mantener a su clientela, actualmente su taller lo tiene en su propia casa para  mas adelante quiere tener un  lugar mas grande para comodidad de sus trabajadores y  poder producir mas  ya que su meta es exportar sus productos, la Sra. .Marina es tesorera del grupo “TRABAJANDO EN ARMONIA” que esta conformado por 11 socias todas amigas y vecinas del barrio donde viven,  el dinero desembolsado  lo usara para comprar los insumos que necesita  para  la  confección de canguros como telas, cierres, hilos  etc. Marina sabe que en un futuro su negocio crecerá y es para eso que trabaja  incansablemente.

*Marina es la que viste polo color fuccia
texts.en:
Marina is a nurse by profession and pursued her career until she had her second child. She decided to quit her job so that she could devote herself to her family. Marina began sewing in her free time with the idea that it might prove to be useful someday. Her brother manufactures toy kangaroos, so she began working for him as a seamstress to earn some extra money. During this time, she continued to work until her brother convinced her to open her own workshop. Now she manufactures and sells toys kangaroos on her own and sells them wholesale to markets, stores, and businesses in the area. With her earnings, Marina has been able to help with her children’s education and complete the construction of her house. Even though her business experiences highs and lows, she has been able to maintain her customer base. Her workshop is currently located in her home, but later on she wants to have a larger place where her employees can work comfortably. Her goal is export her products, so she wants to be able to produce more items.

Sra. Marina serves as the treasurer for the group “Trabajando en Armonia” (Working in Harmony), which consists of eleven members who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. The money she will receive will be used to buy supplies for manufacturing toy kangaroos such as fabric, zippers, thread, and other items. Marina knows that her business will grow in the future, so she continues to work tirelessly.

*Marina is the woman in the photograph wearing a fuchsia blouse.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, zippers, thread, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruit.

loans.name: Eliodoro Ignacia

texts.es:
El Sr Eliodoro C. es casado posee casa propia con todas comodidades de un hogar es del Barrio La Amistad Distrito Cambyreta  tiene 4 hijos mayores.
 Los hijos adultos también ayudan para los gastos a la unidad familiar porque son micro empresarios. 
El señor Eliodoro de dedica a la venta de accesorios de celulares, bijouteri, lentes, calculadoras, linternas y Solicita  un crédito de para la compra de los mismos.
texts.en:
Eliodoro C. is married and owns his own house that has all the comforts of home in the La Amistad neighborhood of Cambyreta district; he has four adult children who contribute to the household’s finances because they are micro entrepreneurs. Eliodoro sells accessories for cell phones, costume jewelry, sunglasses, calculators, flashlights, etc. He is asking for funds to buy more of the same.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phone accessories, sunglasses, calculators, etc.

loans.name: Fanny Elizabeth

texts.es: FANNY TIENE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN CASA DE SUS PADRES, ELLA TIENE UN PEQUEÑA BODEGA UBICADA EN SU DOMICILIO, TIENE MUCHA EXPERIENCIA EN EL NEGOCIO YA QUE SE INICIO DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS, APERTURO EL NEGOCIO CON RECURSOS PROPIOS VENDIENDO SOLO GASEOSAS, ELLA YA HA TENIDO EXPERIENCIA EN OTRAS ENTIDADES Y  A LA FECHA NO CUENTA CON SALDOS, TIENE TRES HIJAS DE LAS CUALES SOLO DOS ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, FANNY SUEÑA CON DARLE LO MEJOR A SUS HIJAS, POR LO QUE ELLA TRABAJA DIARIAMENTE ATENDIENDO SU BODEGA DE FORMA CALIDA Y AMABLE, ES POR ESO QUE SUS CLIENTE SE SIENTEN AGUSTO CON SU ATENCION, FANNY  SOLICITA FINANCIAMIENTO PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO, COMPRAR MERCADERIA Y AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO, ELLA TIENE CAPACIDAD Y VOLUNTAD DE PAGO ADEMAS DE CONTAR CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES EN LA ZONA DONDE VIVE.
texts.en:
Fanny, 43, lives in her parents’ house; she has a small general store in their home. She has been in this line of work for 5 years so she has a lot of experience in it. She opened the store using her own funds and used to sell just soft-drinks. She has had credit history with other financial institutions but currently has no outstanding debts. She has three daughters two of whom are still school aged. Fanny dreams with giving the best to her daughters and this is why she works so hard every day in her store tending to her customers with kindness and warmth; this is why her customers are so pleased with the attention they receive. Fanny is asking for funding to invest in her business buying stock items to enlarge her inventory. She has both the capacity and the willingness to repay as well as good personal references from her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jesulina

texts.es:
Jesulina pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Jesulina, tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la compra y venta de lácteos, ella vende sus productos lácteos en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. Ella también se dedica a  cosechar y sembrar maíz y papa pero es solo para consumo de su familia.  

Jesulina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar insumos para la producción de queso de tipo andino y prensado.
 
Jesulina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jesulina, 37, is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” (Virgin Mary of Inquilpata) communal bank. She is married and has two children. She lives in Inquilpata, Anta district, Cusco department. She sells dairy products at the Friday Inquilpata-Anta Farmers Market. She also farms corn and potato but only for family consumption. Jesulina is a hard-working, enterprising woman who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life and help her family through her own daily efforts. She needs funds to buy ingredients to make Andean-style and pressed cheese. Jesulina is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese-making ingredients.

loans.name: Graciela Ester

texts.es:
La señora Graciela Ester B. R. se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y también artículos de primera necesidad.
Ella posee su puesto de venta en el mercado de la ciudad y muy temprano se traslada desde su casa hasta su negocio para realizar la venta de sus producto para esta actividad es apoyada por el marido.
 Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sus mercaderías(frutas y verduras) y otros gastos para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Graciela Ester B. R. sells fruit, vegetables and also basic necessity items. She has a stall in the city market very early in the morning she goes from her house to her business to sell her products. She is supported by her husband in this activity. She is asking for this loan to purchase her merchandise (fruits and vegetables) and for other housing expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase onions, tomatoes, apples, pears, pineapples, oranges, and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA D. INQUILPATA” D. la Asociación Arariwa. 

Juliana, tiene 67 años, es casada y tiene siete hijos, ella vive en la comunidad D. Inquilpata del distrito D. Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta D. comestibles y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta D. queso, leche y venta D. animales menores, ella venD. sus productos en el Campo Ferial D. la Comunidad Campesina D. Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. 

Juliana es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar detergente, arroz y muchas cosas más. 
 
Juliana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juliana, 67, is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “VIRGEN MARIA D. INQUILPATA” (Virgin Mary of Inquilpata) communal bank. She is married and has 7 children. She lives in Inquilpata, Anta district, Cusco department. Her main commercial activity is food sales but she also sells cheese, milk and small farm animals at Friday’s Inquilpata-Anta Farmers Market. Juliana is a hard-working, enterprising woman who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life and to proviD. the best for her family through her own daily efforts. She needs funding to buy detergent, rice and many other things. Juliana is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy detergent, rice and many other items.

loans.name: Maria Asunta

texts.es:
María Asunta pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

María Asunta, tiene 30 años y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de comestibles y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta de queso, leche y venta de ganado, ella vende sus productos en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. 

María Asunta es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar detergente, arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, cerveza  y muchas cosas más. 
 
María Asunta se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María Asunta, 30, is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” (Virgin Mary of Inquilpata) communal bank. She lives in Inquilpata, Anta district, Cusco department. Her main commercial activity is Cosmetics sales but she also sells cheese, milk and livestock at Friday’s Inquilpata-Anta Farmers Market. María Asunta is a hard-working, enterprising woman who always seeks ways to get ahead in life and provide the best for her family through her own daily efforts. She needs funds to buy detergent, rice, sugar, soft-drinks, beer and many other things. María Asunta is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy detergent, rice, sugar, soft-drinks, beer and many other items.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista tiene 46 años, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a la venta de madera, actividad que es su principal fuente de ingreso y la de su familia. Ella trae la madera de provincias y las vende en su ciudad a un precio mayor, generándole buenas ganancias. El trabajo es duro, por ello cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, y gracias a esta ayuda podrá muy pronto ampliar su negocio. Ella necesita capital para comprar mayor cantidad de madera y de esa manera obtener más ingresos, además en estas épocas del año las ventas son buenas, por tal motivo necesita comprar en mayor cantidad. Por el momento continuará trabajando arduamente como lo viene haciendo, porque sabe que solo así lograra el éxito en su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en los viajes que hará para traer mayor cantidad de madera y de esa manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Evarista, 46, lives with her partner and their three children in her own home. She has sold lumber for the last three years; this is her family’s main source of income. She brings wood from the provinces to sell in the city at a higher price thus generating good profits. It’s hard work but she can count on her family’s help and thanks to this funding will be able to expand her business. She needs capital to buy larger amounts of wood so that earnings will be higher; besides, this time of year sales are good so she needs to have larger amounts in stock. For the present, she will continue to work hard like she’s been doing so far because she knows this is the only way her business will succeed. This is her 1st loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with her repayments. She will use the requested funds to pay for the trips she will make to bring larger amounts of wood thus increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Alberto forma parte del banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”, tiene 45 años, es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos. Juan Alberto trabaja en una empresa donde producen tejas y ladrillos y su esposa trabaja vendiendo papas en el mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabajan en el negocio de venta de papas y les va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en el trabajo. 

Juan Alberto es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un  mejor futuro a sus hijos, el requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más semillas. 
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto, 45, is a member of “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” (Virgin Mary of Inquilpata) communal bank; he lives with his partner and their four children. Juan Alberto works for a firm that manufactures bricks and ceiling tiles; his wife works as a potato merchant in Cusco’s Huancaro market. They have been potato farmers for quite some time now and they do well thanks to the effort they put into their work. Juan Alberto is a hard-working, enterprising young man who is always looking for ways to provide the best for his family and to get ahead in life through his own daily efforts. He needs funds to buy more seed. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Inquilpata is an hour and 10 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una emprendedora joven de 26 años de edad, vive con sus padres en casa de ellos, donde le han otorgado un espacio propio. Hace más de 3 años se dedica en la venta de productos especiales para la preparación de tortas, es decir es un producto que contiene los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar tortas, tan solo se agrega leche, huevos y agua para poder obtener este rico postre. Por la facilidad que brinda este producto, es muy solicitado, y eso le da mucha ventaja a Nancy por que gana más clientes.  Además de vender este producto, también se dedica en la preparación de tortas y demás postres, que los elabora por cada pedido que tiene. Sus vecinos convencidos de las buenas dotes culinarias que ella posee, siempre recurren a ella cuando tienen algún tipo de actividad como cumpleaños, fiestas de 15 años y hasta matrimonios. Nancy quiere mejorar su trabajo  y en un futuro quisiera tener un gran local donde pueda exhibir mejor sus postres. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería y utensilios para la preparación de tortas.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 26-year-old enterprising young woman; she lives in her own quarters in her parents’ house. For over three years she has sold products used in making tortas (cakes). In other words, this is a product that contains all the necessary ingredients for making the tortas, one only need add milk, eggs and water to get this delicious dessert. Because of the ease in preparation of this product it is highly sought-after; this is a great advantage for Nancy because it generates lots of customers for her. In addition to selling the product, Nancy also makes cakes and other desserts on order. Her neighbors are convinced by her good culinary touches and always come to her when they have a special occasion like a birthday, a quinceañera party or even weddings. Nancy wants to improve her work and would love to have a large locale to exhibit her desserts in the future. This is her 1st loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with repayments. She will use the requested funds to buy merchandise and utensils for cake preparation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and utensils.

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es:
Jeronima pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA D. INQUILPATA” D. la Asociación Arariwa. 

Jeronima tiene 48 años y tiene cuatro hijos D. los cuales depenD. todavía D. la socia, ella vive en la comunidad D. Inquilpata del distrito D. Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta D. chanchos y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta D. queso y leche, ella venD. sus productos en el Campo Ferial D. la Comunidad Campesina D. Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. 

Jeronima es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar chanchos. 
 
Jeronima se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jeronima belongs to the community bank “VIRGEN MARIA D. INQUILPATA” with Asociación Arariwa. Jeronima is 48 years old and has four children that still depend on her. She lives in the community of Inquilpata in the district of Anta in the department of Cusco. Her principal economic activity is the sale of pigs and her complementary economic activity is the sale of cheese and milk. She sells the products in the Fair Grounds in the Country Community of Inquilpata-Anta on Fridays. Jeronima is am entrepreneurial and hard working woman that at every moment finds the opportunities to get ahead and with her daily strength to help her family. She needs the loan to buy pigs. Jeronima is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to complete the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jeronima needs the loan to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
La señora M. ya tiene unos 20 años de experiencia en la actividad del negocio de venta de productos de consumo , ella vende productos como arroz , frijoles , azúcar que es para la alimentación diaria gracias a su negocio ella ha logrado salir adelante ya que con los créditos brindados por ceprodel para su negocio este ha aumentado sus productos de ventas y vender mas 

Este es un cuarto crédito el cual solicita para la compra de mas productos de consumo ya que con estas ventas ella ha logrado mejorar su condición de vida
texts.en:
La señora M. ya tiene unos 20 años de experiencia en la actividad del negocio de venta de productos de consumo , ella vende productos como arroz , frijoles , azúcar que es para la alimentación diaria gracias a su negocio ella ha logrado salir adelante ya que con los créditos brindados por ceprodel para su negocio este ha aumentado sus productos de ventas y vender mas Este es un cuarto crédito el cual solicita para la compra de mas productos de consumo ya que con estas ventas ella ha logrado mejorar su condición de vida

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de bienes de consumo como arroz , azúcar , aceite , jabones para la venta etc.

loans.name: Matiasa

texts.es:
Matiasa pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Matiasa tiene 39 años y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales depende todavía de la socia, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, pollos y chanchos y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta de ropa, ella vende sus productos en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. 

Matiasa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar chanchos y gallinas. 
 
Matiasa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Matiasa belongs to the borrowing group “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” with partner organization Asociación Arariwa. Matiasa is 39 and has five children that depend on her. She lives in the community of Inquilpata in the district of Anta in the department of Cusco. Her principle economic activity is the sale of small animals, for example guinea pigs, hens and chickens, and pigs. Her complimentary economic activity is clothing sales. She sells her products at the Fair Grounds at the Country Community of Inquilpata-Anta on Fridays. Matiasa is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman that finds every opportunity to get ahead and with her daily strength helps her family at every opportunity, she needs this loan to buy pigs and hens. Matiasa is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to completing the payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Matiasa needs the loan to buy pigs and hens

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Martha tiene 34 años y tiene dos hijos de los cuales depende todavía de la socia, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, arroz, leche, etc. ella vende sus productos en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. Su actividad económica complementaria es alquilar maquinaria para construcción de casas como por ejemplo vibradora y mezcladora de cemento. 

Martha es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más.    
 
Martha se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Martha pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Martha is 34 years old and has two children that depend on her. She lives in the community of Inquilpata in the district of Anta in the department of Cusco. Her principle activity is the sale of food products like: sugar, noodles, rice, milk, etc. She sells products at the Fair Grounds at the Country Community of Inquilpata-Anta on Fridays. Her complementary economic activity is to rent machinery for the construction of houses, for example a concrete vibrator and a cement mixer. Martha is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman that finds every opportunity to get ahead and with her daily strength helps her family at every opportunity, she needs this loan to buy merchandise like rice sugar, and many other things. Martha is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to completing the payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Martha needs the loan to buy merchandise, for example rice, sugar and many other things

loans.name: Beneranda

texts.es:
Beneranda tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Santa Rosa, una zona cuya economía depenD. principalmente D. la pesca, se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. diez años a confeccionar artesanalmente paños, fundas y fajas, ella confecciona los productos por pedidos y debido a la calidad con la que los diseña ya se ha vuelto conocida en el rubro, actualmente tiene un grupo D. clientes fijos que recurren a solicitar sus servicios, las prendas que confecciona son utilizadas por los lugareños en diversas fiestas y reuniones sociales.

Beneranda nos comenta que esta actividad le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar ya que, como pescador, el no percibe ingresos D. manera pemanente debido a las continuas temporadas D. veda.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas materiales (hilos y telas) con los cuales pueda ampliar su producción y percibir ingresos adicionales por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar su objetivo.

Beneranda es una madre bastante trabajadora y que siempre ha luchado por sacar adelante a los suyos, en la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer responsable y D. confianza. En la fotografía nos muestra un paño recientemente bordado.
texts.en:
Beneranda, 50, is married and lives with her husband in Santa Rosa district, primarily a fishing area, located about 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over ten years she has maD. woven crafts like wraps, scarfs and belts to order. Thanks to the high quality of her items she has become very well-known in the field and currently has a group of regular customers that repeatedly come by to ask for her services. Locals wear her items during social reunions and various fiestas. Beneranda tells us that this activity has helped her husband support the family because, as a fisherman, his earnings aren’t steady because of the continuous seasonal fishing bans. She wants to expand her business buying more fabric and threads so that production and earnings will grow. She is asking for her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach this goal. Beneranda is quite a hard-working mother who has always struggled to get her family ahead. In her neighborhood she is well known and her neighbors consider her to be responsible and trustworthy. In the photo she shows us a recently-completed embroidered scarf.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Mariela tiene 29 años y tiene un hijo, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, cuyes, gallinas, etc. ella vende sus productos en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. Su actividad económica complementaria es producir y vender queso. 

Mariela es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar insumos como por ejemplo leche, sal y muchas cosas más que se necesitan para producir queso.    
 
Mariela se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mariela, 29, is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” (Virgin Mary of Inquilpata) communal bank. She has a son and they live in Inquilpata, Anta district, Cusco department. Her main commercial activity is raising small farm animals like, pigs, guinea pigs, chickens, etc. She sells her products at Friday’s Inquilpata-Anta Farmers Market; she also makes and sells cheese. Mariela is a hard-working, enterprising woman who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life and provide the best for her family through her own daily efforts. She needs funding to buy cheese-making ingredients like, milk, salt and many other items. Mariela is grateful for the opportunity offered to her by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese-making ingredients.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive con su pareja, quien se dedica a la venta de chatarra y su hija Kimberly de 11 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace más de dos años se dedica a la venta de cortinas, además apoya  a su esposo en el negocio de reciclaje, venta de chatarra y crianza de animales, es así que toda la familia se une para salir adelante. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le da independencia económica,  pues le genera un ingreso extra a su familia. Es así que se encuentra ocupada de 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, la ventaja de este horario, es que puede disponer de ella, para poder cuidar de sus hijos y su familia.  El negocio de chatarra esta en sociedad con sus hermanos, por lo que le va bien. Tanto para Ana como para su esposo, es la de independizarse del negocio familiar poniendo su propio negocio de reciclaje y poder administrar las ganancias e inversiones en su empresa. Aunque sabe que este camino no será nada fácil, pero tiene muchas esperanzas de poder cumplir con sus metas. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de cortinas así como conseguir chatarra para el negocio que tiene con su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana, 32, is a hard-working woman; she lives with her partner who sells recyclables and their daughter, Kimberly, 11, in their own home. For over two years she has sold curtains but also helps her husband with his business selling recyclables and raising small farm animals so that the entire family can get ahead. She enjoys her work very much because it provides her financial independence generating extra family income. Her business keeps her busy from 9am until 8pm and the advantage of this schedule is that she can watch over her family and children. The recyclable business is in partnership with her siblings so all goes well. Both Ana and her husband would like to become independent from their relatives setting up their own business and managing their own profits and investments. Although she realizes that this is a difficult path she hopes to be able to reach her goals. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy a larger amount of curtains and to get recyclables for the business she has with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy curtains and recyclables.

loans.name: Conis

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo comarca la carreta la señora Conis C. B., ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias y forestales con las cuales obtiene sus ingresos y le proveen el sostén necesario para su mantención y la de su familia la que consta de sus tres hijas y esposo con quien realiza la mayor parte de estas actividades, dentro de las que destacan la siembra de maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo y en algunos casos Jamaica, también se dedican a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar los que le proveen a demás de ingresos la base fundamental para la dieta de su familia, dichas actividades son realizadas en una jornada de 7 horas.
La señora Conis C. B. solicita este financiamiento para la compra de un lote de terreno de 1 mz para asegurar una mejor mantención para su hato ganadero.
texts.en:
En el municipio de somotillo comarca la carreta la señora Conis C. B., ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias y forestales con las cuales obtiene sus ingresos y le proveen el sostén necesario para su mantención y la de su familia la que consta de sus tres hijas y esposo con quien realiza la mayor parte de estas actividades, dentro de las que destacan la siembra de maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo y en algunos casos Jamaica, también se dedican a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar los que le proveen a demás de ingresos la base fundamental para la dieta de su familia, dichas actividades son realizadas en una jornada de 7 horas. La señora Conis C. B. solicita este financiamiento para la compra de un lote de terreno de 1 mz para asegurar una mejor mantención para su hato ganadero.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra una manzana de terreno.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca la pimienta el señor Julio Cesar V. G., ha dedicado su vida al desarrollo de productos agropecuarios como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo, también realiza la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar, con dichos rubros asegura la mantención de su familia constituida por su esposa y tres hijos quienes también colaboran con la actividades diarias, además de estas obligaciones también se dedica a realizar  trabajos de corte y aserrado de madera para la construcción de viviendas y también madera para uso industrial, solicita este financiamiento para la compra de una moto cierra ya que la que actualmente tiene esta bastante deteriorada y de esta manera asegurar un mejor trabajo, lo que le traerá consigo un mejor ingreso para su familia y la realización de  actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
En el municipio de somotillo comarca la pimienta el señor Julio Cesar V. G., ha dedicado su vida al desarrollo de productos agropecuarios como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo, también realiza la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar, con dichos rubros asegura la mantención de su familia constituida por su esposa y tres hijos quienes también colaboran con la actividades diarias, además de estas obligaciones también se dedica a realizar trabajos de corte y aserrado de madera para la construcción de viviendas y también madera para uso industrial, solicita este financiamiento para la compra de una moto cierra ya que la que actualmente tiene esta bastante deteriorada y de esta manera asegurar un mejor trabajo, lo que le traerá consigo un mejor ingreso para su familia y la realización de actividades agropecuarias.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra una moto cierra.

loans.name: Neris Irela

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca palo grande sector santa Paula, la señora Neris Irela M. J.se dedica a la producción agropecuaria dentro de las principales actividades o rubros que esta desarrollo están la producción de Maíz, Ajonjolí, sorgo, y frijol blanco, así como la crianza de ganado bobino. Porcino y aviar dichas actividades le proporciona a demás de ingresos, alimentos y estabilidad en su parte financiera ya que estas actividades son parte fundamental para el desarrollo economico de su familia, las labores diarias son realizadas en conjunto familiar con sus esposo y cuatro hijos, quienes colaboran con éstas, la señora Neris Irela M. J.solicita este financiamiento para la compra de insumos para el establecimiento de tres manzanas de maíz con que pretende comprar una vaca al momento que obtenga su cosecha.
texts.en:
En el municipio de somotillo comarca palo grande sector santa Paula, la señora Neris Irela M. J.se dedica a la producción agropecuaria dentro de las principales actividades o rubros que esta desarrollo están la producción de Maíz, Ajonjolí, sorgo, y frijol blanco, así como la crianza de ganado bobino. Porcino y aviar dichas actividades le proporciona a demás de ingresos, alimentos y estabilidad en su parte financiera ya que estas actividades son parte fundamental para el desarrollo economico de su familia, las labores diarias son realizadas en conjunto familiar con sus esposo y cuatro hijos, quienes colaboran con éstas, la señora Neris Irela M. J.solicita este financiamiento para la compra de insumos para el establecimiento de tres manzanas de maíz con que pretende comprar una vaca al momento que obtenga su cosecha.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para siembra de cultivos.

loans.name: Leocadia Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria tiene 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus hijos. Ella se 
dedica a la venta en su bodega la cual inicio aproximadamente hace 12 años, con 
capital propio producto de ahorros. Valeria ya posee experiencia en el negocio con el 
cual apoya a los gastos de su casa. Ella posee una gran cantidad de clientes a los 
cuales los atiende de manera muy amable y calida, por esto y por sus buenos precios es 
que los clientes regresan a su negocio, el sueños de Valeria es incrementar su 
negocio, ya que esto hará que sus ingresos incrementen y así poder darle buena 
educación a sus hijos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
Valeria, 56, lives in her own home with her children. She has had a general store for about 12 years that she set up originally with her own savings. Valeria has a lot of experience in this line of work; it provides for her household’s expenses. She has quite a few regular customers that she cares for with kindness and warmth. Added to her fair prices, this keeps them coming back to her store. Valeria’s dream is to enlarge her business so that income will increase and she will be able to provide a good education for her children. She is asking for funds to buy stock merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna P. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. Elna owns & operates a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business, providing services to local community members. Elna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Elna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elna is requesting a new loan, her third, of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Thav

texts.en: Thav T., 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells dried fish for an income of about $8 US per day. Her husband is construction worker, earning an income of $5 US per day to help cover the family expenses.  T. is requesting a loan of $500 US to buy more fish for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun S., 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells fish for an income of about $4 US per day. Her husband is motorcycle repairman and hired to dig wells, earning an income of $5 US per day to help cover the family expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of $600 US to buy more fish for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy fish for resale

loans.name: Victoria

Victoria O. is from the village of Villalin Panaon, Mis. Occ. She is 35 years old. Victoria is married and has 3 school-aged children. Victoria owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as, additional capital for her business. Victoria is requesting a fourth loan, for 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia L. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Claudia is married and has 4 adult children. Claudia owns & operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Claudia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Claudia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Claudia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Claudia is requesting a fourth loan, for 7000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Ev

texts.en:
Ev O. is 57 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She sells mangos and weaves silk cloth for a profit of $3.30 US every day, while her husband is a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes $3 US per day. This couple has four children, three of whom are employed as garment factory workers. 

Ev O. would like to take out a loan of $1,200 US so that she can purchase a motorbike to transport mangos to sell at the market. (Ev O. is pictured with her husband at home.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for product transport

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Suy S. is 44 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She makes cow ties and raises pigs to earn a living and is able to make about $1.30 US of profit every day. Her husband is a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes about $3.30 US per day. This couple together has three children, one is in school and two are employed as workers. Suy S. is asking for a loan of $800 US to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.

loans.use: To perchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie E. is from the city of Sta. Cruz, Ozamiz City. She is 33 years old. Winnie is married and has 2 school-aged children. Winnie's picture was taken in her mini-office.To make a living, Winnie operates a family member's business venture making and selling food products. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling food like cassava cake, torta, pastries, etc. to local community members. Winnie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Winnie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Winnie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Winnie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Winnie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anavil

texts.en:
Anavil, 40, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. Her business in rice farming is a big help to her family. It is from that they get the food they eat every day. And also a way to repay the amount borrowed from Community Economic Ventures, Inc.

She is the mother of a 9-year-old child. She lacks capital to provide all the farm supplies needed for her farm. That’s why she sought help from CEVI and asked for a loan of 6,000 Php. This will really help with her business venture.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her grocery store.

The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling 'banana cue' (fried banana on a stick) in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jovelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Jovelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

texts.en:
Margarita B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old. Margarita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Margarita owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing tricycle services in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Margarita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Margarita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
