texts.en: Mrs. Sambath S. is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Kampong Pou village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Leang May, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice on to earn a living. Mrs. Sambath S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming. Aside from farming, Mr. Leang May is a fisherman who can earn only a small income to support his family. This couple has six children; four are students in the local school and also support their parents' farming while two other are too young to study or work. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Madame Korotoumou Koné est une femme divorcée de 42ans qui vit  chez son père avec ses trois enfants  dans le quartier central  de Kolondièba (troisième région de la république du Mali).  
Kadiatou fait l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Elle est très sollicitée et appréciée à Kolondièba. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse,  elle décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après trois prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Elle s’approvisionne sur le marché de Kolondièba les jours de foire et revend aux grossistes venant de Bamako et Sikasso.
Avec ce prêt, il compte avoir, 400  kilogrammes de grains d’arachide, 1000  kilogrammes de mil qu’elle stockera pour revendre à  une période où le cours sera plus  élevé.
 Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  40. 000 FCFA. Le bénéfice  sera  réinvesti dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Mrs. Korotoumou Koné is a divorced lady, who is 42 years old and lives at her father's house with her three children in the central district of Kolondièba (third region of the Republic of Mali). Korotoumou stocks and cells cereals. She is much sought after and appreciated in Kolondièba. In order to satisfy her ever increasing clientele, she decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. After three group loans, which were all repaid on time, she is on her first individual loan. She gets her supplies at the market in Kolondièba on fair days and resells to wholesalers coming from Bamako and Sikasso. With this loan she is hoping to have 400kg of peanut grains and 1000 kg of millet, which she will stock to resell at a time when the price is more expensive. She is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA. This profit will be reinvested in her business

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Car Repair

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en:
Sriyani is a 44-year-old married woman living with her husband and two daughters. She lives in the town of Telijjawila, in the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She has a beauty salon which her husband is also involved in.  They have lots of experience with this type of business and have been running their shop successfully for two years.

Sriyani has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help  her business and purchase materials for the salon.  She is an honest and hard-working woman.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy materials for the beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm tools like hoes, fertilizer and mulches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married  with  six children and her husband owns a restaurantin Wandegeya one of Kampala city suburbs. All her children to school. She resides in and owns a house where she stays with additional family members. Margaret owns a wooden store at her home where she sells charcoal.  She works seven days week. Margaret incurs transport costs to and from buying bags of charcoal from the villages of Luwero district and goes to the villages twice a month. Besides this charcoal business, she also roasts maize and sweet potatoes. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal and a basket of maize. She joined MCDT because they were working with poor women in groups. Margaret aspires to see her business grow big so that she could get enough profits to build commercial houses in the available space near her home.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, maize and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
On the face of it, M. Joseph has come a long way with his cattle-selling business which he started with the savings he got from his tea leaf picking and packing small-scale business. Having had determination and a vision to change for better, the married father of four children invested in a farm stock of cows which he grazes and sells after some time to earn some profit.

Joseph’s main challenge is poor quality animals that do not grow very fast to bring quick returns. With this loan he will deworm and also buy more cows to sell. This will help him expand his business and also increase his revenue to meet family needs

loans.use: To stock more cows into his farm and buy deworming medicine

loans.name: Dancéni

texts.fr:
Monsieur Dancéni Samaké  est un homme marié de 38 ans, polygame   avec cinq  enfants, il  réside dans le quartier des enseignants  de la ville de  Kolondièba (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Dancéni, n’ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, s’intéressa très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment la réparation de vélos et mobylettes. 
Il dispose d’un magasin qui se trouve au cœur du marché de Kolondièba dans lequel il vend des pièces détachées pour vélos et mobylettes, des vélos neufs et occasions, en plus de ses activités de réparateurs. 
Pour augmenter son capital il décide d’adhérer au programme  crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel.  
Il compte  acheter une importante quantité de pièces détachées à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Il revend ses pièces en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse  et variée. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000 FCFA par mois qui sera essentiellement réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Dancéni Samaké is a married man who is 38 years old, polygamous and has five children. He lives in the teachers' district of the town of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Dancéni, who did not have the opportunity to go to school, began to be interested in income-generating activities at a very early age, notably repairing bicycles and mobilettes. He has a shop which lies at the heart of the market in Kolondièba, and from here he sells spare parts for bicycles and mobilettes, new and second-hand bicycles, and he also carries out his repair work here. In order to increase his capital he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and he is taking out his first individual loan. He is planning to buy a significant quantity of spare parts from wholesalers in Bamako (the capital of Mali). He resells these parts on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a diverse and varied customer base. He hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA the bulk of which will be reinvested in his business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Art

texts.en:
Mr. Art S. is 57 years old, and he is a villager who lives in Roka village in Kandal province. He is a widower with a child who is a farm laborer and also supports his father's farming business.
 
Mr. Art S. owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice to earn the family's living. In order to support this farming, Mr. Art S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support this purpose.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.name: Moussa Tièdian

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Tièdian Koné est un homme marié de 56 ans qui vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier central  de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région  administrative de la république Mali. 
Moussa Tièdian fait l’achat vente de céréales et de pièces détachées pour motos et vélos depuis maintenant 10 ans. 
Son magasin de pièces détachées, sis au cœur du marché central de Kolondièba est d’accès  facile et très fréquenté. 
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, il adhère au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son quatrième prêt.    
Il  compte acheter une grande quantité de pièces détachées à Bamako. Avec une clientèle constituée de réparateurs de motos et vélos, il vend généralement au comptant et  à détail. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA par mois qui servira à   prendra en charges  les frais scolaire et de santé  au niveau de la famille.
texts.en:
Monsieur Moussa Tièdian Koné is a married man aged 56 ans who lives in a polygamous family in downtown Kolondièba, in Mali's third administrative region. He has been buying and selling cereals, and also motorbike and bicycle parts, for 10 years. His parts store, in the central market of Kolondièba, is easy to get to and very busy. To increase his capital, he belongs to the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. He is currently paying back his fourth loan from the program, He plans to buy a large number of parts in Bamako [Mali's capital]. He usually sells for cash, and at retail, to his customers, who are motorbike and bicycle mechanics. He is predicting income of 50.000 FCFA a month to pay for school fees and family health care.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy motorbike and bicycle parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used shoes to sell

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mr. Khoeurn K., 37 years old, is a villager who lives in Peam Sala village in Kandal province. He is a fisherman who can earn a small income to support his family. In order to support this business, Mr. Khoeurn K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a boat and a boat machine to support his fishing business. His wife, Mrs. Pov Chim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows crops. This couple has five children; one is a grass seller, while the others attend the local school and also support their parent's business. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and a boat machine.

loans.name: Mrs. Vannara Lay Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This group loan has sixteen people in it, who all live in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. Mrs. Vannara L. is the village bank president, and was selected by the members. Each member will use their loan for different purposes.

Mrs. L. is a vegetable seller in the local market, and her husband is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he grows crops to sell to support his family. In the crop field, this couple has a problem because their field is ready to plant, but they do not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Vannara L. decided to seek a loan to buy bamboo and a hose to grow a crop. She has four children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the others are too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy bamboo and a hose to grow a crop.

loans.name: Minh's Group

texts.en:
Minh T. N. was born in 1950. She lives in Luong Quy village, Xuan Non commune, Dong Anh district. She has a store at home where she serves customers from the local community. She has three sons who are married while her youngest son lives at home with her and her husband. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2005 and repaid her loans punctually. Minh T. N. is the group leader of a five-member loan group. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to expand her store.
About the other borrowers in her group
Nhien T. N. was born in 1969. She breeds pigs, and wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy pig food.
Thuy T. N. was born in 1960. She has three children. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
Ha T. T. P. was born in 1974. She raises chickens, and wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy chicken food.
Nhung T. N. was born in 1952. She raises 14 pigs and some poultry. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba D. is married to her wonderful husband who is a farmer. She has no educational background. Aba sells plastic bowls, containers and also fries doughnuts at Abura. She has been selling containers and bowls for some time now. Her husband is a farmer.  

Aba uses her income to help her husband with the general welfare of the home.  Aba will use the loan to purchase more plastic containers as demand for them is continuously increasing. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save to build a shop where she can store her plastics for customers to come and buy.

loans.use: purchase more plastic containers for resale

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Zoumana  Koné est un homme marié de 53 ans et père de 22 enfants qui vit  avec ses trois femmes et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle dans le village de Soromana, sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba  (troisième région administrative de la  république  Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école depuis le premier cycle fondamental (système éducatif Malien), Zoumana  Koné  a tenté plusieurs activités économiques notamment la vente d’habits, de chaussures et de tasses, mais sans succès, alors il décida de s’intéresser à l’achat vente de céréales. Cette activité (qu’il a appris cette activité auprès de son grand-frère) lui réussi et il dispose d’un magasin de vente. 
Avec une dixième année d’expérience dans cette activité, il est très connu et sollicité.
Zoumana Koné est à son cinquième prêt après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre précédents.
Il veut acheter avec son prêt, 1000kg de maïs, 500kg d’arachide et 500kg de mil auprès des producteurs pour les revendre au comptant et en détail aux revendeurs et consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Zoumana Koné compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 .000FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son magasin,  assurer les dépenses de la famille (santé, scolarité, nourriture) et acheter des animaux.
texts.en:
Mr Zoumana Koné is a married man who is 53 years old and father to 22 children. He lives with his three wives and their children in a large traditional family in the village of Soromana, in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, in the prefecture of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After leaving school after the first basic cycle (according to the Malian education system), Zoumana Koné tried his hand at several economic activities, notably the sale of clothes, shoes and cups, but he did not have any success so he decided to turn to buying cereals. This activity (which he learnt with his older brother) has been a success and he has a shop to sell his goods. With ten years experience in this activity he is well known and sought after. Zoumana Koné is on his fifth loan, having repaid the four previous loans without problem. With this loan he wants to buy from producers 1000kg of rice, 500kg of peanuts and 500kg of millet in order to resell them for cash and on a retail basis to retailers and consumers. With this loan, Mr. Zoumana Koné is counting on making a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA which will be used to extend his shop, to cover the family expenses (health, schooling, food) and to buy some animals.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Zam

texts.en: Zam is married and her husband is a machine operator in a coffee factory at Kawempe.  The family resides in and owns a house. Zam doesn’t take care of any additional family members.  Zam owns a stall selling bananas. She also has other jobs including a fish and a charcoal stall. She works seven days week and sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, fish and charcoal. She aspires to see her business grow big and build commercial houses. She has access to electricity and piped water and her monthly ??? include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, fish and charcoal

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa B. is happily married and lives with her three children. She has received no formal education.  Yaa buys onions in bags and sells them in both small and large quantities to her customers at Abura. Her husband is a teacher.  

Yaa uses the income she generates from her sales to help her husband in the general up-keep of the home.  Yaa will use the loan to purchase onions for resale as well as yams and maize which is going to serve as an additional trade to invest in. With the new income that is going to come as a result of the loan received, Yaa plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: purchase onions for resale as well as yams and maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ramya

texts.en:
Ramya  is a 54-year-old married woman living with her husband and son in the town of Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka. Her son and husband  help her  in managing a coir business, which consists of weaving the fibers from coconut shells into household products such as floor mats.  She uses the income from the family business to help cover daily living expenses. They have managed this business for six years now. 

Ramya is known as a very honest and hard-working woman who is willing to help others in her community when needed. Ramya has requested a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC to buy coir.

Thank you very much for taking the time to consider supporting this loan!

loans.use: to purchase coir to make woven products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of corn

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba E. is married. She has received junior high education.  Aba sells slippers and shoes, moving from one house to another at Abura. She was on her way to sell her goods when she was photographed. Her husband is a driver. 

 Aba uses the income she is able to acquire from her sales to help her husband pay for their accommodations and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more slippers for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Aba plans to save to buy a shop to trade in.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 22 years old and single. He is a hardworking farmer in Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. He has been farming for the last two years with only one employee. His main produce has been bananas, but in the last two years he decided to venture into poultry farming. He sells his bananas to the local market. Nkubu is a region that is well known for banana farming, and this has led to insufficient markets for the produce. 

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs.30,000 to buy chicken layers (chickens reared mainly for egg production). He says the income from the sale of eggs will improve his family's living standard and enable him to educate his siblings. In the future he intends to expand his farming activities by buying another piece of land.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old and married with one child, aged 2 years. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 12 years with only one employee. He produces maize, bananas, and beans; all of which he sells to the local market. He also earns some income from a food kiosk he is operating in the area, a balast (concrete) business, and poultry farming.

He has successfully completed his first loan with Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs. 40,000 and has requested this loan for Kshs.70,000 to purchase a dairy goat and expand his poultry project. The income he will get from this loan he says will help educate his child and build a permanent house. His main challenge has been the poor road network which has affected his produce since most of them are perishable. In the future he intends to export bananas to foreign countries.

He added that he has received "perfect services from Juhudi Kilimo."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy goat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy goat and expand his poultry project

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Kadiatou C. est une femme mariée de 43ans qui vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier de Toumanbougou à Kolondièba (troisième  région administrative de la république  Mali. 
Kadiatou fait le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat vente d’habits, de chaussures, de tissus etc. 
Afin d’augmenter son capital et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son septième prêt et tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 35 complets de prêt-à-porter, 90 pagnes de wax  et 100 paires de chaussures.
Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé (Togo) un pays de la sous région. Avec une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, elle vend au comptant et souvent  à crédit.
Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  50.000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans les entreprises.
texts.en:
Mrs Kadiatou C. is a married woman, aged 43, who lives in a polygamous family in the neighborhood of Toumanbougou in Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Kadiatou sells various articles: clothes, shoes, fabrics, etc. She wants to increase her working capital to satisfy her customers, which is why she joined the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso. This is her seventh loan and all her previous loans have been repaid on schedule. Kadiatou will use her loan to buy 35 ready-to-wear suits, 90 lengths of wax pagnes (brightly colored African print cloth) and 100 pairs of shoes. She gets her supplies from Lomé in Togo, another country in West Africa. She sells for cash and often for credit to a clientele made up of women and men. Kadiatou expects to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs which she will reinvest in her business.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy suits, pagnes and shoes

loans.name: Koumba

texts.fr:
Madame Koumba B.  est une femme marée de 35ans qui vit  dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses quatre  enfants  dans le quartier Est de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région administrative de la république  Mali. 
Koumba fait de l’achat stockage vente de céréales. 
Pour augmenter son capital et faire plus de stocks, elle décida  d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Après dix  prêts solidaires tous bien remboursés, elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 400  kilogrammes de petit mil, 1000  kilogrammes de mil. 
Elle s’approvisionne sur le marché de Kolondièba les jours de foire et revend aux grossistes venant de Bamako et Sikasso, au comptant.
Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour renforcer le capital de l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs Koumba B., aged 35, is a married woman who lives in a monogamous family with her husband and her four children in the eastern outskirts of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Koumba buys cereals, then stocks and resells them. She wants to increase her working capital and her inventory, which is why she joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having repaid on schedule her previous ten solidarity loans, she applies now for her first individual loan. She will use her loan to buy 400 kilograms of small millet and 1000 kilograms of regular millet. She gets her supplies at the market in Kolondièba and resells for cash to wholesalers coming from Bamako and Sikasso. Koumba expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs which she will reinvest in her business to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Fifty-six year old Pamela is a widowed mother of five children, aged between 14 and 36 years. Two of the children are currently attending school. Pamela is a farmer in Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town, where she has been practicing mixed farming for four years. She has one permanent employee and two casual laborers. Pamela is a retired employee and depends on her pension pay to educate and cater for her family's needs. She also depends on the income from the sale of bananas, maize, and pawpaw (similar to a papaya) to the local market.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs.50,000 after successfully completing her first loan for Kshs.45,000. She will use this loan to start a poultry project and buy a dairy goat. Poor road networks and insufficient water for her crops is the main challenge for her, since this affects the marketing and produce from her farm. In the future she intends to expand her banana farming and start exporting pawpaws.

She says that "Juhudi Kilimo loans are flexible in terms of repayment period" and that she "intends to take more and more loans."

loans.use: To expand her poultry project.

loans.name: Benda

texts.fr:
Monsieur Benda Sangaré  est un homme marié de 33 ans, monogame, qui vit à Kalakan  avec ses  trois enfants et leur mère, dans la Préfecture de  Kolondièba, troisième région administrative de la république Mali. 
Benda fait le commerce de bétails depuis maintenant 4 ans, il est très sollicité et apprécié.
Afin augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit  de  Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son premier  prêt individuel. 
Il  compte acheter des bœufs dans les différentes foires de la préfecture de Kolondièba. Benda effectue sa vente au comptant et souvent à crédit, à Kolondièba à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de  bouchers. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50000 FCFA par mois qui   sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
Dans l’avenir Monsieur Sangaré compte aller vendre ses animaux dans les pays voisins pour avoir beaucoup plus de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mr Benda Sangaré is married and 33 years old. He lives with his three children and their mother in a monogamous household in the prefecture of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Benda has been a cattle trader for the past four years. His business is in high demand and appreciated. In order to boost his working capital, he joined the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first individual loan. He will buy oxen at several cattle fairs in the prefecture of Kolondièba. He sells for cash and often for credit to a clientele in Kolondièba made up mainly of butchers. Benda expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, which he will reinvest in his business. In future Benda plans to travel to the neighboring countries and sell his animals there. He expects to earn a much higher income from that undertaking.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Modibo

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modibo B. est un homme marié de 28 ans monogame, qui vit avec ses deux enfants et leur mère dans le quartier Ouest de la  ville de  Kolondièba dans la   troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Modibo est un éleveur qui fait l’achat vente de bétails depuis maintenant 4 ans. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier  prêt individuel. 
Il  envisage acheter quelques bœufs dans certains villages de la préfecture de Kolondièba pour  aller les revendre à Nièna,  Bougouni et quelques fois à Bamako (capitale du Mali), au comptant , aux revendeurs et aux bouchers.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 37.500 FCFA. qui servira à payer un terrain  à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr Modibo B. is married and 28 years old. He lives with his two children and their mother in a monogamous household in the western outskirts of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Modibo has been a cattle breeder and trader for the past four years. In order to boost his working capital, he joined the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first individual loan. He will buy a few oxen in the neighboring villages in the prefecture of Kolondièba and travel to Nièna, Bougouni and sometimes Bamako (the capital city of Mali) to sell his cattle for cash to resellers and butchers. Modibo expects to make a monthly profit of 37,500 CFA francs, which he will use to buy a plot of land for his future house.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Naluvuule Group, Kampala

texts.en:
Sylvia N. is the brown lady in front of the rest of the group in the group photo. She is a young enterprising 26-year-old married mother of four.

For the last five years, Sylvia has been operating a hardware business in Naluvule Trading center, Kampala. Her business has had its fair share of financial ups and downs but she has persisted in the wake of all this. As a testament to this, all her children, despite the rising costs of education, are in good schools.

Sylvia’s monthly profits are to the tune of 70,000 shillings per month. She envisions the prospect of building her business to be the premier hardware business in her operating area. Her business is in the run-up to achieving this milestone though she insists she needs this loan to be her invaluable resource. She is looking at buying more ceramic tiles, wheelbarrows, bags of cement and tins of paint.

loans.use: To buy boxes of ceramic tiles, wheelbarrows, bags of cement and tins of paint

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. cooks rice to sell at Abura. Ama has been through junior high school.  She is divorced and lives with her two children. Ama has been cooking rice for about two years now. She is solely responsible for the general upkeep of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more rice to cook to be able to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest into her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more rice to cook

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Sangaré  est un homme marié de 43ans qui est polygame et qui vit dans le village de N’Tjinina, dans une grande famille traditionnelle  dans la préfecture de  Kolondièba (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Moussa fait l’achat vente de bétails. Il a deux  ans d’expérience dans cette activité. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier  prêt individuel.
Il  compte acheter quelques bœufs dans la préfecture de Kolondièba pour aller les revendre à Nièna et Koumantou, au comptant rarement à crédit aux revendeurs et bouchers.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui  sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
Dans l’avenir Monsieur Sangaré ambitionne aller vendre ses animaux dans les pays voisins tels la Côte- d’Ivoire pour avoir beaucoup plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr Moussa Sangaré is a polygamous married man and 43 years old. He lives in a large traditional family in the village of N'Tjinina in the prefecture of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Moussa is a cattle trader with a 2-year-long experience. In order to boost his working capital, he joined the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first individual loan. He will buy a few oxen in the prefecture of Kolondièba and travel to Nièna and Koumantou to sell them for cash and less often for credit to resellers and butchers. Moussa expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, which he will reinvest in his business. His future ambition is to sell his animals in the adjacent countries, such as Côte d'Ivoire, and earn a much higher profit.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Rono

texts.en:
Rono K. is a 23 year old farmer, who lives near Litein in the South Rift Valley of Kenya. He's been farming for seven years already and sells his milk to local traders. He also earns income from a small-scale tea production. He says that the main challenges to his business have been a lack of capital to invest in his business and that there are no nearby veterinary services.

Rono successfully completed a previous loan for Kshs. 40,000 through Juhudi Kilimo and requested this loan, also for Kshs. 40,000, to purchase another dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his farm and allow him to pay school fees for his younger siblings. In the future, he would like to build a modern dairy unit and plant enough feed for his cows and expand his farm.

He added that "Juhudi has really improved his dairy business."

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa K. cooks 'banku' (a staple cornmeal dish) for sale at Abura. Adjoa also sells some of the maize she buys from the market. She has received senior high education.  She is a widow and lives with her two children. She is responsible for feeding, clothing and providing shelter for her family. Her loan will be used to buy additional bags of maize to cook 'banku' for sale. She hopes to use the new income from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy additional bags of maize to cook 'banku' for sale

loans.name: Chandrakanthi

texts.en:
Chandrakanthi  is a 48-year-old married woman living in Hikkaduwa, Galle, with her three sons and husband. Chandrakanthi has been managing her business by herself, which consists of selling grocery items. She purchases the items wholesale, then later sells them retail. She devotes her full effort to her grocery business, step by step, and uses the income to help support her family, which her husband and children also provide some support to. 

Chandrakanthi has managed her business for five years now, running it herself. She has asked for a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to purchase grocery items to sell.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
John K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. He is 69 years old, married, and has six children whose ages range from two to 24 years old. John is a college graduate.

For five years, John has been running a general store on Duport Road, which is near the Red Light Market in Paynesville, Liberia.  He says he sells goods that customers demand, which keeps them returning. One of the challenges he faces is that there are many competitors in the market.

John plans to use his 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more provisions. His goal is to improve the living standard of his family members.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, John is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase general store provisions.

loans.name: Babunga's Group

texts.fr:
Mangaza K. est présidente du groupe de crédit  Baraka-Alanine, elle lève sa main sur la photo,devant le portail rouge,  cliente au 16e cycle, âgée de 36 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants parmi lesquels 4 étudient, 2 autres enfants n’étudient pas car ils n’ont pas encore l’âge scolaire. Son mari est petit commerçant des Planches (bois).
Mangaza K. s’entraide avec son mari dans le business de vente des planches. Elle  a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Son capital initial était de 50$ . Son business est de vendre les planches au long de la route Katindo, point d’arrêt  Afia bora. Il y a 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente des  planches. Avant de  s’installer dans la ville de Goma, Mangaza K. vendait de la bière à Kalehe, village situé dans le sud Kivu, à 180 km près de la ville de Goma. 
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Riziki Chahi souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  50 planches de 250$.
Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de changer  l’activité et faire le commerce général, étant donné que le service public  de l’environnement et conservation de la nature a pris des mesures pénales à la coupe de bois et demande  beaucoup de taxe dans ce secteur pour le décourager à détruire l’environnement. 
Mangaza K. préférait  augmenter auprès de l’IMF Hekima ses epargnes. Elle ambitionne entrer dans le groupe solidaire qui offre plus des avantages opérationnels que la banque communautaire dont elle fait membre. En outre, elle compte  construire confortablement sa maison.
Mangaza K. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. 
Ce groupe Neema est  composé de 18 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Mangaza K. is the president of the loan group Baraka-Alanine. She is the one with her hand raised, in front of the red door. On her 16th loan, she is 36 years old, married and the mother six children, four of whom attend school. The other two children are not old enough to attend school yet. Her husband is a businessman who deals in lumber. Mangaza K. helps her husband in the lumber business. She began her small business with her own money that she received from her husband. Her starting capital was $50. Her business was to sell boards along the Katindo road at Afia Bora. She has been selling lumber for 12 years. Before settling in the town of Goma, Mangaza K. sold beer in Kalehe, a village located in the south of Kivu, 180 km from the town of Goma. With her loan from the IMF Hekima, Riziki Chahi hopes to increase her turnover by buying 50 boards at $250. In the future, she plans to change to general commerce, given the fact that public environmental and conservation services have taken measures to control the cutting of wood and imposed high taxes to discourage destruction of the environment. Mangaza K. prefers to increase her savings through the IMF Hekima. Her ambition is to join the group which offers more operational advantages than the community bank of which she is a member. In addition, she hopes to do some work to her house to make it more comfortable. Mangaza K. thanks the IMF Hekima for the loans she had received without any material backing because, thanks to these loans, she is able to meet the needs of her children. The group Neema has 18 members, most of whom are women.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 50 boards

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mlieta

texts.pt:
Melita Mereleco nasceu no Distrito de Xai xai, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 44 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 5 filhos de 16, 14, 12, 10 e 5 anos de idade, todos vão a escola excepto o mais novo vai a creche. Fez 9ą classe na Republica da África do Sul, não continuou porque contraiu o matrimónio. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem de seus filhos.
Saiu de Xai xai para Maputo, depois para a Republica Sul-africana a procura de melhores condições de vida. Mais tarde regressa a Maputo em Moçambique depois de perder o seu marido a 6 anos, altura em que iniciou seu negócio. Não possui nenhum empregado mas os filhos têm ajudado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.200.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e de vez enquanto poupa algum na sua conta Bancária.
Ja teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito Procredito e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, cervejas, vinhos e outros) para aumentar a sua mercadoria e responder a demanda da sua clientela.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para condicionar um estabelecimento comercial próprio e melhorado.
texts.en:
Melita Mereleco was born in the district of Xai Xai, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is 44 years old, widowed, and the mother of 5 children ages 16, 14, 12, 10, and 5. All attend school except for the youngest, who goes to daycare. She attended school through the 9th grade in the Republic of South Africa, but did not finish because she got married. She lives in her own home with her children and does not support anyone else. She left Xai Xai for Maputo and later for South Africa in search of better living conditions. She later returned to Maputo in Mozambique after losing her husband 6 years ago, which is when she started her business. She does not have any employees, but her children help out and she earns around 5.200.00 Mt per month, which she uses for household expenses, and she is sometimes able to save a bit in her bank account. He has had loans in the past in the credit cooperative Procredito but she deicded not to continue with them. She learned about Hluvuku through a fried who is also a Hluvuku customer. This is her first loan, in the amount of 15.000.00 Mt which she plans to use to purchase products (soft drinks, beer, wine, etc.) to increase her inventory and meet customer demand. She promises to pay back the loan on schedule so that she has access to other. In the future she plans to request more loans to set up her own, better, shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of products (soft drinks, beer, wine, etc. )

loans.name: Molly Adrine

texts.en:
Secondhand clothes are in high favor with many people in Uganda. Not one to be left out of this lucrative opportunity which had presented itself in her home area of Nyakacwamba, Rukungiri, is A. Molly Adrine, an enterprising and lively 30-year-old woman, who made a decision to capitalize on it.

With the money Molly had saved working in a local market, she bought her first consignment bales of secondhand clothes. With these, she took root and, though her business has had its fair share of ups and downs, she has emerged as a resilient woman who has refused to buckle under any sort of pressure. With this kind of spirit, she has made enormous headway as manifested in the 300,000 Ugandan shillings she makes monthly.

Molly is a lady who likes taking the long view and, as such, she has drawn up a plan to expand her secondhand clothes selling business into a wholesale franchise. With this loan she is optimistic she will be empowered financially to see her dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used-clothes for her business

loans.name: Silva

texts.pt:
Silva Ernesto C. nasceu no Distrito de Chokwe, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 35 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 14, 10 e 05 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Chokwe para Maputo no Distrito de Boane ainda muito jovem, tendo estudado e crescer nesta zona, onde vive actualmente. Trabalha na empresa de segurança G4S ha mais de 6 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 4.375.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 23.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (loiça sanitária, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 9.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com a melhoria da sua casa e abrir um salão de cabeleireiro como forma de aumentar a receita familiar.
texts.en:
Silva Ernesto C. was born in the district of Chokwe, Gaza Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children ages 14, 10 and 5. All attend school. He attended school through the 12th grade but did not continue due to a lack of financial resources. He lives in his own home with his family, and supports his parents who live with him. He left Chokwe for the Boane district of Maputo when he was still very young. He attended school and grew up there, and still lives in this area. He has worked for the security company G4S for more than 6 years. He does not have any employees and receives a salary of 4.375.00 mt per month, which he uses for household expenses and saves a bit in his bank account. He has never had loans in other banks. He learned about Hluvuku thorugh work colleagues who are also Hluvuku customers. This is his third loan, in the amount of 23.000.00mt which he will use to purchase construction material (porcelain bath fixtures, cement, etc.) to continue building his home. The prior loans were for 9.000.00mt and 13.000.00mt for the same purpose. He promises to pay this loan as agreed in order to have access to others. In the future he plans to request more loans to continue his home improvements and to open a hair salon as a way to increase his family's income.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construciton materials (poreclain bath fixtures, cement, etc. )

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Laura Jose

texts.pt:
Laura José N. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 37 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos de 14, 10 e 04 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Licenciou na Universidade Pedagógica, ainda pretende dar continuidade com os seus estudos. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo com seus pais ainda muito jovem, tendo começado a trabalhar e iniciou com a construção da sua própria residência. Trabalha como docente na escola primária completa 1 de Junho ha mais de 15 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 11.430.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta Bancária (Barclays).
Ja teve empréstimos no Banco comercial “Millenium Bim” e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, areia, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e abrir uma creche para servir a crianças e aumentar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Laura José N. was born in the district of Manjacaze, Gaza Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 37 years old, single, and has 3 children ages 14, 10 and 4. The two older children attend school. She has a degree from the Teachers University and would like to continue her studies. She lives in her own home with her children and she supports two brothers who live with her. She left Manjacaze for Maputo with her parents when she was very young. She started working and began building her own home. She has worked as a teacher in the 1 de Junho elementary school for more than 15 years and is part of the Ministry of Education. She does not have any employees, and her salary is 11.430.00mt per month, which she uses for her household expenses and saves a bit sometimes in her Barclays Bank account. She has taken out loans with the commercial bank "Millenium Bim" and decided not to continue. She learned about Hluvuku through work colleagues who are also Hluvuku customers. This is her first loan, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she plans to use to purchase construction materials (concrete block, sand, iron, etc.) to continue the construction of her home. She promises to pay the loan as agreed to have access to other loans. In the future she plans to ask for additional loans to finish her home and to open a daycare for infants and increase her family income.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construciton materials (concrete block, sand, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. is a widow and has four children. She has no formal educational background. Efua fries fish as well as smoking them for sale at Abura. The smoked fish is often distributed to her customers in large quantity. After the customers have come for their consignment, she stays back home to sell the fried fish. 

Efua uses her income in paying school fees and utility bills. Efua will use the loan to purchase extra fish to smoke and to fry for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase extra fish to smoke and to fry for sale

loans.name: Flora Antonio

texts.pt:
Flora António Jaiela nasceu no Distrito de Manhiça, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 42 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos de 18, 15, 15 (gémeos) e 08 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez o nível superior, Licenciou na Universidade Pedagógica. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta seus irmãos e mãe enviando algum valor monetário e produtos alimentares.
Saiu de Manhiça para o Distrito de Boane através de transferência dos serviços. Trabalha como docente ha mais de 18 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 8.102.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tinta, areia, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a melhoria da sua residência.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e um dos sonhos dela é adquirir uma viatura para transporte pessoal.
texts.en:
Flora António Jaiela was born in the district of Manhiça, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 42 years old, and a single mother of 4 children ages 18, 15, 15, (twins) and 8. All attend school. She completed higher level studies and has a degree from the Teachers College. She lives in her own home with her children and also supports her siblings and mother by sending them money and food. She left Manhiça for the district of Boane through a work transfer. She has worked as a teacher for more than 18 years and is part of the Ministry of Education. She does not have any employees and she has a salary of 8.102.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and she saves a bit in her bank account. She has never had a loan with other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers. This is her second loan, in the amount of 20.000.00mt which she will use to purchase construction materials (paint, sand, cement, etc.) to continue making improvements to her home. She promises to pay this loan as agreed in order to have access to others. In the future she plans to request additional loans to complete her home and one of her dreams is to buy a car for personal transportation.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construction materials (paint, sand, cement, etc. )

loans.name: Padmini

texts.en:
Padmini is a 45-year-old married woman living in Hikkaduwa, Galle, with her son and husband. Padmini and her husband  have been managing a business together, which consists of cultivating vegetables. They devote their full effort towards cultivating their vegetable farm.  They use the income to help support the family and their son's necessities. Padmini has managed her business for five years now.  The weather in her area is particularly good for vegetable cultivation.  

Padmini has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to pay labor costs and to purchase seed, and chemicals to promote the fertility of her vegetable farm.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and seed for farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama T. prepares 'Fante kenkey' (a staple maize dish) for sale and distribution at Abura.  Ama has received junior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband works in a soap-making factory. 

Ama has been selling 'Fante kenkey' for some time now. She helps her husband in taking good care of themselves and the children. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare 'kenkey' for distribution. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save if possible to operate a 'kenkey' factory where she would produce and distribute to customers.

loans.use: buy more maize to prepare 'kenkey'

loans.name: Wenday

texts.en: For over 10 years,Wenday J. has had a table where she displays her goods of palm oil, groundnut oil, fresh pepper, and charcoal. She joined LAPO,SL almost a year ago and has taken out two loans. She is 35 years old, married to a bus driver, and has 4 children. She lives very close to Goderich market, where she sells her goods. Wenday needs this loan of 1,000,000 Leones in order to have more goods for sale, and be able to help her husband take care of the family's needs.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, groundnut oil, fresh pepper, and charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El señor Leoncio E. tiene 38 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Encarnación.
Es propietario de un negocio en el nuevo circuito comercial que se dedica a la venta de productos naturales remedios   elaborados .
Es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a la actividad que realiza ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo  en su micro- Empresa.
 El Destino del crédito fue para realizar compras de mas productos naturales que están saliendo en el mercado(adelgasantes y energisantes).

.
texts.en:
Leoncio E., 38, lives in the city of Encarnación. He has a store in the new shopping circuit where he sells natural remedies. He is a very hard-working person and thanks to the work he does he has been able to get ahead and have his micro business grow. He will use the requested funds to buy more natural products that are coming into the market (weight loss and energy). .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural remedies.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya is married with one adult son. She sells women's clothing at a small open market in Novaya Kahovka town. Natalya has been in this business for 20 years. She started it at the time of high unemployment. During all these years, the business has been a stable source of income for her family. Natalya enjoys her business. She’s got many repeated clients that buy from her. Natalya would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase the assortment.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu F. is 45 years old, married, and lives in Fourbay road. She has 5 children and they are all in school. She sells garri, flour, sugar and groundnut oil in Funkia market. After school the children go to the market to help her with her sales. Her husband owns a motor garage and brings financial support to the family. Kadiatu is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 Leones to buy more garri, flour, sugar and groundnut oil to increase her business and also see to the growth of her family.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy garri, flour, sugar and groundnut oil for sale.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.pt:
Marieta S. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 39 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos de 18, 16, 12, 11 e 02 anos de idade, todos vão a escola excepto o mais novo. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a guerra de desestabilização que no momento afectou as escolas onde devia continuar. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua irmã que vive em casa dos falecidos pais delas, enviando algum valor monetário e produtos alimentares.
Nunca saiu de Boane, apenas mudou da residência dos pais para a sua própria. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 23 anos, possui 2 empregados que lhe auxiliam nos seus trabalhos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda do salário do marido que trabalha no Ministério do Interior, consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, ferro, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a melhoria da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.000.00mt e 16.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e também construir um estabelecimento comercial condigno.
texts.en:
Marieta S. was born in the district of Boane, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 39 years old, married, and mother of 5 children ages 18, 16, 12, 11, and 2. All attend school except for the youngest. She only attended school through the 6th grade but did not continue due to the civil war which at that time affected the schools that she would have attended. She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her sister who lives in their late parents' home by sending her money and food. She has never lived outside of Boane, she has only moved from her parents' home to her own. She has had her own business for more than 23 years. She has 2 employees who help her and she earns around 9.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses. With the help of her husband's salary, an employee of the Ministry of the Interior, she is able to save a bit in her bank account. She has never had loans in other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also customers. This is her third loan, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, iron, iron bars, etc.) to continue making improvements to her home. The prior loans were for 7.000.00mt and 16.000.00mt for the same purpose. She promises to pay the loan as agreed to have access to others. In the future she plans to request additional loans to finish her home and to also construct a nice shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, iron, iron bars, etc. )

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
Abie S. is 42 years old and divorced. She lives with her 3 children in Goderich, Sierra Leone. Her children are two boys and a girl, and they are currently in primary school.

Abie is a client of a LAPO, SL credit group. She has been in business for 2 years, and has taken out 3 loans since joining LAPO, SL 2 years ago. She sells used clothes. With her last loan she bought a bale for sale.

This time she is seeking a loan of 3 million Leones to invest in her business. She hopes to get more profits that will change her life and that of her children.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Osvaldo Elias

texts.pt:
Osvaldo Elias M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 22 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 5 e 1 anos de idade, ainda não vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou porque não conseguiu ingressar a Universidade. Vive na casa dos pais com a sua família e sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele.
Nunca saiu de Boane, cresceu e estudou sempre neste Distrito. Trabalha na empresa de construção de estradas e pontes, ECMEP ha mais de 4 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 4.300.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 21.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, ferro, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.200.00mt, 3.200.00mt, 13.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt para a Habitação e bens de consumo.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e iniciar uma actividade comercial para aumentar a renda.
texts.en:
Osvaldo Elias M. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is 22, married, and father to two children aged 5 and 1, who do not yet go to school. Osvaldo finished twefth grade but did not continue because he was not accepted to University. He lives in his parents' house with his family and also supports his parents, who live with him. He never left Boane; he grew up and studied always in this District. For more than four years he has worked for ECMEP, a road and bridge construction company. He has no employees and has a monthly salary of 4,300 meticais. He uses the money for household expenses and still manages to save some in his bank account. Osvaldo has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers at this institution. This loan for 21,000 meticais is his fifth. He plans to buy construction material (sand, cement, iron, beams and other items) to continue construction on his house. The earlier loans were for 7,200 meticais, 3,200 meticais, 13,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais. They were used for the house and consumer goods. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he can maintain his credit. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to finish his house and begin a commercial activity to increase his income.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (sand, cement, iron, beams and other products)

loans.name: Kumari

texts.en:
Kumari is a 30-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, a town in the Matara district of Sri Lanka. She has one child and her husband is currently abroad. Kumari has managed a business sewing clothes for six months. She is a hard-working woman.

She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business and purchase cloth. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and garri (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Marthaline S. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God’s Blessing. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children who range from 8 to 22 years old. Marthaline was only able to attend school through 5th grade.

For 8 years, Marthaline has been selling fish at the Red Light Market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She says that she provides her customers with good quality fish, which keeps them coming to her for business.

Marthaline plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more fish.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marthaline is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish.

loans.name: Jeremias Pedro

texts.pt:
Jeremias Pedro B. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 20, 17, 15, 09 e 06 anos de idade, destes os 4 mais novos vão a escola. Fez 7ą classe não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Boane após sua desmobilização no serviço militar em 1987, e vinha a procura de emprego e melhores condições de vida. Trabalha na empresa de segurança ha mais de 11 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 4.817.00mt e 5.000.00mt por mês do seu rendimento do negócio, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (pintos, ração e vitaminas) para fortificar a seu negócio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com o seu negócio e adquirir uma viatura para ajudar no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Jeremias Pedro B. was born in Manjacaze District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. He is 50 years old, married and the father of 5 children, ages 20,17, 15, 9 and 6. The four youngest children go to school. Jeremias finished seventh grade but did not continue because he was drafted into military service. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone other than his children. He left Manjacaze to go to Boane after his discharge from the military in 1987, and he came in search of a job and better living conditions. For more than eleven years he has worked for a security company. He has no employees and earns a salary of 4,817 meticais, plus another 5,000 meticais per month from his own business. He uses this money for household expenses and also manages to save some in his bank account. Jeremias has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 20,000 meticais, which he will use to buy chicks, feed and vitamins to improve his business. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he may take out other loans. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to continue with his business and to buy a vehicle to help with his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chicken raising (chicks, feed and vitamins)

loans.name: Salam

texts.en: Salam is a 61 year old married man with one child. Salam has been a businessman for many years. In 2005, he decided to open his general shop where he sells different kinds of products such as soaps, light bulbs, sanitary products, and so on. This business is profitable in his region and that is why Salam chose it as his principal work. Today, for the first time, he is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Al Majmoua in order to expand his business through purchasing more products. With this expansion, Salam will be able to expand his stock and answer his clients’ demands. Salam’s target is to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more products.

loans.name: Balu

texts.en: This is Balu S., she is 36 years old, and married with two children. One of her children is in college and the other is in primary school. Her husband is a pastor who supports the family financially. Balu has a provision store where she sells drinks, biscuits, palm oil, groundnut oil, sweets, milk and many other good things for human consumption. She has taken two previous loans from LAPO,SL which she used for the expansion of her store and now seeks a loan of 2,000,000 Leones to enable her to fill her store.

loans.use: To buy provisions for sale.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a faithful and hard-working businessman who sells groceries to his customers. He is a 20 year old single man. He spends most of his time taking care of his work. He trades in groceries like candies, mineral water, toiletries, canned food, biscuits, beverages (juices and soft drinks) and so on. He has operated the shop for the past 2 years, but when he was younger, since he took after his father, he used to help him. Therefore, he gained lots of experience and knows how to please his clients, which makes him successful in his groceries sales. He plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of groceries to serve his customers. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of groceries.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two adult children. She owns a small business selling clothing at the central market in Berdyansk town. She has been in this business for five years and has always offered high quality products and good customer service. Today Ludmila has many repeat customers and a stable business. Her active life and position encourages her business neighbors and friends. 

Ludmila would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase sales and boost her income.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Venancio Alberto

texts.pt:
Venâncio Alberto J. nasceu no Distrito de Mocuba, Província de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique, tem 25 anos de idade, casado e não tem nenhum filho. Frequenta a Universidade Pedagógica a realizar o curso de licenciatura em gestão ambiental. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta seu irmão enviando dinheiro par despesas escolares.
Saiu de Mocuba para Boane para continuar com seus estudos no Instituto Agrário de Boane durante 4 anos. Trabalha como docente na escola secundaria ha mais de 3 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação, possui um negócio próprio e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.130.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do seu salário consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (frangos para revenda) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no seu negócio e tem como sonho terminar a sua licenciatura.
texts.en:
Venâncio Alberto J. was born in the district of Mocuba, Zambézia province, in central Mozambique. He is 25 years old, married, and does not have any children. He attends the Teachers' University where he is studying for a degree in Environmental Management. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his brother by sending him money for school expenses. He left Mocuba for Boane in order to continue with his studies at the Boane Agrarian Institute, where he was for 4 years. He has worked as a secondary school instructor for more than 3 years, and is on the Ministry of Education staff. He has his own business and earns about 10,130 MZN each month, which he uses to pay for household expenses. With help from his teaching salary, he is able to save some money in his bank account. He has never had loans with other banks. He found out about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his 2nd loan, which has a value of 17,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy chickens to resell in order to increase his business's stock. The previous loan had a value of 10,000 MZN, for the same purpose. He promises to pay off the loan on time in order to have access to others. In the future, he would like to request more loans to use for his business needs. His dream is to finish his degree.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell chickens

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama C. is 39 year old and married. She lives in Goderich, Sierra Leone. Her husband is a nurse and her eldest three children are in secondary school while the youngest is in primary school. Maraima sells rice, sugar and palm oil. She has taken out two previous loans from LAPO, SL which allowed her to make enough profit and support her family. Maraima is seeking a loan of 2 million Leones to enable her to get a bigger place to sell her goods and also invest in her business to increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and palm oil

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 22 years old and engaged to be married. He works as a master mason and builder. There is a lot of competition in this type of business, but he is known for being a hard worker and for his quality work. More importantly, he knows how to satisfy his clients’ demands. With this loan, Mohamad will replace his work tools and be able to offer better service and, as a consequence, gain a larger clientele. This is his second loan from our institution. He has shown good compliance in paying off his previous loan. He plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase new tools.

loans.name: Pedro Alberto

texts.pt:
Pedro Alberto M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 47 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 15, 08 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta 1 sobrinho que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu da província de Maputo, actualmente encontra se a residir no bairro da Machava. Trabalha como docente, é do quadro do Ministério da Educação ha mais de 29 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 5.999.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar cerca de 800.00mt na sua conta Bancária.
Ja teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito Tchuma, mais tarde não continuou. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, varões de ferro, mão de obra  e outros) para concluir com a construção da sua residência.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para a construção do murro de vedação e sanitários.
texts.en:
Pedro Alberto M. was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique. He is 47 years old, married, and the father of 3 children who are 15, 8, and 6 years old. All go to school. He only finished 12 grade and did not continue due to a lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and supports one nephew who lives with them. He has never left Maputo province; Pedro Alberto currently resides in the Machava sector. He works as an instructor and has been on the staff of the Ministry of Education for more than 29 years. He does not have any employees and earns a salary of 5,999 MZN each month, which he uses to pay for household expenses. He even manages to save about 800 MZN in his bank account. Pedro Alberto has had loans with the Tchuma credit cooperative, but did not continue with them later on. He found out about Hluvuku through co-workers who are also clients of this institution. This is his 1st loan [with Hluvuku], which has a value of 17,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy construction material (cement, iron rods, etc.) and to pay for labor in order to finish building his home. He promises to pay off the loan on time so he will be able to have access to others. In the future, he intends to request more loans to build a protection wall and bathrooms.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, iron rods, etc.) and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
In October 2008, Marie S. joined LAPO, SL to improve her life and that of her family financially. She is 28 years old, married with 4 children, and the children are all schooling. Her husband is a teacher in one of the government school in Sierra Leone and he supports his family with his salary.

Marie sells palm oil by the gallon very close to Funkia market in Goderich where she lives. She is requesting 3,000,000 Leones which she wants to invest in the palm oil business. This is the fourth loan she has taken from LAPO, SL. Marie plans to use the income generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has owned a barbershop in his town since 1998. He is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children who still go to school. 

Ali works hard in order to cover his family’s expenses, as well as to provide the best for them. In order to do so, he sometimes works overtime to earn more profit to satisfy their needs, such as schooling, hospitality, family expenses, etc. Today, for the second time, Ali has requested a loan and wishes to improve the decor and purchase a new seat for his shop. His previous loan allowed him to improve his workplace and attract more clients. 

When he first opened his barber shop, Ali had difficulty finding the proper place to open it, but he was confident that his will and his experience would make him succeed in his work.

loans.use: To improve the decor and purchase a new seat for his shop

loans.name: Dilini

texts.en:
Dilini is a  24-year-old married woman living with her husband and daughter in the town of Kekanadura in southern Sri Lanka. Her husband is a businessman, and Dilini manages a food production business, making food and selling it to local shops.  She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help expand her business. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to help expand the food production business

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih has owned an auto repair and body shop in his village since 2002, and he has been involved in this occupation for the past 10 years. He's 30 years old, married, and has two children. He has many customers because of his good service and stable operations. His business is well-known in his area. 

Rabih does not store large numbers of spare parts. Therefore, he has been planning to purchase a large number of spare car parts to provide a more convenient service to his customers. Rabih has been a micro-credit client for the past five years. He has always repaid his previous loans on time which allows him to continually improve his work by either purchasing new and more sophisticated tools, or by purchasing spare parts. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his work, as well as his financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en: Baby T. is the mother of six children, four boys and two girls. She is 43 years old and married to a fisherman. She sells fresh fish by the seaside very close to Funkia market.
