Since she joined October 2008, she has built herself a very good profile with LAPOSL where she has taken out three previous loans, paid her children's school fees, and also fed her family with her profit. Baby needs a new loan of 3,000,000 Leones to enable her to add palm oil and bags of onions to her business because there is scarcity of fish during this period.

loans.use: This loan will be use to purchase palm oil and onions for sale.

loans.name: Mayteh

texts.en: Mayteh, 50, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married and has four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own olive oil production. Today, Mayteh has requested her second loan in order to purchase raw materials for her business and change the décor of her home with the income. She reimbursed her previous loan on time. Her previous loan allowed her to produce more olive oil and increase her family’s income. Her family depends on her income because it is additional revenue for them.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for olive oil production.

loans.name: Success Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh S. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Success Group.  She is 46 years old, married, and has three children who are 17, 20, and 30 years old. Kebbeh was only able to attend school through 6th grade.

For 17 years, Kebbeh has been selling pepper and vegetables at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, which is near Monrovia. She says she sells her goods in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning. One of the challenges she faces is that there are many competitors in the market.
Kebbeh plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 61,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more pepper and vegetables to sell. Her goal is to improve the quality of her children’s lives.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kebbeh is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase pepper and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Abed El Latif

texts.en:
Abed El Latif is a 22 year old single man. He works on a freelance basis as a home painter. He learned the business at the age of 18 at a previous job. He works hard to satisfy the demands of his job, in order to pay his daily expenses and provide a better living for his family. Due to his good work, and because he is a hard-working man, he has gained lots of clients and enlarged his network.

This is the first time that he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint and tools for his work. He hopes that this loan will allow him to purchase new and better tools to improve his work.

loans.use: To purchase paint and tools for his work.

loans.name: Kimutai

texts.en:
Kimutai M. is a 26-year-old farmer near Litein town in the South Rift Valley of Kenya. He's been farming for five years and sells milk through the Kenya Cooperative Creameries. He also earns an income from the small-scale farming of maize. He says that the main challenges to his business are poor milk marketing and the high cost of transport.

Kimutai requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this will help his family's overall income. In the future, he would like to process his own milk to sell at the local market, purchase more quality dairy cows, and buy more land for farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 31-year-old man who lives with his wife and their two children. Mouhamad has been a home and furniture painter since 2001. He is someone who likes art and offers a big variety of paintings from all different genres.

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint and tools for his work, as well as pay for his home construction. He is building a new house for his family. This is his second cycle. He repaid his previous loan on time. His previous loan allowed him to improve his work and therefore his income.

His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of clients because he wasn’t known by the public, but he knew how to enlarge his network.

loans.use: To purchase paint and tools for his work.

loans.name: Prima Esther

texts.es:
La señora Prima D. tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y tiene hijos ya independientes económicamente, es comerciante y vive en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio San Isidro Etapa I de la ciudad de Encarnación.

La señora Prima es propietaria de una Despensa bien surtida que esta en la Feria Municipal La Placita, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años y le ha ido muy bien ya que posee muchos clientes que le conocen y que diariamente se acercan a comprar sus productos. 
Mediante este trabajo ella siempre ha podido solventar los gastos del hogar, mantener a sus hijos, y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar.

Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de mas mercaderías para la su despensa, tales como: harina de maíz, almidón, queso, leche, huevos y otros.
texts.en:
Señora Prima D. is 42 years old, she is separated from her husband and her children are already economically independent. She is store owner and lives in her own house which is situated in the neighborhood, San Isidro Etapa in the city of Encarnación. Prima is the owner of a store that is well located, it is in the municipal fair La Placita. She has worked in this job for many years and has done very well, she has many clients that come daily to buy her products. Through this work she has always been able to cover the expenses of the house, to raise her children and to cover whatever has unexpectedly presented itself. She is seeking this loan to buy more merchandise for her store, things like: corn flour, starch, cheese, milk, eggs and others.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store, things like: corn flour, starch, cheese, milk, eggs and others.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Macanhan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Evelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a clothing business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying shirts, dresses, and other ready-to-wear clothes from the city and peddling it to the local community members in their village. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as her additional working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

location.town: Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nelly Margarita

texts.es:
Nelly Q. de 39 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil (lugar muy humilde con lomas y caminos de tierra) de Guayaquil. Su casa es de cemento, actualmente esta separada de su esposo con el tiene tres hijos de 23, 15 y 7 años de edad. 

Por la falta de oportunidades y la idea de tener su propio negocio Nelly tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en mariscos, carnes  y en un puesto pequeño en el mercado de la “florida” de Guayaquil, poco a poco ha venido trabajando hay para mantener su hogar. Vende camarones, pescados, conchas, carnes en su puesto. 

Algunas veces se siente cansada porque se tiene que levantar en la madrugada a comprar los mariscos y carnes para poder vender en su negocio. Con el préstamo quiere comprar camarones, pescados, chanchos para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener su propio local para ya no tener que ir hasta el mercado ha vender las carnes y mariscos.
texts.en:
Nelly Q., 39, lives in a periurban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a low-income, hilly area with unpaved streets). Her house is cement. She’s separated from her husband and has three children who are 23, 15 and 7 years of age. Because of the lack of employment options and wanting to have her own business, Nelly invested her savings in seafood and meats and in a small stand in Guayaquil’s “Florida” market. She has been working there to support her family; she sells shrimp, fish, conch and meats in her stall. Occasionally she feels tired because she must get up at daybreak to go buy the seafood and meats to sell in her stall. She will use the requested funds to buy shrimp, fish and pigs for her business. In the future she wants to have her own location so that she won’t have to go all the way to the market to sell the meat and seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shrimp, fish, pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Transformation of cassava into cassava flour, which is then sold

loans.name: God Is In Control Group

texts.en:
Rose C. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Is In Control. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children who range from 5 to 10 years old. Rose was only able to attend school through junior high due to a lack of support.

For five years, Rose has been selling provisional goods such as sugar, candles, batteries, milk, and tea at the Duport Road Market, which is near Monrovia, Liberia. She says that she talks to her customers in a friendly manner and meets their demands, which keeps customers returning.

Rose plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more provisional goods for her shop. Her dream is to expand her business and return home to Nigeria one day.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Rose is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase addtional provisional goods such as sugar, candles, batteries, milk, and tea  for her shop.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn S. is from the village of Orozena, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old. Roselyn is married and has three preschool-aged children. To make a living, Roselyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community through peddling. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Roselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Roselyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Orozena, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta
